38377044.review:
Crawl is a really good asymmetrical multiplayer game. Probably one of the best concepts for a game in recent memory, and the execution is generally quite good. The combat & level interactions are a bit janky but it's certainly not terrible, just not as good as it could be. The most fun is in sabotaging your friend as often as possible. I only played with one friend and two bots but I feel like it would shine with 4 players as it's more of a chaotic mess of fighting for the lead. 

I'm not the biggest fan of how the game is so focused on levelling up monsters but then the actual endgame is just a pre-determined boss that has no bearing on anything the dead have achieved while not being the human player. But in general, Crawl is a great game with lots of tense battles for power that make it fun with a friend. I don't think single player has much appeal tbh but there is a decent amount of unlockables which is cool. I wish there was more games like this, would be even better with working online play. I definitely plan to give Crawl another chance, hopefully with a full crowd. Still an easy recommendation.

38118049.review:
Oh man. Where do I begin with this game? There's so much done right about this game that it's very quickly becoming one of my favourite rougelikes. Let's just dive right into the dungeon and start chopping off the pros and cons of this insanely unique and fast-paced competitive Gauntlet-inspired roguelike.

Pros:

+Fast paced couch competition. The game is super quick to pick up and just as wasy to learn, utilizing only the movement directions and two buttons.
+Most unique idea for a rogulike in a long time. The fact that AI or other friends control your ENTIRE JOURNEY is so fresh and innovative that I honestly can't think of a game to compare it to.
+Amazing art direction and fluent animation. You can tell there was so much heart and soul poured into this game, I completely understand it taking 4 years of hard work and devotion to reach what we see today.
+Brilliant soundtrack.
+Unfair. Why is that a good thing? Because this game *prides* itself on being unfair in one way or another. It feels so amazing to be the big, bad monster that tears through the Hero or vice versa, and when you manage to wittle down or kill as like, a tiny fish while everyone else are hulking behemoths, everyone goes freaking bananas. It's such a fun concept, even when you're losing.
+Cheap pricetag, sitting at only $15.
+Amazing two "bonus" bosses which can be found and posessed by any player.


All that said, this is not a perfect game. It's close, and I've definitely got to mark it down as my favourite roguelike yet, but let's get into the downsides of this passion project.

Cons:

-Lacks diversity. This is the game's biggest downfall. There's only one type of floor design, three total bosses, and the monsters themselves become a tad bit repetitive once you've been around the block. Don't get me wrong, it's still a good start, but I'd absolutely LOVE to see more variation in the future such as an ice temple or lava corridor in the later floors.
-Little to no way to make the Hero actually do stuff; i.e, you can't stop them from stalling at all. If you're friends with some real dickbags, they can decide to troll you by finding a safe spot while being the Hero and just not do anything. The only area this really applies is the Shops due to slimes and ectoplasm, but it can still be an issue.
-No online multiplayer.
-Slimes have so much untapped potential. 
-Lackluster AI. It's either too easy and brainless or too ridiculously difficult. No inbetween.


All those things said, all-in-all I'd have to give this game a 9.5/10. Powerhoof spent YEARS working on this amazing game, and it truly shows. It's a wonderful title and I would heavily reccomend getting it if you have friends to play it with.

38026014.review:
I've only played this game a few times with friends, but I've found the spirit and idea of this game wonderfully fun!  Its execution is generally very solid, though I will quibble a bit and say there's a distinct lack of visual contrast between specters and background.  This is especially true in a busy, high-action room, and it is additionally true in cases when jumping as a specter between different traps or world items.  The aiming also takes a bit to get used to, since most items only allow you to aim on the cardinal directions (N/S/E/W), and the delay between possession of a trap, engagement of it, and the actual doing/shooting of whatever it does/shoots I've found hard to nail down.

This game, like so many games that rely on precision timing, plays much better locally than it does streamed through a Steam Link or other machine - the added network and transcode latency makes controlls noticably more sluggish than when playing locally with a locally attached controller or kb/mouse.

OVerall, a very cool, fun romp.  The OST's awesome, and the voice work of the narrator is on-point.  It's a bit rough around the edges as noted, but I feel like those are fairly minor points compared to its success as a high-action local coop PVP dungeon crawler (basically). :)

38021327.review:
tl;dr A fun co-op game for you and up to three other friends (or the AI, but that's not as fun).

Pretty fun and hectic local co-op game. Key word being local - make sure you have friends to play with. Each playthrough centers around trying to stop whichever boss/Elder God is about to be resurrected. There are three different bosses. You get three attempts per boss - if the Hero fails, it's game over and the God is summoned for the end of the world. Matches are short, 30-60 minutes. You level up both are the Hero and the monster-summoning Wraiths. Each player levels up the monsters they can summon once the Hero reaches the floor exit staircase (which also heals everyone). Once someone reaches level 10, they have to get to the Boss Portal while the Wraiths try to kill him with traps and monsters that they can summon/possess. Once you get to the Boss, the Wraiths possess parts of the boss and try to kill the Hero. 

Each successful playthrough unlocks new monsters, weapons, deities to worship (affects stats and which monsters you can summon/upgrade), etc. Wraiths can collect ectoplasm to summon low-level slimes. The Hero has to kill all enemies to escape the room he's in.

Game looks gorgeous. Haven't encountered any technical problems so far. I wonder if the devs plan to implement online play, because local-only really limits the potential. Maybe Hamachi/Tunngle/some other virtual LAN program will work, but latency is probably the concern the devs had since you have to immediately start moving once you resurrect as the Hero or turn into a Wraith.

37883286.review:
Crawl is an extremely fun and addicting dungeon CRAWLer. You play both with and against your friends (or bots if you don't have any friends), as you struggle to escape the underground. One player will play as a human character, who is able to obtain gold and exp to increase their strength in order to kill the boss, which will result in him winning, through escaping the underground. The other players, play as ghosts, who fight against the human, with traps and monsters, which they get to level up. 
Now the intersesting component is, that the player who kills the human, regains his human form, thus creating a very ambivalent, both co-operative and versus, but mostly overall fun game.

I absolutely love this game and for me it is the perfect combination of a short rpg and a competitive fun local co-op game.

An absolte BLAST to play with freinds in couch co-op. We all play it on the big screen with the Steam link and xbox controllers. My friends are mostly casual console gamers and whenever they come over everyone alway's wants to play CRAWL! Tight controlls, amazing gameplay and ideas, good amount of unlockables, just perfect really. People who suck at it still get to have fun as the monsters and controlling the boss. 37661471.review:
CRAWL is dripping in style, and has all the substance you can ask for.

Having followed this game from early access I cam confidently state that with all the additions and tweaks that the game has received over time. It hasn't lost one drop of the forbidden elixir that makes it so intense. The AI is challenging, the procedurally generated levels are unpredictable and the 'loot' (shop bought items) make you feel powerful without being invincible.

No game is perfect but the flaw in crawl is one that makes it all the more appealing to me. When you play crawl on your own it's good. But when you play with friends one of two things will happen.

1. You will ha e an epic time and never want to play without your friends (which your friends will insist, lest you gain knowledge/skill advantage)

2. You're friends don't get it and you crush them over and over. Feeling 'badgood' that they won't be blessed by the dark gods and knowing that even though you have enjoyed this so you won't get a chance to play this way often.

Both of these eventualities are a poison chalice. Because they will lessen the amount of play time you get.

Between the mechanics, sound visuals, setting, replauability and all other factors I'd easily give Crawl 9/10. However I will knock this down to an 8/10 as it's mileage may vary dependent on each persons circle of friends.

Crawl manages to come out on top as my favorite local party game. Something that my friends and I struggle with is finding a game everyone has a fair chance in, and with Crawl we've found it. The skill of the player is only half the battle, as the chaos of the arena-maze that is randomly generated whenever you move to a new floor manages to keep whoever's in the lead on their toes, while the endless cycle of cooperation and betrayal keeps the fun, competitive atmosphere alive. This game is at its best when the attitudes of combativeness and cooperation are at their most dynamic; which is usually in every room of the game.
Online is the last step this game needs to become perfect. The random, jump-in and play style is so fitting of the chaotic, makeshift alliance kind of play which is Crawl's heart. As stated, skill is only half the battle, so matchmaking is barely an issue when the one-sidedness of a fight is central to what can make it interesting. 

Great game.

37255521.review:
Crawl is a dungeon crawler for up to four local players, where one player plays as the hero trying to escape, and the other fleshly human people play as ghosts who haunt monsters, traps and pots (yes, really) to try and defeat the hero and take their place. It's fun, frantic and one of the best multiplayer games I've ever played.

First of all, the presentation is unique. It's half glitch-esque, half pixel aesthetic and half lovecraftian horror. The music in this game is foreboding and intense, as well as just being good music, and the monsters all have limbs that contort and move in grotesque ways, which compliment the gameplay well. Speaking of the gameplay... wow.

The gameplay in this game is phenomenal: a classic top-down combat system mixed with RPG elements. To win the game, you must get to level 10 as the hero, and then fight the boss: if you defeat it, the game ends and you are crowned the winner. What makes the gameplay infinitely replayable is the sheer amount of content on display: 40 unique weapons and 62 unique monsters, multiple status effects, tons of room layouts, and 'gods' that you can worship (or taunt) to give you unique ways to play, such as (slight spoilers) [spoiler] extra health, store discounts and starting with different weapons [/spoiler] .

It even surprisingly has a great deal of singleplayer substance. If you're looking for a purely singleplayer game, you won't find it here, but there are unique options like endless hero gauntlets (vault challenges) for every monster in the game, shockingly competent AI and 45 achievements, some of which truly test your gaming prowess in interesting ways.

I really only have two minor complaints: firstly, there are only 3 end-game bosses to fight. They are undoubtedly incredibly well animated and oozing with great game design (in fact, the whole game is), but at least having 1 or 2 more, despite the undertaking, could go a long way. Secondly, the game is local multiplayer only. This is a common complaint, and this post sums up the whole situation better than I ever could: http://steamcommunity.com/app/293780/discussions/0/34095051768030848/ , but once again, this could go a long way, and I understand the absence of it.

Despite all this, Crawl is outstanding. It has a great art style, awesome music and phenomenal gameplay that's so good I'm running out of synonyms for 'good'. If you have the money and a group of friends to play with, you're guaranteed to have a great time.

Hasta el momento solo he jugado la primera partida nada más comenzar a jugar.

Me parece un juego que, de primeras, puede impresionar y desorientar un poco. Sin embargo, cuando avanzas en la primera partida empiezas a entender cómo funciona y descubres que tiene una dinámica interesante.

El juego es un todos contra todos de cuatro jugadores en el que uno es humano y los demás fantasmas. El humano deberá matar a los monstruos invocados por los fantasmas para subir de nivel y poder huir por un portal (a nivel 10), pero los fantasmas ganarán ira y mejoraran con ella a sus monstruos. Cuando un fantasma mata al humano, se convierte en humano y los otros tres tienen que pararle. El humano ganará oro al revisar las estancias y matando a los monstruos y podrá invertirlo en comprar equipo.

Lo que pasa al huir por el portal es mejor verlo que leerlo, así que no hare un spoiler aquí.

Está claro que no es un juego para alguien que busque gráficos impresionantes o unos controles sofisticados. Es un juego para disfrutar de la partida, ya sea con amigos o contra los bots.

Como he indicado al principio del análisis, solo he jugado la primera partida y es un juego que añado a mi lista de pendientes para sacar los logros. A mí me ha gustado y me ha parecido un juego muy bueno que cumple de sobra.

36945026.review:
[h1] [b] Crawl Review [/b] [/h1]

Crawl is unlike many co-op/multiplayer games I have played in the past.
I have been setting up weekly gaming nights for the last few years, and sadly, there aren't many multiplayer games that stay installed on my PC. Most dwindle and become obsolete after a few sessions. But not Crawl.

The game is very simple and approachable. Few buttons are used, and there is really no tutorial needed.
At the very beginning, you choose a deity and watch your pixelated characters drift into madness as you take control and kill your 1 - 3 friends before they murder you. If you survive the slaughter you continue deeper into the dungeon seeking loot, gold, and weapons.
But if one of your unhinged friends murder you at the outset, you now take the form or a floating spirit that is unable to physically attack the living friend. But it does not keep you from harming them in other ways. You are able to accumulate orbs that appear on the screen and possess things in the environment in an attempt to harm and eventually kill the living. Collect enough orbs and you can spawn a small, weak blob that you can possess and attack with. Or, just spawn multiple blobs and watch the chaos from the side lines hoping for the best.
Eventually, the hero will enter a room with inverted pentagrams chiseled into the floor, there you can summon a stronger monster that corresponds with your chosen deity.
As you and your friends proceed deeper into the dungeon, back-stabbing and killing each other all of the way, you gain stronger weapons and monsters. Becoming more efficient, eventually choosing to enter a boss room and face off against your undead friends who possess a pixelated horror that can be quite challenging. Succeed, and you are crowned the winner of Crawl. But lose, and allow your friends to try the boss fight.


[h1] - - - [/h1]


[h1] [b] AUDIO [/b] [/h1]
The soundtrack fits the game perfectly. It works with the graphic scheme and will keep your heart rate elevated as you play.

[h1] [b] VISUALS [/b] [/h1]
The graphics are nostalgic and just plain fun. But if AAA games with next gen graphics are more your speed, you probably won't enjoy this one. It is pretty old-school.

[h1] [b] GAMEPLAY [/b] [/h1]
The combat is tight and responsive. Attacks, evades, and movement all act exactly as you would expect with Keyboards, controllers. I have tested Playstation, XBox 1, and USB SNES controllers and it was a blast with all of them.

[h1] [b] STORY [/b] [/h1]
There really isn't much of a story. Your characters go insane in a monster infested dungeon, they kill all of their companions, and attempt to best the horrors waiting deep inside.

[h1] I highly recommend this game. [/h1]

36881998.review:
This game is serious fun if you can corral at least two other people into your place to play at the same time. Honestly? This game is MADE for playing with players of way different power levels. Casuals can have fun playing with monsters (obviously the coolest part of the game anyway) and the skilled players that lured them into this trap can have fun trying to survive as the player against some truly heinous odds.

The skill differential is going to come in handy when you get to the bosses - the bosses are seriously spammy, so anyone with a modicum of skill can do some SERIOUS damage fairly easily. That means that to win, even if you're overleveled, you had better be a friggin' bullet dodgin' bad-ass. The bosses actually really take away from my enjoyment of the game - they are really hard to beat for a laid back player like myself! Fortunately, this game packs in so much style and gives such intensely fun moments in the "mundane" encounters that, even local only, it's worth the low price of admission. An incredible party game.

36238980.review:
I went into this optimistically, and holy hell was I surprised to have my expectations blown out of the water!

Pros:
- Unique premise for a game. 
- Challenging AI (if playing solo). It's possible to pick the pace of the game by including 1-3 AI players on top of the hero you control.
- Incredible for use as a drinking game (local multiplayer). The game lends itself to unparalleled social/competitive (local multiplayer) gameplay thanks to the (often fast-paced, and frantic) 1v3 chaotic brawling.
- Narration, sound effects, and music are sensational, giving a strong sense of nostalgia. The narration is kooky as hell, and damn it works well.
- Game art feels spot-on. Pixelated graphics aren't everyone's cup of tea, though this game makes it work extremely well.
- Put together perfectly. Every aspect of the game feels as though it was developed with all the other parts of the game in mind. Very polished.

Cons (or lack thereof):
- The game does not (yet) have online multiplayer, however the developers have been very clear in stating that this is one of their primary focuses for addition to the game, moving forward.

Summary:
Do yourself a favour and grab this game. You won't regret it. Get a handful of mates together, and dive in, head first. It takes more than a great game to have me write a Steam review, and this game makes no exception to that rule.

36227708.review:
What I would pay to have a couple of friends that I could play this game with on the couch.

The game is so good, that even playing solo (when it's obviously intended as a multiplayer game) is sooo charming.

It's a free-for-all but slightly asymmetric game that allows the players to essentially choose their own dungeon crawl, by controlling pretty much every meaningful piece of the game other than dungeon generation.

You start just like any other arcade game of the like, 2-4 players (if solo, with CPUs) choose their name and deity. Start by being the hero while the others are the enemies in the dungeon rooms. They act as spirits that can possess the enemies and begin attacking you. Once dead they move on to possess something else to ruin your day.

I was clueless and turned the CPU up on Normal because I thought they were on my team. WRONG. Once your time as the hero has been ended, you take the place of your killer and become the spirit now trying to kill the new hero!

Once the chapters end, you get to use your points to upgrade your enemies to what I'm sure becomes a chaotic end. Eventually boss battles come into play, but who gets to fight it?!

Again, this game is totally playable alone, but you will be VERY aware that you're missing out on a lot of fun by playing with others.

This game is absolutely a must-play, and if they were ever to add online multiplayer... holy shit.

This game would seriously be a PC staple for everyone, it's so fun.

36153007.review:
Crawl es básicamente un hack'n slash enfocado al multijugador local. 

Un jugador es el héroe, mientras que los otros son fantasmas. El jugador que es el héroe debe explorar la mazmorra buscando un portal que lo llevará al jefe final y debe derrotarlo para ganar.

Los fantasmas pueden poseer objetos del mapa o controlar criaturas invocadas. Los fantasmas deben matar al héroe para recobrar su humanidad (lo cual los revive) y así tener la oportunidad de ganar el juego. Los espiritus también pueden ganar si se falla tres veces en derrotar al jefe final, en cuyo caso, el fantasma con más experiencia es el ganador.

Es entretenido como experiencia solo, pero realmente no siento que se presenten nuevas sorpresas en cada partida, prácticamente el objeto es sacar logros (achivements) que consisten en matar cierto número de enemigos, matar jefes, desbloquear nuevos monstruos, etc.

Así que solamente queda recomendarlo si tienes la manera de jugarlo con alguien de manera local, entre más mejor, porque el juego no tiene modo online.

Para más referencia del gameplay y de que va, un video introductorio.
https://youtu.be/No8cyPeOuNA

36118676.review:
Got this on a humble bundle and payed around 25 cents for it. The game itself if very fun and innovative. It is designed with local coop in mind and is probably one of the most intelligent party games I have seen. Players try to escape being a lost soul by being the one who deals the death blow to the current live mortal and then beating the boss in order to escape with a body. Players can buy upgrades with gold and upgrade their monsters with wrath.

Upgrading monsters and unlocking new gods to serve are the most fun aspects of crawl. However the gameplay gets tedious fast. With your player and three other ghosts on the screen at the same time all trying to do their own thing, it is VERY easy to lose track of what you can interact with and hard to explore environments. Crawl is too fast paced with players  moving from room to room with little time to properly react.

The controls are simple and not very inntuitive. The developers should have taken advantage of some other available buttons to add much needed variety. Crawl is a very good idea but needs a much bigger developer in order to get to the fantastic potential it has. Crawl should have been designed around an online multiplayer aspect with chat features in order to get the most out of it. If a developer would to take many of the main concepts of Crawl and couple it with online multiplayer then this would be an instant classic party game. As it stands now Crawl will never be much more than it already is, a party game not aimed at casuals with way too much going on at one time while being surprisingly lacking of content.

Great if you can pick it up extreamly cheap or have three or four other dedicated friends to play with, but very overpriced.

35928597.review:
I really shouldn't like this game. BUT I DO! This is one of those rare games that ticks of all my "hate" boxes, but still is so good, that even I as a genre hater enjoy it a lot. 
Crawl is basically an asymmetric retro pixelart 3v1 procedurally generated rogue-lite PvP fast paced dungeon brawler, and I don't like one single word in this description (except dungeon). But Oh my good is it well done. You either are the human, trying to escape from a summoning site by killing what you summoned, or you play one of the 3 dead trying to kill the human so that you can continue as the human.This is done by summoning upgradable monsters, slimes or possessing traps and furniture. It seems unfair at first, but after the tutorial you understand. Playing as human is hectic, chaotic and non stop action fun. Playing as ghost is hectic, less chaotic and almost non stop action fun. They found the balance between having to compete with your fellow ghosts while killing the human and having trouble keeping up as a human.
Great game, big fun, recommendations all around. But 15 bucks??? Really??? (I got it in the humble bundle)

Follow my curator @ http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28337205-Fair-Minded-Witness/?appid=368080

35912891.review:
Crawl is what happens when the madness, frustration, and heart pounding action of the last few seconds of classic couch co-op games is stretched into 20 minutes. The complex tug and pull between monsters and hero is always changing, and with randomized equipment and maps ensures that no player is ever truly out of the race. The game encourages players to be cautious and through by filling rooms with treasure and goodies for the hero, but every second you spend inside is one your opponents have to try and take your life. The boss encounters are unique and challenging, perfect capstones to the intensity of the crawl proper.

Crawl is the sort of game that takes fellow gamers and makes them friends (or enemies.) It's haunting atmosphere and illustrious pixel art support the frantic and tense gameplay. 9/10, absolutely wonderful.

一个撕逼向的游戏，魔性的音乐，痛快的打击感
游戏难度很高，支持四人游玩，开局就是一击必杀来决出活人，而死掉的人则会成为鬼魂，可以控制物品或者进入魔法阵来召唤怪物，目的就是为了杀死活人让自己复活，但这并不是终点，被杀死的活人会变成鬼魂，周而复始。活人可以收集金币到商店购买武器、技能、药水和饰品（新买的物品会代替旧的物品），还可以升级来提升自己的属性。而鬼魂是根据活人击杀自己召唤的怪物的次数用来分配升级怪物的技能点数，怪物也分种族、攻击方式和技能。
游戏中还有boss需要玩家来击杀，但不是必要性的，挑战boss失败会使挑战者生命值变成总生命的五分之一，boss难度很高，我挑战过五次，大部分都是差点就成功了。

游戏最大的缺点就是联机方式，只能通过本地联机，我看二逼的制作组也不准备更新这个了。

35843950.review:
Primero que nada... No esta en español... Como digo siempre: leer o escuchar en otro idioma, solo me estresa mas, independientemente de si conozco dicho idioma o no.

De todas formas, no es muy necesario conocer ingles, pero creo que se necesitas un poco de nivel, ya que el tutorial te explica como funciona el juego. Ademas, tiene voces en ingles (sin subtitulos, ni en ingles), las cuales añaden mas emocion al juego, desafortunadamente, no entiendo ni la mitad de lo que dicen con las voces.

Volviendo a lo que es el juego... Esta muy bien, si bien es cierto que esta hecho para jugarlo con amigos en el mismo PC, SE PUEDE JUGAR A SOLAS PERFECTAMENTE, la IA sabe lo que hace, y hay en algunas partidas me dicho a mi mismo: "espera, pero si estoy jugando con la IA", me sorprendio, ya que son muy humanos... En la mayoria de las cosas... Como experiencia personal: una vez mori, y el que me mato, se fue a por la recompensa de mi cuerpo, pero mi cuerpo estaba fuera del mapa (un fallo del juego) intento ir asta el cuerpo, se pego a la pared intentando rodearla, pero no pudo, y tras intentarlo durante 3 segundos, decidio irse. Puede parecer una tontería, pero la mayoria de IA que conozco, se quedarian pegadas a dicha pared insistiendo constantemente en meterse por la pared asta tal punto que tienes que cerrar el juego.

El juego consta de que eres un aventurero o "Heroe", que esta atrapado en una mazmorra, pero no puedes escapar, estas con tus compañeros y entonces hay una disputa, os matáis los unos a los otros (de instakill) y solo queda uno, asi empieza el juego, basicamente empieza con una rapida escaramuza, el primero en matar a todos y sobrevivir, empieza siendo el protagonista. Los demas heroes estan atrapados como espiritus, ya que incluso en la muerte, no pueden escapar (es mas o menos lo que e conseguido traducir yo mismo de las voces en ingles). La tarea del heroe es sencilla, recorrer una mazmorra generada aleatoriamente, que recuerda a cierto juego... The binding of isaac... tambien se les conoce como "rogue-like", tiene objetos en la tienda que modifican tus acciones en el juego, como tirar tornados, o invocar un escudo que te proteja la espalda, y armas diferentes, como dagas o espadas pesadas. Puedes ver en todo momento la direccion a la que esta la tienda de la mazmorra, el portal y el piso inferior, asi como las habitaciones sin investigar. Como heroe, tienes que alcanzar el nivel 10, entrar al portal y desafiar al jefe, al derrotarlo, conseguiras escapar vivo de la mazmorra, si no... Quedaras perdido para siempre y un horrendo mal se alzara al mundo.

Al empezar varios jugadores en el juego, obviamente no podran ser todos el heroe, asi que al terminar la disputa del principio del juego, donde se matan los jugadores, los unos a otros... Quedaras en fantasma y pensareis... Ser un fantasma tiene que ser un rollo, ¡NO LO ES!, creo que es muy divertido, ademas, es necesario en el juego, ya que los fantasmas son al mismo tiempo, los enemigos de la mazmorra. Cuando empiezas una partida, te dan para seleccionar un grupo de tres monstruos (van como en packs, no puedes elegir monstruos individualmente). Cada vez que el heroe sube de nivel, los fantasmas suben su "IRA" y con eso conviertes a tus monstruos en seres mas poderosos, eso al final de cada planta de la mazmorra. Cada jugador tiene su propia "IRA" y su propio nivel, asi como armas y habilidades que este compre. Ademas de invocar monstruos, los fantasmas pueden poseer objetos y trampas de la mazmorra, pero la camara siempre estara en la sala del heroe y los fantasmas tambien. Es divertidisimo ser fantasma, y ir alternando entre fantasma y heroe me encanta.

Cuando acaba el juego, te dan recomensas, nuevos monstruos, evoluciones de estos, armas, etc... La IA tiene varias dificultades y puedes decidir cuantas IA hay en una partida.

Lo malo obviamente es... Esta en ingles... Jajaja no no no. No me molesta tanto (era broma). Lo realmente malo es que NO puede jugarse ONLINE y este juego ganaría mucho en poder jugarse online.

35843607.review: I'm sure you get the picture by now.  An absolutely amazing game that would be better with online multiplayer.  Going into a bit more detail though, I get enough joy out of this game simply by contemplating the intricately designed mechanics.  Everything in the game is simple to comprehend, yet expertly arranged in order to complement everything else.  For example, just look at the ectoplasm system.  Every time the human breaks scenery, it creates ectoplasm for the ghosts.  Therefore the human wouldn't want to break scenery, except that ghosts can pick up unbroken scenery and throw it at him.  To keep the ghosts in check, scenery doesn't yield ectoplasm when broken by a ghost.  Each part is simple in itself, but combines to create a complex yet fast paced series of checks and balances which combine to leave each aspect of the game feeling neither overpowered nor irrelevant.

35804141.review:
Voici un jeu qui figure en bonne place dans l'univers du multijoueur local !

J'aime ce jeu car il fait varier les plaisirs. Dans la peau du héros, on est en position dominante. On va pouvoir prendre des niveaux, les stats montent, on loote les coffres et on dépense tout au magasin ! Qu'il est bon de se tâter face aux étals, prendre son temps sous l'oeil jaloux des autres joueurs qui bavent sur les items qu'ils ne pourront plus avoir une fois que vous les aurez raflés ! Vu comme ça, le rôle des monstres peut sembler moins joyeux. Sauf qu'en fait, non, car en tant que héros, vous êtes autant à plaindre qu'à envier. Vous êtes en fait une victime. Un martyr.  Un lapidé consentant.

C'est là qu'on se tourne vers les monstres. Eh bien alors ? On fait des misères au petit, là ? Ooh oui !!! Et c'est tellement bon de lui faire vivre un enfer ! Lui faire manger ses dents à 3 contre 1, le harceler avec toutes sortes de pièges, envoyer des hordes de blobs quand il ne reste plus que ça ! Il faut bien ça pour laver l'affront du client indécis au magasin... et puis c'est ainsi qu'on procède pour tenter de se réincarner en héros... Croisons les doigts pour être celui qui lui portera le coup fatal ! Reprendre forme humaine ! Devenir l'élu ! ... et morfler à notre tour. 

Ce jeu a bien évolué depuis ses débuts. J'ai constaté pas mal de mises à jour, des rééquilibrages. Il dispose par ailleurs d'une musique sympa, d'un large choix de monstres pour tenir la lassitude à distance, ainsi que du contenu déblocable. Si je devais lui reprocher quelque chose, ce serait le manque d'indications sur les évolutions des monstres. Au moins une phrase, un mot serait apprécié. Je pense ici aux nouveaux joueurs qui sont désavantagés lorsqu'ils choisissent leur dieu et les monstres car ils n'ont aucun élément pour orienter leur choix. On dira que la surprise fait aussi partie du jeu !

Conclusion : jeu recommandé.

Crawl, c'est le charme de Gauntlet sous acide mélangé à l'odeur démoniaque de D&D vu par les mamans américaines dans les années 80. Sauf que Gauntlet, c'est naze et Crawl c'est génial.
4 personnages s'affontent dans un donjon généré aléatoirement. Leurs âmes se disputent le contrôle d'un unique corps, et chacun cherche à atteindre la rédemption en terrassant un bête légendaire, tapie dans le donjon. Tandis que le joueur contrôlant le corps progresse, les esprits des autres joueurs possèdent le mobilier, des pièges, voire s'incarnent sous forme de monstres de plus en plus puissants, pour géner ou blesser le corps. Celui qui aura finalement sa peau prendra à son tour le contrôle du corps. Tandis que l'opposition devient plus formidable, chaque personnage gagne des niveaux et s'équipe, devenant lui-même plus dangereux, pour finalement être de taille à affronter l'ennemi final.
Conçu comme un jeu multijoueur local, il fonctionne le mieux à 4 devant l'écran, même si des joueurs peuvent être remplacés par des bots qui s'avèrent plutôt coriaces. Il déroule un gameplay riche récompensant le savoir-faire en hack'n'slash  tout en rendant le jeu aussi intéressant que possible pour ceux qui sont moins adroits.
Doté de graphismes rétro-glitch avec des pixels très grossiers, hyper-expressifs, et d'une bande son très léchée, en hommage au jeux d'arcade, la présentation du jeu frise la perfection dans le genre choisi.
Vivement recommandé, le jeu est une grande réussite à posséder absolument, si vous pouvez réunir 4 personne pendant 20-30 minutes devant l'écran.

35558453.review:
PROS:
++Unique game 
++Variety of monsters, traps, and items
+Polished. Works the way it's meant to work.
+Local multiplayer bonanza
+Looks cool

CONS:
-The only gamemodes are the main one which is about a 40ish minute commitment, and a simple singleplayer challenge mode. There's no team mode, no survival mode, no campaign, and no gameplay modifiers.
-No online multiplayer
-No mods
-Yellowish greenish crypt is the only environment/theme
-Confusing. You could call this a + if you like games that feel like hectic chaos.
-Costs 15 USD. Considering how many good games you can get these days for just 5$ or even for free it's not a great value

It's not great; but it's charming and I'd like to see the developers be successful and make more cool stuff.

35504222.review:
This is one of the best games I have played in a long time.

Even though it is intended as a local multiplayer game it is immensely fun as single player as well.

First off the game has vast amounts of content, and by that I mean new monsters, weapons and every other bit that makes up a roguelike kind of genre as you go deeper into the game.

The mechanics of the game are crazy simple. Just two buttons on top of directionals. Even then it feels like you are doing all kinds of crazy stuff because different kinds of weapons have different attack patterns and effects.

The only and tiny tiny downside of this game that I can see is that it only features local co-op. I have to admit though it is more neat this way.

Overall I give this game a 7/10 and I'm only 2-3 hours into it. I can't imagine the fun you can have playing this game with 3 other friends, or even 1...

You know what? On top of everything they managed to sneak in a Lovecraftian undertone to this game and I love it. Make that a 8/10.

35402598.review:
This game is delightful and remains my favorite game on Steam. It's also my favorite party game. I haven't uninstalled it since I bought the game, and it has been months. The gameplay kicks butt and is incredibly fun, the monsters and traps are delightful, and you can clock hours of play on it.  One thing I really appretiated was the very balanced system. The most levels that your opponents get as a human, the stronger your monsters get, as you collect spendable Wrath points from each of their levels. This ensures that, if one player is especially dominating as the human, the weakest player is allowed to catch up by giving them the strongest monster advantage, without weakening the other players.  The most recent add-on of scrolls has also been incredibly good, allowing you to steal items from other players. Items like these ensure that even the strongest players are not 100% safe and means that there is always a chance at redemption. This is a great game!

P.S. Most people complain about there being no online capability. Personally, I prefer gaming on the couch, with friends. This game is also compatible with USB replica SNES and NES controllers, which are great for that classic experience.

35395808.review:
Barrels of fun. Fun on a bun. Bun bun fun fun barrel with friends.


Practice with the bots, and then invite your friends over to crush them until they catch up.

Or spend time analyzing the game to take down your friends strategically:

At the beginning of the game, the human character is far more powerful than the monsters. The monsters have to run, hide, and perform various shenanigans. Without good strategy, the monsters get killed and the human character can get super far ahead at the beginning. But as a direct response to the human character getting ahead, the monsters become stronger. The balance shifts to the reverse; the monsters are now the powerful ones, and the human character now has to be more creative, and inevitably, they will succumb to the gradual loss of health that is the life of a rogue-liker. Now, a less powerful human player takes the wheel, and they will most likely get killed by the most powerful monster (the weakest human player), gradually balancing the game while leaning towards the more skilled players.


There are two things that are wrong with this. One is that there is exactly one strategy that works at a certain given time; you either run and hide, or charge relentlessly, and it has an obvious curve; the less powerful you are, the more sneaky you should be. No other strategy will lead you to success. 

Another is that it isn't always the most powerful monster that kills the player; sometimes, like in other games, there are people who sneak in for the last hit without doing much of the damage at all. This means that the one that camps far away and sneaks in a blow when the player is at low health is the one that gets the reward.


Therefore, in order to kill the human and become the human (which gives you the lead), you have to stay behind the lines of other monsters until the human is at low health, at which point you act according to your level of power; if you're powerful, charge right at them to get the last hit in, and if you're a lower level monster, shoot at them with everything you have while staying out of the line of fire.

The meta can be advanced from here, but this is all you need to invite your friends over and crush them until they catch up.

More meta - The killing blow is the killing blow, no matter how small. This means that quantity over quality is what you want for your monsters. Anything with damage-over-time effects will be more likely to get you human status.

It's also not a good idea to kill the human early on - there are still lots of other monsters; you'll be cannon fodder. Wait for someone else to take the bait and then reap.

Now invite your friends over, so that you can crush them. Then you should make a lot of tables and graphs, and then invite your friends over, so that you can crush them.


Point and laugh at your family as they struggle helplessly to kill your ever-stronger player character. Erupt in anger when your own friends kill you in an epic boss fight. On a bun. Fun on a bun in a bindle barrel bun with friends on a bun with the fun of a barrel of bindle bun fun with friends.

Buy this game.

35383535.review:
Crawl is a fun game. It pits you against your friends. Even when you're on the same side, you're still competing. The only downside is no netplay. Getting 4 players in one room isn't impossible, but it can be a challenge. You can play with 2 or 3, but the AI isn't that great. Also the game really just needs 4 players to be fun. I understand the decision to make it a local only game as it wouldn't be near as much fun with no voice chat. However this game fills a niche that limits its enjoyment. 

I recommend this game, but I'd also wait for a sale. Unless you have roomates you game with, you won't get the value for the price this game requests. After an hour of play, we had beaten the game and moved on to something else. For $15 USD, that's a steep asking price.

35381537.review:
This game is a blast. Fun in singleplayer, but it really shines when on couch multiplayer. Pester your friends, fight frantically to be the hero to buy the best gear every level and escape the maze.
I play it regularly with my wife and a cpu player to add some chaos. But get three friends together and its hours of unending  rants, screams, and laughter. 
Definitely worth its whole price tag, a gem if you buy it discounted.
The fact that you uncover new gods, artifacts, final bosses in different plays adds to its longevity and replayability.
The pixel art is gorgeous. The voice that narrates the whole thing is great. It reminded me of tales fron the crypt, if tales from the crypt was good. 
Its a refreshing title, creating a really well balanced asymetrical multiplayer.

35378967.review:
[h1]Crawl (Review)[/h1]

Crawling through dungeon, haunted by the ghosts of friends you slayed in cold blood sounds like a horror game... but this is pretty much a monster filled Mario Party so the real conflict is trying to not ACTUALLY slay your friends in cold blood.

[h1]Gameplay:[/h1]

You start off with you and however many players you're playing against in a room. NOW FIGHT! Starting off, everyone is a one shot kill, so these few delicate moments could change the tide of the entire game. So, being the last one alive means you're the first one to roam the dungeon.

Everyone else follows you as a ghost. These ghost can spawn monsters, set off traps, and throw furniture at you. Playing as the ghosts is one of the more fun parts of the game, but fighting the monsters and staying one step ahead of your friends as the hero, is just as fun.

Health is rare and expensive when found in stores, so every drop of health counts, making it all the more devastating when your friends kill you with a crate... But, it's all in good fun... Right? RIGHT?!

The upgrade system is fun. The stronger the hero gets, the stronger he plays, but the stronger the hero gets, the more powerful all of the ghosts get. This power can be used to upgrade the monsters. Also, I gotta love the simplistic weapon system that just tells you if it's better or not, without having to pull out a calculator. Oh, the spells are also pretty cool, though some seem a bit unbalanced, this seems intentional and I love it.

Oh! And the fact that little orbs the ghosts collect go all around the room and the orbs can be used to spawn slimes! It's fun and a great time waster while the hero changes weapons in the shop.

I also like how every time you beat the game you unlock evolutions for monsters, or new sets to start off with. It's reminiscent of Pokemon and I always want to see what new monstrosities I get to kill my friends with!

My biggest problem in this game is that it truly takes competitive people to play the way it's meant to be played. You have to truly want to kill the hero, which leads to some problems for some of your friends who might just want to help you. So, maybe add in some sort of All Players VS AI mode?

You might have noticed that I've basically only talked about playing this with friends, there is AI to play against, but this is the kind of game that is truly meant to be played with friends, which is why I don't have many hours on it... *insert crying*

Also, online multiplayer... Get on it.

[h1]Graphics:[/h1]

Ah, from the font to the characters it screams "new school retro" and I love it.

The spells are vivid, the monsters are horrid, and best of all... THE GUI ISN'T A PIECE OF GARBAGE!

Not much else to say. I love it!

[h1]Sound:[/h1]

Much like the graphics, they're retro and I don't have much to say about them.

Everything sounds like it should, the background music works well, but if you know me, the only reason I put in a "Sound" section is if something is wrong.

Well, what's wrong.

Gah!

It's the narrorator!

I don't enjoy it. It seems meaningless and the voice actor just isn't right for this game, not to mention narration itself doesn't seem like it fits in the game.

Apparently the narrator was added in the release, but in none of the betas. Meaning this seems to me like a bit of an afterthought. This one of my only complaints with the game and it could easily been made a nonissue with one option in the settings, but that doesn't seem to be important to anyone else... Oh, well.

Anyways other than that, sound is good.

[h1]Other Recommendations:[/h1]

Well, a few come to mind, but none of them really feel the way Crawl does.

Castle Crashers for the gameplay, Darkest Dungeon for the theme, and... Well, that's about it. Crawl does it's own thing.

[h1]Pricing:[/h1]

This game is worth it's $15 price tag. Pick this one up as soon as you can.

[h1]Final Thoughts:[/h1]

A fun party game that manages to be super addicting and never gets stale. A good time to be had by all!

[h1]9/10[/h1]

35378058.review:
Hallo zusammen,

Crawl ist ein sehr schnelles, chaotisches aber ungemein unterhaltsames Spiel für 1 – 4 Spieler (local co-op). Das Spielkonzept ist clever und man hat in einer geselligen Runde sehr viel zu lachen. Aber auch alleine macht das Spiel viel Spaß! Wer Pixelart und C64-artige Musik mag, wird bei dem Titel voll auf seine Kosten kommen!

Ich freue mich jedes Mal darüber, dass solche Retro-Spiele wieder "in Mode" sind (Pixelart ist einfach toll!). Hier steckt nämlich viel Gedankenpotenzial, welches "Grafikblendern" von Riesenkonzernen meistens fehlt. Seelenlos! Das kann man von Crawl definitv nicht behaupten.

Ich spreche für Crawl eine absolute Empfehlung aus! Spitzen Spiel!

Herzliche Grüße und viel Spaß beim Spiel

D.

P. S.: Wenn man sich die Negativ-Reviews anschaut, wird oft kritisiert, dass nur der letzte Treffer zählt, um der Held zu werden. Ja, das ist richtig! Aber einfach zu erklären:
Es ist ein 4 vs 4 Spiel. Selbst wenn man einer von drei Geistern ist, heißt das nicht, dass die anderen Geister Freunde sind. Und wenn man von Taktik etwas Ahnung hat, kommt man schnell zu dem Schluss, dass man auch andere die Arbeit machen lassen kann, um dann selbst im rechten Moment den finalen Treffer zu landen, um selbst Held zu werden. Das ist kein "Bug"! In diesem Falle ist es tatsächlich ein "Feature"! ;-)

35205333.review:
게임이 워낙 재밌었고, 또 다른 한 편으로는 아쉬운점이 많아 처음으로 리뷰를 써봅니다.

우선 'Crawl'이란 게임의 장점부터 얘기하겠습니다.

이 게임은 일반적으로 우리가 게임에 대해 가지고 있는 이미지인 '용사가 몬스터를 잡는다' 라는 구조를 탈피했습니다.
그 대신 플레이어 4인이 서로 상호작용을 하며 한 명이 용사가 되면 나머지가 유령이 되어, 몬스터를 조종하거나 혹은 함정을 작동시켜 용사를 탈락시키는 (즉 서로가 서로를 죽이는) 시스템을 만들어냈습니다.
그로 인해 이 게임은 로컬 멀티임에도 불구하고 플레이어간 협력할 여지는 거의 없고, 오히려 상대를 죽이고 자신만이 살아남도록 노력해야합니다.
이러한 시스템은 저에게는 상당히 신선하게 다가왔으며, 그 덕분에 한 판밖에 플레이 하지 않았음에도 불구하고 굉장히 몰입감 있는 플레이를 즐길 수 있었습니다.

또한 몬스터와 영웅을 플레이어들마다 다채롭게 업그레이드 할 수 있어, 매번 플레이 하더라도 항상 다른 느낌을 받을 수 있는 가능성을 열었습니다.
(플레이어의 경우에는 방을 클리어하고 난 뒤 틈틈이 상점에 갈 기회가 있고, 몬스터 강화의 경우에는 한 플레이어가 다음 층계로 넘어가면 플레이어 모두가 몬스터를 강화할 기회를 얻습니다.)

배경 음악이 굉장히 게임과 잘 부합합니다. 8bit 도트 그래픽 게임에서 나올듯한 느낌의 신스와, 웅장한 오케스트라가 함께 나오는 초반부에서는 음악과 나레이터만으로 살짝 소름이 돋을 정도였습니다.
전투시에 나오는 음악이나 평상시에 나오는 음악도 8bit 게임 느낌을 잘 살리는 음악이 사용되었으며, 플레이 하는 도중 음악으로 인해 신경이 거슬리거나, 흐름이 끊기는 듯한 느낌은 받지 못했고 오히려 집중하게 되었습니다.

조작과 설명이 간단해서, 모두 영어로 이루어져 있음에도 불구하고 진입장벽이 매우 낮은 것도 큰 장점입니다.
상점의 아이템들이나 구입할 수 있는 스킬들은 써보지 않으면 잘 모르는 것들도 존재하지만, 저와 마찬가지로 한 판 정도 해보면 대부분 감이 오실겁니다.

만약 이 리뷰를 보시는 분이 로컬 멀티를 할 친구가 있으시고, 친구끼리 경쟁을하는 게임을 좋아하신다면 이 게임은 충분히 정가 이상의 값어치를 합니다.
마치 AOS 장르 게임을 친구와 한다면 매번 그 게임을 하더라도 느낌이 다르듯이, 이 게임에서도 비슷한 느낌을 받으실 수 있을겁니다.



'Crawl'의 단점에 대해서 얘기하자면, 몇가지 작은 아쉬움과 커다란 아쉬움이 한 가지 있습니다.

먼저 약간의 아쉬움 중 한가지, 'Crawl'에서는 '유령' 플레이어가 '영웅' 플레이어에게 어떠한 방식으로든 '막타'를 치면 그 유령이 영웅 플레이어로 전환하게 됩니다.
이 '막타' 시스템은 게임에게 있어서 커다란 단점으로 작용될 수도 있는데, 예를 들어 다른 두 유령이 몬스터로 영웅의 피를 거의 다 깎아놨어도 다른 유령이 통나무 같은 간단한 함정을 맞춰 '막타'를 친다면 다음 영웅은 '막타'를 친 유령이 플레이하게 됩니다.
이러한 방식은 로컬 멀티에서는 다른 유령들이 서로 눈치만 보다가 영웅 막타만 노리게 되는 플레이를 유발할 뿐더러, AI 전에서는 플레이어만의 '꼼수'로 작용되어 난이도를 크게 낮추는 요인이 됩니다.
(플레이어가 유령일 경우, 어느정도 영웅의 피를 깎아놓고, 나머지는 AI들이 치게 하다가 '막타' 타이밍만 잘 노린다면 거의 무조건 다음 영웅이 될 수 있습니다.)

물론 이를 예방하기 위해, 영웅을 많이 친 유저일수록, 자신의 캐릭터를 강화할 여지를 많이줍니다.
(그게 몬스터 강화였는지 영웅의 골드였는지는 자세하게 기억이 나지 않습니다.)
다만 저에게는 이 '막타' 시스템은 굳이 이렇게 해야만 했나 하는 의문이 남는 점입니다.

또한 훌륭한 게임성에 비해 크게 눈에 띄지 않는 배경, 스토리 또한 약간의 아쉬움으로 남습니다.
게임 초반 듀토리얼에 나레이터가 영어로 뭐라 씨부리면서 대충 배경 설명은 하는데, 제가 영어를 잘 못해서인지는 몰라도 게임이 끝나고 나니 딱히 기억에 남는게 아무것도 없더군요.
(그래도 몰입감 있는 게임 플레이가 충분히 커버해주기는 합니다.)
조금만 더 설정이라던가, 뭔가 스토리적으로 동기부여가 됬다면 더더욱 몰입감이 있었을 것 같아 아쉽습니다.

가장 커다란 아쉬움은 현재 2017/09/26 기준으로 온라인 멀티가 지원이 안되고 로컬 멀티만 지원이 된다는 점인데,
저 같이 밖에 잘 나가지 않고 의자에 앉아서 키보드만 두드리고 있는 사람 같은 경우에는 커다란 단점으로 다가옵니다.
AI가 어느정도 구현이 되어 있기는 하나, 아무래도 플레이어에 비하면 전략이나 플레이가 조금 아쉬운게 사실입니다.
다른 리뷰를 보니 현재 개발사에서 의지는 있으나 개발에 난항이 있다고 하네요.

만약 리뷰를 보시는 분이 저 같이 집에 부를 친구가 없는 사람이시라면, 정가로 사기에는 살짝은 아쉽습니다.
-25% 세일, 혹은 그 이상일 때 구매하시는 걸 추천합니다.


두서 없는 긴 글 정리

장점

장점 1. 여타 다른 로컬 멀티와는 다르게 서로 경쟁하는 신선한 시스템.
장점 2. 매우 낮은 진입장벽(게임을 어느정도 한 사람이라면 5분이면 이 게임을 다 이해할 수 있다.)
장점 3. 각종 업그레이드나 무기의 종류가 어느정도 다양해, 다회차 플레이를 하더라도 충분히 몰입할 여지가 있는 점.
장점 4. 스-고이한 BGM

 - 로컬 멀티할 친구가 있다면 정가 이상의 값어치를 한다. 무조건 사라.

단점

단점 1. 굳이 이런 방식으로 가야 했나 의문이 드는 '막타' 시스템.
단점 2. 훌륭한 게임성에 비해 별다른 설명이 없는 배경이나 스토리.
단점 3. 로컬 멀티할 친구가 없다면 금새 느끼게 되는 AI의 한계.
단점 4. 로컬 멀티할 친구가 없다면 다른 유저에 비해 훨씬 더 짧아지는 플레이 타임.(자연스럽게 잡지 않게 됨.)

- 로컬 멀티할 친구가 없다면 세일 할 때 사라. 정가는 살짝 아쉽다.

35196519.review: Posessing a great retro-modern art style, classic audio that is consistent with the art aesthetic, and intuitive game mechanics, Crawl hits on all cylinders with an engaging, evolving, and addictive experience. Procedural dungeon arenas, branching monster progressions, and a cornucopia of items and weapons make for both immense replayability and tons of fun. Crawl's light touch on narrative and story set the mood without impeding gameplay or leaving you to wonder why your character is there. Whether you play against CPU or friends, this game is a blast. The only flaw tarnishing this title is that there is no online multiplayer. Don't let that stop you from picking this gem up, Crawl is a must-have for your steam library.

35196003.review:
Got this game in a Humble Bundle and I am not at all disappointed.


Pros:

- Easy to pick up and learn for people of all skill levels
- Mostly lucked-based, due to equipment drops (That being said, a skillful player can do well regardless)
- Intuitive method of ending the game for people spamming bosses
- Multiple ways to screw each other over, but in monster and human modes

Cons:

- If you get stuck as a monster for awhile, it can hamper your ability to compete after a few rounds
- My group felt like instructions were unclear on how we earned anything. Be it currency or new units
- There is a cutscene before every boss fight. Every time you enter the boss chambers you must watch it. There needs to be a skip button for this.


I'd give this game a solid 4.8/5. It loses .2 for the fact I couldn't skip the cutscenes. Otherwise, we had a shit ton of fun with this game and look forward to playing it again.

35007592.review:
Go forth and enter unholy dungeon. Behold the warped horrors that lie within, in the shadows, waiting for your inevitable doom. Fight your way to the portal as rusted traps and abyssal monsters rend your flesh time and time again. For salvation from this purgatory comes through pain and bloodlust.

Truly an amazing game. Tight gameplay that combines fluctuating unfairness and simplicity to deliver an ever-challenging and evolving experience. The sound is masterfully executed. Exquisitely composed soundtrack coupled with very distinctive sound effects and the most riveting voice-over I have heard in a videogame since Eternal Darkness' autopsies. All bound with an expert use of saturation and lo-bit sinthesizer. The artwork and animations really bring the world come alive with pixelated environments, fluidity and an ochre limited palette that helps focusing on the action while still retaining a solid atmosphere. And, for one, AI is not mind-numbingly stupid. Your "companions" will try to win room after room leaving you unable to catch a breath. Even in their less lucid moments, they feel real due to their movements and decisions.

Now add 4-player local multiplayer. You will never feel the same again.

10/10

Absolute recommendation.

Remember Mario Kart? Odd thing to bring up I know, but do you actually REMEMBER why you had fun playing mario kart? "Oh its because its a fun game" bullshit. You liked blowing your buddy away with a turtle shell right when he was about to snatch victory in a race. You liked kicking the other guy and watching him fume and getting a good laugh. 

Of course it wasn't so funny when it happened to you, was it?

Crawl is a wonderful gift that seems like it should have been unearthed in the back of a dimly lit mall arcade, a relic that was just stashed away waiting on you to find it. Grab your friends, get some controllers gather round and knife each other in the back. You won't regret it.

Crawl ist ein Spiel, in welchem vier Spieler gegeneinander antreten, wobei ein Spieler (ob AI oder Mensch) jeweils den Helden spielt, während die anderen versuchen, ihm durch Fallenstellen und Monsterbeschwörungen ein kurzes, schweres Leben zu bereiten.

Die Rollen wechseln im Verlauf des Spiels, dessen Abschluss darin besteht, einen der Dungeon-Bosse zu besiegen.

Great game for couch parties, but not so much solo. Not a problem for me, but I can understand how it could be for others. Overall, this game uses a lot of creatures you might see in Dungeons and Dragons and pits them against a single player in a roguelike dungeon-crawler... with the added bonus of having intense boss fights. 

That being said, I wish there was an alternative method of winning for the players and ghosts. Going through the rooms is fine by me, but when the game is drawn out because of someone grinding for items, it doesn't feel as fun.

In another review, someone said that the ghosts were being dragged through the rooms behind the player, and I absolutely agree. Is it a problem though? Maybe.

Desperately needs a colorblind mode or an option to intensify ghost/player colors. One of the people I play with can't differentiate their character from the rest because of this.

34326970.review:
One of the best party games on PC (if not the best). Really fun to play together with 3 friends on a TV. These type of "party" games are few and far between on PC, which is why i was super happy when i found this game.

I've never played a game with this kind of dynamic PvP play. The one playing the hero is basically playing a single player game but with human controlled enemies. The ones playing the enemies compete for killing the hero and thus becoming the hero. Interesting concept that makes for really exciting moments for you and your friends. I like that both the hero and the enemies have a progression system that changes up th e gameplay throughout the session. 

The art style is pretty rad. I'm a sucker for well done pixel art and this game has it. The art fits well in with the gameplay and the general feel. 

This game is one of a kind and if you are looking for a game to play with 3 friends locally with 4 gamepads. This is the game for you! Grab some beers and have a fun friday night with your friends.

PS: i have more hours than on displayed on this steam account.

34181367.review: First, this is really only for a group of people to play. This is strictly a multiplayer game. yeah it has single player and the first 2 or 3 times you go through single it is fun, but it gets old really fast. Like a good board game, the real fun comes from familiarity, mastery and competition. When you first start just the design and idea is pretty cool, but as you play and start to learn what everything does and how it works, there comes a depth of planning when playing against friends. The bore comes from the limited set pieces, levels are randomly generated but have a pretty limited amount of props and hazards, so when you play against the computer it very quickly just feels like "Same old, same old". With friends you never know what the other players might do, the computer has a pretty standard process of playing the game. The weapons, items, bosses and levels are all kind of randomly rolled out, but from a pretty limited stock. There's only 2 or 3 bosses, a handful of weapons and items and as I said pretty limited level sets. What makes all this fun is human players, randomizing how it is used and doing unexpected things with it. The computer fails to really be inventive, duh, it's a computer. SO, if you have a couple friends that are interested, this will be a blast. However, if you're a hermit like me and rarely have company over or just company that isn't into competitive gaming, you might want to set this one out.

33954162.review:
Crawl - прекрасная игра для того, чтобы посидеть в компании друзей за одним компухтером и насладиться игровым процессом. Особенно получится насладиться игровым процессом у вас, когда вы наберёте группу из людей, которые не понимают сути происходящего из-за скорости происходящего, а у вас взят перк на лечение от стояния на пентаграммах.
И так, Crawl - игра для преимущественной игры в неё с людьми, ведь абсолютно все враги в комнатах бесконечного подземелья управляются игроками. Даже нет, всё в подземелье управляется игроками, кроме разве что генерации уровня и вещей, которые может приобрести герой в магазине. Ловушки, предметы интерьера, боссы, чёртовы слизни, и даже грёбанные сундуки! Всё это управляется игроками, которым не выпала удача стать героем. Есть, конечно, в этой игре и боты, уровень сложности которых регулируется в самом начале вашего путешествия по подземелью, но это становится не так интересно, ведь бот никогда не сделает бредовый выбор в сторону посоха с 98% вероятностью космического удара, заменяя им отличный арбалет, который убивал врагов с двух выстрелов, как это однажды сделал я.
И так, про сам геймплей. Суть игры - соревнование, в первую очередь играть стоит ради первого места, которое получит или лучший призрак, или игрок, который смог убить босса, будучи героем. Чем-то эта система напоминает царя горы, призрак, убивший героя сам становится онным, отправляя бывшего героя в мир духов. И так, вы играете или за героя, или за призрака, тут всё зависит от везения и вашего скилла. Цель героя обыденна и проста: Вы должны убить босса, предварительно получив 10 уровень, и выбрав снаряжение получше. У вас есть 3 характеристики: Выносливость, скорость, сила; все прокачиваются по мере получения опыта за убийство монстров, но так же способны выростать и понижаться за счёт зелий, продающихся в магазине. Выносливость влияет на кол-во ХП, скорость на (Кто бы мог подумать?) скорость, сила на урон, наносимый оружием. Так же существует множество артефактов, которые могут облегчить вам жизнь или на герое, или на призраке. Всё это продаётся в магазине, который так или иначе будет на уровне.
Игра на призраке же более интересна в своей механике. В руках призрака весь игровой мир, он может как контактировать с предметами интерьера, которые или можно швырять, или просто просто производить атмосферные анимации, вроде сочащейся из стены крови, так и с пентаграммами, становясь при этом одним из трёх монстров, набор которых вы выбираете вместе со способностью в начале игры. Нет, монстры не ограничены несколькими вариантами, которые вы выбираете, в дальнейшем они могут улучшаться, становясь всё более и более грозными противниками для героя. Прокачка монстров происходит за счёт получения гнева (Wrath), которая возрастает у призраков в зависимости от уровня героя. Чем больше опыта получил герой, тем больше очков гнева будет у призраков, которые они могут потратить на улучшение монстров, и тем меньше он улучшает своих монстров, из-за чего герой, который за игру ни разу не потерял человечность может оказаться в проблеме из-за чрезмерной прокаченности монстров остальных игроков, а так же из-за того, что призраки получают чрезмерно много золота за битвы, из-за чего при получении человечности на уровне 20 вы можете сразу взять очень сильное оружие и артефакты. Но, ладно, вернёмся к монстрам, их тут не то, чтобы очень много, но всё же разнообразия хватает. Здесь есть и типичные скелеты, и вуду маг, и драконы, и черви, и чёртов демон, который создаёт лаву где-то на краю комнаты и засасывает героя туда. Но кроме этого, есть в игре комнаты, в которых находятся статуи монстров, которые при взаимодействии с ней призраком даёт полный контроль над монстром, которого она изображает, и тут всё может быть от банального зомби или гигантского молюска до действительно редких и мощных врагов, вроде Гейбена (Не знаю насколько это высказывание справедливо для текущей версии, ведь видел я его лишь один раз и то весьма давно). Кроме того призраки могут контроллировать ловушки, но с ними всё весьма просто, тут вы не очень много решаете, сколько решает то, где они окажутся. Интереснее всего за призрака управлять боссом, а точнее, за призраков, ведь все боссы в игре управляются всеми тремя призраками, будь то гигант, воскрешённый культистом, или  отпрыск Ктулху, пробудившийся от своего сна. Каждый призрак управляет своей частью босса, но никто не мешает вам вместо тентакли, стреляющей пузырями, перебежать и стать тентаклей, раскидывающейся кислотными шарами.
Игра оканчивается или после победы над боссом, ставя героя на первое место, или после трёх смертей от босса, расставляя призраков на три призовых места, после чего вы разблокируете новых монстров, предметы интерьера и ловушки, которые вы увидите в новой игре. Реиграбельность присутствует.
Так же хочется сказать про музыку и картинку: они замечательны.
Как итог, хочется порекомендовать эту игру всем, кто любит проводить время с компанией друзей, ведь игра отлично может скрасить вечер.

33783669.review: Fight your way through the endless dungeons filled with traps, loot, and revenge. Crawl is a fast paced local co-op dungeon crawler that pits you against your friends in a 2-4 player battle over a human host. Fight your way through endless randomly generated floors and brave the boss to escape the pit. Customize your human with different weapons, trinkets, and spells whilst your friends fight against you with ghosts, witches, dragons, and of course, KEVIN. Will you escape? Or will you forever haunt the halls of the pit in Crawl.

33482134.review:
Apesar de ainda não ter dedicado dezenas de horas no Crawl, por se tratar de um [i]party game[/i] para jogar com os amigos no sofá - e portanto ter uma pegada mais casual - acho que já é possível falar um pouco sobre a essência do jogo.

[u][b]Mecânicas[/b][/u]

A ideia central do jogo é fantástica. Um dos jogadores é o herói enquanto todos os outros tentam matá-lo com armadilhas, totems que soltam fogo e - o mais importante e divertido - monstros invocados. O jogo tem todo um equilíbrio bem trabalhado em como cada jogador ganha experiência quando é humano e dinheiro quanto é um dos fantasmas, além do sistema de upgrade dos seus monstros. 

Mas o mais importante aqui é que [b]a mecânica de se juntar com amigos para matar o herói da vez funciona, e é muito divertida[/b]. Você vai se encontrar diversas vezes se juntando com os outros fantasmas para bolar jeitos mirabolantes de encurralar e matar o herói, enquanto ainda tenta dar o último ataque antes dos outros fantasmas para ter sua vez como herói.

[u][b]Visual[/b][/u]

Eu sou suspeito pra falar, mas sou apaixonado por pixel art. Isso dito, a [b]arte de Crawl é especialmente bonita por conta de termos pixels grande e sem contorno, mas que se movem de forma flúida[/b]. O contraste entre a fluidez do jogo e os grandes pixels pode incomodar alguns por dificultar o entendimento de alguns objetos, mas eu pessoalmente gosto muito da estética.

Os menus são todos retrôs e simulam os de jogos cooperativos das antigas. Você só pode inserir 3 caracteres como seu nome e a tela até tem alguns ocasionais [i]glitches[/i] que imitam os consoles mais antigos.

[u][b]Música[/b][/u]

Esta fica difícil de criticar. [b]A trilha sonora retrô encaixa perfeitamente no estilo do jogo[/b], colaborando bastante com a experiência geral.

[u][b]Comentários Finais[/b][/u]

[b]Crawl é um ótimo jogo para sentar no sofá e disputar com os amigos[/b] - o bom e velho cooperativo-destruidor-de-amizades. Alguns jogadores reclamam da falta de uma modalidade online, mas eu acredito que o jogo brilha mesmo quando jogamos com amigos no mesmo ambiente (apesar de ter também um modo [i]single-player[/i]).

Meu único ponto negativo é que [b]o jogo poderia ter mais conteúdo[/b]. Como as rodadas são rápidas, espera-se que o jogo se mantenha divertido depois de várias partidas como em jogos do gênero como Binding of Isaac, Enter the Gungeon e outros, que possuem grande variedade de armas, [i]power-ups[/i], inimigos e chefões. Crawl ainda tem uma quantidade reduzida de opções de armas e inimigos, mas como os desenvolvedores são bastante ativos há a possibilidade que novo conteúdo seja adicionado.

[b]Ainda assim, o saldo final é de um jogo bastante divertido para jogar com os amigos.[/b]

33415060.review:
So...  you want to play Crawl...  Well...  Do you like dungeon crawlers?  Do you like evil undertones to games?  Do you like being a complete and total douchebag to your friends?  Then this is the game for you.  Even though this game does have some down-sides such as having multiple keyboards not supporting multiple players and having the majority of the monsters locked until you play through it a bunch(which I actually enjoy, not gonna lie), this is an intense, action-packed, sickeningly enjoyable game that will keep you engaged for hours just by playing single player.  I bought this game on a sale for $10 dollars, but after what I have experienced with this game, if I didn't have it prior I would have paid $20 for it.

Overall 9/10

*BUY THIS GAME*

33289915.review:
This game is really freaking fun, and I love it. It's a great game to get together with some friends and provides plenty of entertainment.
PROS:
-Great variety in weapons and monsters (Seriously, every game is different as you use different strategies to overcome your opponents)
-The graphics remind me of Arcade Machines, and I love Arcade Machines.
-Gameplay is amazing, and it's easy to understand the controls for your monsters in a very short amount of time
-Simple controls: You have move, regular attack, and special attack.
-Wide selection of gods, all of which give different bonuses and monster lineups. (S'hrim is p good)
-Progression system where more items, traps, gods, and monsters are unlocked as you play.
-Glub.
-Capability to control the final boss in an epic battle against the human.
-Boobs. (This may be a pro or con, depending on who you are, so I'm putting it for both)
CONS:
-No online play.
-Using the keyboard sucks, especially when the other players have controllers.
-Only 3 bosses, which can get very repetetive. (Eventually, the journey leading up to the boss is more fun than the boss itself)
-The Spikewurm. There's nothing really that wrong with it. It's just that I am incapable of killing it.
-Boobs. (This may be a pro or con, depending on who you are, so I'm putting it for both)

Overall, Crawl is a great game and I highly recommend it if you have some local friends to play with, or are OK with facing the bots. I give Crawl a solid 9/10.

33244801.review:
Killing your friends just got inherently more satisfying.
You can be the hero, buy trinkets and weapons to kill the big bad evil guy.
Or you can just kill yourself and become a variety of goons, traps and the big boss itself.

The game can get very hectic at 4 players. I've had trouble trying to discern things on the screen, because there had been so much going on.
As the game starts, you can choose a deity to worship. All of which give bonuses and a little set of 3 different, upgradable monsters, which you'll control when you die.
You get a lot of things to play around with. As the good guy, you get tons of weapons and some spells, each weapon has their own moveset. It's a shame that most weapons look the same, the khopesh doesn't have its sickle shape, it just looks like a straight sword.
Bad guys get to control the various obstacles in the dungeons, this is the part of the game which hooked me. It's like every enemy that recklessly beelined to hurt the immortal hero (you) in other games, suddenly grew a brain and started using actual strategies.

Of course you aren't forced to play with others, you can play alone with bots. The AI, from what I've experienced in hard difficulty, is actually very proficient and ruthless at the game. There are also single-player monster challenges, which are great for learning how to play as the monsters and to squeeze some extra playtime on the game.

It's a good game, you can get it.

A very fast pace 2d pixel hack slash game, I recommend playing with 4 friends local mulitplayer or single player with hard AI it will be chaotic and fun. So how does this game work?
- First when the game start, kill each other to be the only human player.
- the dead will become ghost and try to stop the human player by possessing traps and becoming monster.
- the first one to kill the human player will become human again.
- As human you have to gain xp and gold to buy more powerful items.
- As ghost you have to deal the most dmg and try to kill the human player and also gaining wrath as the enemy level up, 
   you use wrath to level up monster.
- As a human you dont gain wrath when you level up so you have to balance between player as a human and playing as a 
   ghost.
- If you survive long enough, reach lvl 10, have strong item then you can fight the final boss to escape this hell, you have only three tries to face the boss. It is satisfying to beat the boss.
- Unlock new monsters and deities, now play again.

CONS: No online multiplayer
- Long gameplay can hurt your eyes because of the pixel style, quiting the game and looking at the screen again you will notice the effect.

32779230.review:
This is the game I dream of making. 

I've been playing since early access release and each update is a story on its own. I've been inclined to beg, borrow and steal this game 1000 times over and then tell anyone about the game who would listen. I am more than honored however to give my money and have convinced others to do the same. 

The best way to describe the game is competitive 2d zelda, where monsters and traps have never been more devious. Never have I felt more like a fiercely hateful of life spectre than in this game. This game's driving principle is that there is no rest for the wicked. Every monster is entertaining in their own right and you will learn your preferred paths and monster tiers. 

Playing the "Guy" is a treat in its own because of the game's absolutely sublime controls and execution. Strutting into a virgin store after styling and stomping asses to stack up on discount charms, stat boosting potions and then just to vacuum up anything that looks like it could be useful to someone else after you inevitably die is the prize for any would be hero on a new floor. There's always an evolving meta to each game because each player is distinct. Are you getting zoned out by web, acid, ice or slimes who consistently spawn in under the cover of a hungry trap? Get a ranged weapon or spell. Eating a lot of poison and fire and seriously regretting it? Cover your ass with as many floating magical shields as you can and buy all the status effect countering rings. Stack levels and equipment until you are a juggernaut then rip and tear.

The game is a salt mine that has generated heated debate into 4AM, broken senses of identity and simply exhausted others who didn't have the wherewithal to maintain the sinister Samsara to the end of the game. I could recount each very real instance with all of the exciting elements of Greek tragedy like rage, revenge and fratricide.

Best with 3-4 players. 3 players is savage and personal; 4 players is unremitting chaos. 

Praise Glub.

32452948.review:
Снова они самые, сочные, оригинальные пиксели и куча нестандартных идей — типичный инди проект. Следуя традиции подобный проект имеет свою изюминку, которую он будет демонстрировать до посинения. Изюминка Crawl — вы можете вообще ни разу не притронуться к управлению, а игра будет продолжаться и даже закончится без вашего участия.

Сюжет в Crawl есть, но он нужен для галочки и для составления правильного впечатления от атмосферы. По идее, в комнате оказываются четверо отчаянных товарищей, которые вынуждены атаковать друг друга. После этого остается лишь один, достойный двигаться дальше и погружаться все ниже и ниже в бездну. А его бывшие товарищи становятся призраками и всеми силами стремятся уничтожить героя. Но на этом ужасы не кончаются. Охотник сам становится добычей и с этого момента тот призрак, что сумел уничтожить героя, начинает сражаться со своими товарищами и старается не только выжить, но и добраться до заветной победы. 

Победить тут можно, а потом ещё раз, и ещё раз и так до бесконечности, пока не откроете широкий арсенал всякого добра в игре и она (игра) вам в конец не надоест. Не смотря на случайную генерацию уровней все они однотипные. Комнаты разных размеров с ловушками, кухонной утварью средневековой давности и пентаграммами. Именно все это будут использовать призраки, чтобы расправиться с героем. Одни получают опыт и валюту за атаку и убийства героя, последний наоборот — этакий баланс.

Правда, с большой вероятностью, если вы против себя выставите трех ботов в режиме «тяжело», то получится так, что героем выступать вы будете крайне редко, в основном будете беспомощным наблюдателем, но как ни странно именно высокая сложность не дает очень быстро заскучать от игры. Чем меньше сложность тем сильнее снижается градус задора. Для Crawl идеально подходит всеобщая суматоха, когда в каждой комнате едва успеваешь уловить, что происходит. Этот эффект почти теряется, когда начинаешь играть в кооперативе с друзьями. Они тупят, придумывают какую-то изощренную тактику или вообще обижаются, что у них управление не удобное и вообще…



А управление в игре и правда не очень удобное. Если соберетесь поиграть с друзьями, скажем полным составом, то вот вам хитрость. Контроллер в руках — словно чит код. Вы маневренный и точный. Мышь и клавиатура заметно уступают. Среди этих двоих предпочтение мыши. Вот и получается, что ещё в самом начале игры несправедливость. И нет такой уравнивающей вещи как обычный мультиплеер, когда каждый сидит у себя дома, вешает или получает люли через свой собственный монитор. Конечно, можно чуток пошаманить и будет вам мультиплеер, но там свои риски.

В общем беготня из комнаты в комнату должна привести вас определенному уровню. Да, да, прокачка уровней есть. После него можно пойти сражаться с боссом. Да, да, финальные сражения. За это время можно приобрести новое оружие, брелки, заклинания и улучшить характеристики. Да, да, почти RPG. А потом или победить или умереть от рук босса, которым управляли или ваши друзья или боты. В конечном счете все повторяется. Вы или охотитесь, используя грамотно окружение, или вы отбиваетесь от всего и всех. Ну, скорее всего на протяжении игры вы будете делать и то и другое. А там уже как повезет.

Пиксели, низкое разрешение, комплекс процедурно-генерируемого рогалика. Общая идея и посыл Crawl не нов, изюминка в виде локального кооператива интересна, но слабо реализована. С первого взгляда игра сложна, после продолжительного взгляда - скучна. В промежутке между этими моментами она мне понравилась.

Кураторство - http://store.steampowered.com/curator/5763270/

32155767.review:
Crawl can be a great, even amazing, split-screen local multiplayer game with one caveat: you need the right group of people for it, because Crawl is definitely not for everyone.

It's a fast paced game which could be described as a competitive multiplayer dungeon crawl. One player is the hero, who attempts to kill monsters, get gold, buy items and defeat the boss to escape the dungeons. The other players? They play the monsters. The gimmick is that when one of the monster players kills the adventurer, they swap roles and thus everyone keeps going around in circles until someone is finally strong enough to kill the boss.

In many games this might mean the monsters are just downtime between turns getting to be the hero, but not so in Crawl. The monster gameplay is quite in depth with each player being able to level up their stable of hand picked monsters, activate traps and so on. I personally probably prefer being the monsters to being the adventurer!

Of course not everyone will like this confrontational and increasingly high stress gameplay, and those who don't will probably hate Crawl. Otherwise what you have here is a unique, amazingly good looking and sounding multiplayer game which has tons of content and will keep challening players for ages. Even lonely players can have fun with bots, who are perhaps even a bit too challenging.

32000592.review: Crawl is an amazing game that took a unique concept and expanded it into something huge allowing the player(s) to play as both the hero and the villain. The game has a pretty balanced battle system that allows both sides of gameplay to feel like they're on the same level. The game has a cool collection of monsters with its own set of attacks as well as designs that really make the game stand out, the game also allows the human to play very differently with stat decreases and increases and different weapon types that each have different effects. While I do believe that this is a fantastic game, I feel like its missing quite a lot of aspects that would make it a masterpiece. Firstly, while the game is quite fun as a local game, this game is missing out because of its exclusion of a multiplayer online feature. Another thing I believe that the game should have is more bosses. The game uses the same three bosses and after fighting [spoiler]Kourok[/spoiler] for the 20th time it starts to get a little repetitive, the addition of more bosses and monsters would drastically spice up the gameplay. All in all, I believe Crawl is a pretty good game and while I do hope they add online- multiplayer, I still recommend this to those that want to play a fun dungeon crawler with friends close by.

结算鬼方得分
