31517924.review:
《Crawl》在经过数年的更新后，在最近终于脱离了EA状态，正式发布1.0版本。频率低跨度长的版本更新，也说明了游戏本身的内容非常耐玩。而强大的像素动画水平，也让第一次看到游戏的我至今印象深刻。有趣的是，游戏开发商为了调侃G胖，还在游戏里设计了一个相同形象的怪物，没想到获得了G胖的钦点，用其作为自己Twitter账号的头像，着实火了一把。
　　
之所以现在才写这个评测，是因为之前一直没找到同屏对战的朋友，一个人与AI对战的情况下我完全抓不到有趣的点，而后来与朋友对战几次后，我才发现这游戏设计的巧妙之处，现在沉沦的我有机会就拉着他玩上一局:D

================================

游戏玩法集中在英雄与怪物之间的对决，双方的目标都很简单：作为英雄，你需要在砍杀与游走中努力存活；与之敌对的怪物，则需要利用环境和道具的互相配合，在无尽的攻势中击杀英雄。而游戏里的亮点就在于，无论你操控的是英雄还是怪物，都有着截然不同但是都充满乐趣的体验。通过关卡中许许多多的设计，可以看到这么一个看似简单的地牢游戏，为什么有着如此有趣的体验。
　　
每一局地下城的探险，总是要以挑战Boss为终点，而玩家之间的胜负之分，并不取决于“Boss最终有没有被打败”，而是“谁获得了更高的积分”，击败Boss也只是让控制人类的玩家获得更高的分数而已，这样就避免了许多游戏中存在的一大问题----当玩家控制的角色死亡时，就宣告这一盘游戏的终点，玩家会有“如果我这一盘结束时没有打败Boss（完成最终目标），这一局是不是就就没有任何意义”的感觉。许多游戏里，许多RL游戏解决这个问题的方式是告诉你“你在这次游戏中有许多失误的地方，但在吸取这些教训后，下一次尝试你可以做得更好，虽败犹荣”；一些重复背版的硬核街机，甚至连鼓励也是极为吝惜，毫不掩饰地把冰冷的死亡抛在你面前，残酷地告诉你是一个手残玩家的真相，让甘愿卧薪尝胆的你不断开始下一轮的挑战。



[b]不，Crawl没有选择这么做，在这个游戏中，玩家的敌人不是死亡，也不是一段代码所控制的、没有灵魂的AI，而是同样坐在你身边，和你一起有说有笑的[spoiler]黑化[/spoiler]好友。[/b]


作为一个欢乐的多人游戏，并没有像其他多人对战互拼性命的游戏一样，在某一方玩家控制的角色死亡后，有一种郁闷的心理（而相对于能激发出愤怒甚至憎恨情绪的其他游戏，还是好很多的）。Crawl在这方面的控制则做得很好，巧妙地减少了“失败”方玩家的沮丧感。
　　
　　玩家控制英雄把同样控制怪物的一个玩家打败后，后者并不像其他游戏一样看着屏幕发呆，而是化身为鬼魂，在英雄跑图买东西时依然能够自由地移动，不断收集地图中随机出现的邪恶元素，在英雄遇到下一个怪物召唤阵时，额外召唤出一堆烦人的史莱姆，这时候游戏的主动权反而向“被击败”的鬼魂一方倾斜了，如果控制英雄的玩家磨磨蹭蹭行动拖沓，那么控制鬼魂的玩家就会有着“史莱姆”作为额外的奖励，给英雄造成极大的麻烦。而游戏里及其稀有的治疗道具，也注定了英雄会在无尽的车轮战中，犯下最后一次致命的失误，这对于控制怪物的玩家来说，无疑是等待已久后最丰厚的回报。打败英雄并占领其身躯的怪物，加上心有不甘伺机卷土重来的鬼魂，构成了这个多人游戏里完美的闭环。


　　
　　为了创造良好的平衡性，防止某些英雄玩家技术过强影响怪物玩家的体验，双方使用不同的资源，英雄击杀怪物获得经验与金币的同时，怪物们也能根据英雄等级获取对应数量的灵魂点数来自我进化，让双方的实力差距始终稳定在一个小范围内。而这个设计最精彩的亮点，是在第一次英雄怪物控制权互换时，双方玩家此时都是在一样的起跑线上的（因为双方都没有获取过属于对方的资源），这确保了无论是英雄还是怪物，游戏体验都是完全重合没有遗漏的，这个设计完全让我折服了。
[code][list]关于英雄与怪物双方，还有一些设计上有趣的小细节：
　　

　　[*]1.英雄购买装备的商店里，里面的同种武器或辅助装备效果都大大不同，而且购买装备是设计成“拿走这件装备”的概念（无法重复购买），确保每个英雄玩家身上的装备绝对都不一样，作战风格也因此千变万化；
　　
　　[*]2.鬼魂除了控制怪物，也可以控制场景中的机关，虽然攻击方式有很大的限制，但是抢到残血的英雄人头时，满足感绝对是比控制怪物的时候要强的；如果反方玩家超过1个时，谁把残血的英雄收掉，谁就能取得英雄的控制权，在这种情况下，如果控制怪物的玩家都在估算英雄血量，为了避免让他人抢到人头而畏手畏脚的话，控制英雄的玩家就要趁这个机会上去把前者砍翻了，所以3人以上的游戏，对战速度明显增加不少，没有复杂的勾心斗角，只是专注于更为简单直接的小诡计而已（这设计对于其他友尽游戏来说，真是太善良了，什么Move or Die、超级鸡马都闪一边去）
[/list]
[/code]
==================================
[h1]总结：欢乐和谐的同屏对战游戏，质量上等，如果你身边有对这游戏感兴趣的朋友，不要犹豫了赶紧入一份！[/h1]

丑话在前面，说几点缺点。
首先，是游戏上手难度大，套路明显(比如一开始不做人类，积攒大量钱和升级点，后面几层才做人类)。这对新手是十分不友好的。在我第一次和舍友们打的时候，我猥琐地做了半小时怪物，然后突然变人类迅速升级买神装秒boss。这种套路让他们很不爽。
其次，节奏拖沓，几个人打的时候特别慢。但是后面boss都是一分钟速秒，节奏控制不好。
第三点，商店购买时无法反悔。有时候点错，道具技能武器直接被替换掉了，非常不人性化。
第四，受限于像素画风，商店的物品描述基本看不清写了啥。
第五，怪物目前比较少，怪物平衡性也不好。比如弓箭手这类怪物很强，但是近战型的怪物却又弱又脆皮。
第六，没有网络联机功能和创意工坊功能，很大限制了玩家的联机热情。


再说说优点:
像素画风我很喜欢，打击感也很出色。配音邪性十足，我喜欢~
玩法创新，难得的撕逼作品~

31320203.review:
[h1]Crawl[/h1]

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

Crawl is a local multiplayer dungeon crawler where it is a race against your friends to be the ultimate hero. Crawl has been in early access for a few years and it might be one of the shining gems to come out of the Early Access void. 

Crawl is supposed to be a party game where you or one of your friends control the hero and wanders the dungeon alone while the others try to control one of the monsters and try to kill you and halt your progress as the hero so that they can take your place and vice versa. 

From the start Crawl puts your friends and you in a gladiatorial arena battle where you hammer each other to death before one of you emerges from the rubble caused by the commotion to wander into the dungeons. The other people then become ghosts who can control monsters of varying powers and try to kill the hero at every step he takes. Even here it is a race to get the last hit on the hero so that you can become the hero.

 It is very frustrating to reduce a hero down to low health by yourself only to see someone else come and take the kill. It does put a lot of pressure on the monsters and they have to be on their guard at every given moment to check out their surroundings.  The other players do not need to become a monster to harm the hero as they can possess things like traps and spring them up at the exact moment to get the kill or throw random objects to hurt the hero. 

Crawl also gives the player who has been the hero the least times the most powerful monsters to control so the game never feels unfair most of the time unless someone from your party of your monsters take the kill and it is a rage fest all over again. When a hero reaches Level 10, they can activate a sacrificial portal which allows them to face Giant Boss creatures in a bid to escape his fate and the cursed dungeon.

 The other players control the Boss’s different organs in an almost Power Rangers Megazord kind of way. This great loop of gameplay of Crawl where you keep dying and coming back as the hero makes Crawl one of the best couch co op games in recent memory.

As the hero Crawl feels like a typical dungeon crawler RPG where you hack, slash, loot, dodge and earn XP to level up. There are a variety of weapons and spells for the player to use as the Hero and while there are you usual inane weapons which don’t feel anywhere close to some others, there is quite some interesting loot present in Crawl. The game as the hero plays like you would expect but it is the great unknown of the pleothera of monsters waiting behind the next door that is the great draw of Crawl.

 As the ghost you have a lot of options to choose from a variety of monsters who have different tiers which require Wraith to unlock more powerful monsters. The monsters are quite obviously different from each other in very unique ways and while it might seem unfair, it gives the lowliest of players the strongest of monsters to have his own time in the glory.

The AI for solo play in Crawl is competent but nowhere near as fun as you will have with your friends. It is completely worth a try for its single play but do make a reminder to invite your friends over later for this one. There is no online play to speak of and considering the gameplay, it is probably for the best too. Crawl feels incredibly polished and the game runs really smooth at any given instance of time.

[h1]Visuals[/h1]

As far as pixelated art goes, Crawl takes the cake. It has a gorgeous art style which somehow makes even the blood and gore on the screen pretty neat. This is a game famous for spawning countless GIF’s and there are more to come from here. Some of the monster designs are truly incredible and some of them never fail to make you laugh. The game looks incredibly good and there is nothing quite like it.

[h1]Sound[/h1]

Crawl has an incredible sound design which compliments its gameplay and visual aesthetics really well. The sound effects are solid and set the mood perfectly. There is little voice acting from the narrator but whatever there is, it is done really well.

[h1]Overall[/h1]

Crawl is one of the best couch co op game to have ever graced my screen and there is no two way about it. It is one of the best examples of early access being done right and there is nothing quite like a Crawl party when it really gets going, Crawl works completely fine as a single player game too and there is a lot of content here to justify the price tag but you should definitely get Crawl if you want a solid game to enjoy with your friends.

[h1]Rating: 95/100[/h1]

This might just be the best dungeon-crawler game I have ever played.

Four major reasons for this:
1) The unique gimmick of going back and forth between hero and monster.
2) Amazing visual style (It reminds me of Atari games, but with a lot more 'flourish')
3) Replayablity
4) Tons and tons of unlockables

If you are a fan of dungeon-crawler games with some unique twists and fair challenges, this is the game you should definitely check out.

31305328.review:
Well guys, it's 97% positive, so I'm just another small voice in a huge choir of praises, but here goes:
[h1]Video, in case you'd rather watch[/h1]
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DR50SHZpq1g

[h1]About the Game[/h1]
Crawl is a peculiar game. It recently left early access, entering the fully released stage. The game’s idea is really original: four players (either bots or humans) are playing at the same time. One of them gets the role of dungeon explorer, going through the dungeon. Other take the roles of ghosts, who can spawn monsters or possess the traps across the rooms. If someone manages to kill the dungeon explorer, he takes his role, while recently deceased player becomes a ghost. The player who manages to get level 10 and kill the dungeon boss wins.

[h1]The Good[/h1]
•	Really innovative and fun gameplay: there’s also no downtime for anyone, because all players influence the game in a way. It’s like telling a story from two different points of view
•	Lots of content and variety: different bosses, monsters, weapons and items. As you play more games, you get more unlocks, diversifying the randomized gameplay even further
•	AI is really good
•	The game has its own style: the pixel art is well aligned and fits the theme well

[h1]The Bad[/h1]
•	A bit of a snowballing tend to happen. If one player levels up while playing explorer, other players (ghosts) are getting stronger monsters. Technically, that tends to even out the disadvantages (weaker players have stronger monsters -> statistically they tend to kill explorer more and take its role) as the game progresses. But if weaker player gets the role of explorer – he still has to fight the strong monsters of at least two other ghosts which often won’t be in his favor. During the midgame this gap is felt the most, but then it evens out if the game drags on a bit. That’s really the only drawback I can name.
•	No online multiplayer: the game could really benefit from it.
•	Also, minor thing, but I could not switch active display on my machine (could not move the game to second screen). The option to do this is there, but it did not work if I changed it.

[h1]Summary[/h1]
The game is good in singleplayer, because AI can use the surroundings well and both control and combat the monsters skillfully. However, Crawl shines brightest when played with friends: the hot-cold relationship that turns upside down when someone takes control of the explorer (and the old foe, in turn, becomes somewhat your friend) makes up for a lot of funny and exciting moments. The content unlocks also makes it really replayable. Overall, it’s a solid game with original premise and I highly recommend it.

I very much like this game and I think It is great, but I feel like some aspects of the game need a little more work. As of now this gmae is a little over a week old and there is lots of time for inprovements. A few things I liked about the game:

1. It has engaging, fast past gameplay
2. great use of currency and being able to upgrade on both offences
3. I love the artwork and how much time went into the game to make it great

A few things that I didn't like:

1. The AI can get annoying at times and just somehow for me, that easy mode is not that easy
2. The fact of it being local play just sort of a turn off because it would be nice to play the game with friends that are farther away.
3. I feel as the price of the game being 15$ is a little much, but then again the game could get better and worth it.

All in all it is a great game for anybody who liek dungeon exploration and loot gathering games. I can't wait to see the day when local play is no longer a limitation and get on a skype call with 4 guys and play this masterpiece. As I've said this game is new and there is room for improvement and I can't  wait to see it.

31253326.review:
Crawl ist ein Multiplayerspiel in dem Ihr einen Helden spielt und die anderen Spieler Geister die versuchen den Helden mit allerlei Fallen und Monster die sie aufrüsten können zu Töten. Wenn der Held getötet wird bekommt der Spieler der den Held mit dem letzten Schlag getötert hat die Chance den Helden zu spielen. Wenn ein Spieler Level 10 erreicht darf er über das Portal, dass in jeder Ebende einmal vorhanden ist (es geht immer weiter abwärts über Stiegen) zu dem Boss gehen der einer von bis jetzt (scheinbar) drei verschiedenen ist. Diesen können wiederrum von den Geisterspieler gesteuert werden.
Soviel grob  zu dem Großteil der Mechanik. 
Das Spiel ist gut ich muss, aber auch dazu sagen, dass es noch keinen Onlinemultiplayermodus hat. Dieser soll noch kommen und wird von vielen erwartet. Derzeit ist es nur möglich mittels Freunden lokal zu spielen und das ist notwendig. Natürlich kann man es auch alleine spielen, aber ich denke dann macht es nur halb soviel Spaß.
Ansonsten kann ich noch beanstanden, dass das Spiel durchaus stark erweiterbar ist mit viel mehr Bossen, noch mehr Monstern weiteren Spielmodi oder auch mehr 
Fallen usw...
Positiv ist noch zu sagen, dass nach jedem durchspielen weitere Monster, Götter die man anbeten kann (geben kleine Boni + geben die Startmonster vor) und Gegenstände frei geschalten werden. Dies motiviert auch noch dazu weiter zu spielen.

Ich gebe dem Spiel 7 /10 Punkten, weil da noch viel mehr geht und weil man derzeit Freunde einladen muss damit man das ganze Spielgefühl von Crawl hat.

Ps: habe es bis jetzt ca 5 Stunden gespielt, eine Stunde alleine und ca 4 Stunden mit Freunde.

31239614.review: Sem dúvidas um dos Multiplayers mais divertidos que já joguei na vida. Gosta de jogos com multiplayer local? Compre! Gosta de jogos estilo arena? Compre! Gosta de jogos com bastante ação? Compre! Gosta de jogos com elementos de RPG? Compre! Crawl é um multiplayer arena free-for-all (si por si) com um algumas pitadas de coop onde ganha o jogador que conseguir manter sua forma humana e derrotar o chefe final. Os demais jogadores assumem inicialmente o papel de criaturas fantasmagóricas e posteriormente demoníacas quando ativam pentagramas no chão, se tornando aleatoriamente em 1 das 3 criaturas que sua "divindade" escolhida representa (o jogo dispõe de uma boa quantidade de "deuses" que tem variadas combinações de criaturas e conferem bônus iniciais diferentes), que  que caçarão o jogador humano, podendo evoluir sua forma ao longo do jogo. Além disso os jogadores na forma de fantasma podem possuir e tomar controle de armadilhas para causar danos ao humano. Para se tornar humano basta que você desfira o último golpe sobre ele, porém você será a caça da vez! O humano conta com loja para aprimoramentos, com armas diferentes, magias e power ups, além disso, assim como num RPG tradicional ele ganha EXP e sobe de nível, e ao atingir o nível 10 ele pode adentrar pelo portal e tentar dar fim ao chefe da dungeon (aleatório), que será controlado pelos outros jogadores. O jogo dá 3 tentativas aos jogadores para enfrentar o chefe e caso o humano não consiga até a última o jogo acaba em "empate". Cada jogo terminado geralmente libera coisas novas como novas divindades, armas e evoluções, dando uma sensação de recompensa muito boa. O único contra que achei gravíssimo é que algumas evoluções (me refiro as evoluções finais) são um tanto quanto desbalanceadas, podendo tomar a vida do jogador humano com uma facilidade absurda.

31220408.review:
这种多人互坑的游戏是坠棒的啦！
游戏操作性挺强，而且还有丰富的探索和收集部分，不仅是作为探险者孤军深入，而且还是各种怪物的主宰，控制怪物的成长。
玩家轮流扮演探险者和怪物，这是这个游戏最具创意和潜力的部分。
因为多人模式怪物也是由玩家操作，因此难度是AI所比不上的，各种猥琐凶悍套路，真能打得人哭，这也正是游戏有趣的部分，用各种手段阻止或者通过关卡，在对抗的同时充满娱乐，非常酷。
通常的类似探险/迷宫/RogueLike游戏，玩家或组队或单人，面对的是开发者事先设置好的AI怪物，地形陷阱等，而本作的玩家对抗使得游戏性大增，开发者再也不用费尽心思设置怪物AI（当然还是需要考虑技能属性，我指的是怪物活动/攻击方式等），在精通操作的玩家手上，苍蝇也能杀死探险者。
此外就是游戏风格，克苏鲁背景，像素的画面表现，及“恐怖”的8BIT背景音，充满怀旧，和朋友一起，仿佛回到了红白游戏机的时代。
TIP：希望开发者增加中文，谢谢。
TIPP：别忘了使用机关和各种摆设!!
TIPPP：出联机模式这游戏还能再卖十万份！

The whole point of the game? To be the one adventurer to kill the boss and escape the dungeon, leaving your poor friends lost souls to rot! Whilist the rest of the of the players work together to bring you down, steal your humanity, and make a break for the exit theirselves.

Well enjoyed, thank you

31195831.review:
Should you buy this game? 

Yes.

Crawl is a arcade throw back of yester year (even has a cabinet display option) in which you and up to three friends (or AI if you don't have any friends) face off in local multiplayer in seeing who can hit level 10  by slaying monsters and buying new equipment first to face off against the boss to gain freedom!.. With the other players attempting to murder you and wear your flesh as a suit so they can attempt the same.

In between the levels players have the chance to upgrade their monsters by evolving them into such things as Beholders or Demons at the every end of each monster tree (with more being unlocked after each successful game).

Having played a few games myself I would advise against buying this if you just want a single player game, it's still fun against the AI but the real enjoyment is watching the light of your friendships fade as you rob them of their hard fought victory and win the game yourself, well that's the real enjoyment for me at least (#notsorryChris).

31192943.review:
Estos van a ser los $12 mejores gastados de tu biblioteca de steam. Ahora que el juego salió de early access y ya está en su versión 1.0, lo sigo afirmando: es espectacular.

De lo mejor que vas a poder jugar con tus amigos en modo local como en los viejos tiempos. Un juego que esconde mucha estrategia, y un fenomenal sistema de progreso. Y lo mejor de todo, muy balanceado. Fue una gran sorpresa que me vino junto a un bundle, y cuando vienen mis amigos a la casa, fijo lo jugamos.

Gráficos pixel art con un toque muy original, y animaciones fluidas y vistosas. EXCELENTE música (aunque se echan en falta algunas piezas mas. No estaría mal). En esta versión le agregaron una especie de tutorial con una narrativa muy buena. (va a ayudar mucho a los que lo juegan por primera vez)

Si disfrutas de los juegos multiplayer locales, no dudes ni un segundo en comprarlo. es un must have

10/10

Crawl ist ein legendär gutes Spiel.
Grafik ist halt pixelart, wovon ich eigentlich kein zu großer fan bin, aber im Fall von Crawl
passt sie wirklich sehr gut, da man sich die Details besser selbst vorstellt, oder erahnt.
Die Musik dazu passt hervorragend, man könnte sie sich auch so anhören ohne dass sie nervt.
Das Gameplay wird einem am Anfang in einem gelungenem Tutorial beigebracht, es ist aber weder zu komplex,
noch zu langweilig. Es gibt eine Menge Items und Spells, leider sind da manche noch etwas zu stark oder zu schwach.
Man kann sowohl gegen einen Computer, als auch gegen Freunde spielen.
Ich liebe die Spielidee, dass sich Teams ständig tauschen, so macht sogar verlieren Spaß, da man dann gegen den besseren Spieler verbündet kämpft.
Ich weiß jetzt schon dass ich Crawl noch lange spielen werde und für 15.- ist ein ein wiklich gelungenes und lustiges Spiel.
Ich kann den Kauf nur empfehlen.

31170125.review:
본 글은 지극히 개인적인 생각입니다.

나름 재밌긴 합니다. 단, '오래 할만한 게임이냐??'라는 질문에는 긍정적으로 대답할 수 없을 것 같습니다. 플레이 방식은 다른 분들께서 잘 설명해주셨고, 저 또한 그걸 보고 샀습니다. 이 게임의 장점에 대해서는 이미 언급된 게 많으니 따로 자세히 얘기하지 않고자 합니다. 확실히 친구랑 하니까 재밌습니다. 또, AI 자체가 뛰어난 편이라서 친구가 없어도 어느 정도는 즐길 수 있을 것 같기는 합니다. 

한편, 여러 문제가 있는데 저는 이것들 때문에 결국 환불을 했네요. 
먼저, 게임 플레이 자체가 굉장히 짧으며 맵의 다양성은 전혀 존재하지 않습니다. 스샷에 보이는 맵이 전체라고 해도 과언이 아닙니다. 저렇게 생긴 맵들이 여러 개가 있고, 그 맵들에 있는 몬스터(마법진) 등을 다 잡으면 다음 챕터로 넘어가게 됩니다.다음 챕터로 넘어가는 이유는 레벌업과 새로운 아이템 파밍이 목적입니다. 레벨이 중요한 이유는 렙10을 찍어야만 보스 몬스터 도전을 할 수 있기 때문입니다. 아이템은 상점에서만 구할 수 있게 되는데요. 한 명이 살 경우 다른 사람은 살 수 없습니다. 또 상점에서는 무기3개, 각종 스텟 업글 아이템3개, 스킬 변경 아이템 2개 등으로 소량의 아이템만 매 챕터마다 제공됩니다. 그래서 다음 챕터로 넘어가야만 하는데요. 이게 챕터마다 맵이 똑같기 때문에 반복 플레이로 인한 지루함이 꽤 있습니다. 

무기를 비롯한 아이템과 몬스터의 다양성 부족은 이 게임에 대한 지루함을 더합니다. 게임을 할수록 언락되는 아이템이 많아서 총 아이템의 개수는 많아 보이지만, 위에서 언급했듯이 챕터마다 제공되는 아이템이 매우 적어서 결국은 적어보이네요.  몬스터는 유저가 어떤 선택을 하냐에 따라 업글을 통해 다양성을 추구하고는 있지만, 그 수 자체가 워낙 적기 때문에 결국 후반부에는 지루하게 느껴지고 맙니다. 또한, 어떤 분류(?)를 선택하냐에 따라 조종하는 몬스터가 달라집니다. 이 분류도 꽤 수가 되는데, 서로 겹치는 게 조금 있는 것 같더군요. 


게임의 엔딩 방식은 이 게임에 대한 실망감을 더해주었습니다. 레벨 10을 찍고 보스를 잡을 경우 엔딩을 보게 됩니다. 총 3번의 시도를 할 수 있고, 잡게 되면 인간이 잡지 못 하면 몬스터가 승리합니다. 보스는 페이즈에 따라 유저(몬스터)가 조종할 수 있는 패턴이 늘어나는 것 같더군요. 그런데 이 보수의 개수가 그렇게 많은 편은 아닌 것 같습니다. 무엇보다도 보스 하나를 잡게 되면 게임이 끝나는데요. 같이 하는 친구의 실력 등에 따라 보스를 굉장히 쉽게 잡을 수 있다는 겁니다. 만약 한 판 더 한다면, 이전 판에 있던 일들을 그대로 다시 하게 됩니다. 이건 제게 굉장히 지루하다는 느낌을 주었습니다.

한 줄 요약하자면, 간단하게 한 두 판 하기에는 재밌으나 그 이상은 지루한 게임입니다.

31141471.review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review [/h1]

Crawl is a game developed and published by Powerhoof

Crawl is an excellent couch co-op game which encourages you to work together as a team to end the hero's life, then take their place and fight your way to salvation by besting the cthulhian horror that resides at the end of it all... or die and have your humanity stolen, only to be cursed to rot forever amidst your wrath in the infinite tombs of Crawl

Monsters scale well over time, going from murderous nuisances to outright tough-as-nails murderbeasts whereas hero weapons and abilities are interesting and varied

Buffs and debuffs provide an additional strategic layer which raises the game from simply "good" to "great". There's a heavy cyber-lovecraftian theme which elevates the mood. It's immersive and tense, appealing to that intrinsic desire to survive which exists within every human

It doesn't have online multi-player, but that's a small concession for what is such a tight and cohesive array of elements that come together and create an experience that'll have you sweating from the sheer intensity

Even if you don't have enough people nearby who can slum it on your couch to gather up 4 players, Crawl provides a powerful AI that will keep you on your toes

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

31127743.review:
Uno de los mejores juegos que puedes obtener en esta plataforma. ¿Quieres algo para jugar con tus amigos? ESTE ES TU JUEGO.

POSITIVO: 
-Multijugador local que revive la convivencia con amigos/familiares.
-Banda Sonora atrapante.
-Gráficos característicos que atrapan de gran manera la atmósfera presentada.
-Gameplay excelente, facil de entender.
-Variedad de items <3 
-Logra muy bien el efecto de "competencia" entre los participantes.
-Muchas alternativas de personaje, lo que le da rejugabilidad.
-"Creo" que la estructura de los mapas se genera al azar en cada partida. 

NEGATIVO
-La estética del mapa en cada partida no cambia mucho. (Sería interesante poder jugar en un castillo o en una iglesia abandonada, etc...) 
-Quizá debe haber una mayor cantidad de "bosses". 

CONCLUSIÓN: 9.7 
No me había divertido así desde hace años, es una experciencia sumamente satifsfactoria que te robará muchas horas de tu dia. Es adictivo y fascinante. Un aplauso para el estudio desarrollador, tienen a una obra maestra en sus manos. 
(Espero que lo sigan actualizando ;D )

¡Saludos!

31109901.review:
Crawl is an excellent couch co-op game which encourages you to work together as a team to end the hero's life, then take their place and fight your way to salvation by besting the cthulhian horror that resides at the end of it all... or die and have your humanity stolen, only to be cursed to rot forever amidst your wrath in the infinite tombs of Crawl.

Crawl hits all the right notes:

Monsters scale well over time, going from murderous nuisances to outright tough-as-nails murderbeasts
Hero weapons and abilities are interesting and varied
Buffs and debuffs provide an additional strategic layer which raises the game from simply "good" to "great"
There's a heavy cyber-lovecraftian theme which elevates the mood. It's immersive and tense, appealing to that intrinsic desire to survive which exists within every human.

I love the fact that your scorecard is saved between runs. I also laughed out loud when the game told me that my hero had been "lost forever" because we ran out of attempts against the boss (and then it deleted my scorecard, a really nice touch).

I never felt like any of my deaths were unfair, or that any of the monsters in particular didn't come with their own weakness to exploit. Your decisions really shape your hero and you'd do well to expect your enemies to exploit gaps in your defense.

It doesn't have online multi-player, but that's a small concession for what is such a tight and cohesive array of elements that come together and create an experience that'll have you sweating from the sheer intensity. Even if you don't have enough people nearby who can slum it on your couch to gather up 4 players, Crawl provides a powerful AI that will keep you on your toes. I especially thought it was a nice touch when the AI even goes through the human motions in shops and goes through upgrade menus like a regular player - its an oddly salient touch that I didn't know I wanted until I saw it.

31109447.review:
Crawl is amazing. It's a very unique and exciting local multiplayer game to play with friends. In short, one player is the hero and all other players (human or AI players) control the dungeon's traps and its monsters. Whichever of those gets the killing blow against the hero becomes the hero, and the dungeon crawl continues.

There are really good self-balancing systems built into the game that helps players who are "behind" to have a lot of fun and catch up, and there's a lot of variety between all the creatures, weapons, abilities, procedural level generation, and end bosses so that replayability is very high.

The only real drawback in Crawl is that the multiplayer is limited to local only. To that end I recommend playing with a controller, and if possible, treat it as a console game and play it on a big screen like a TV.

The art is incredible, the music is awesome, and atmosphere is wicked and the game's mechanics are really damn cool. I love this game, I'd give it a solid Spinal Tap 11/10 if I could.

31098995.review:
Maintenant qu'il est sorti je pense qu'il est temps pour moi de le recommander, Crawl est un EXELENT jeu en coop, graphismes et ambiances léchées musiques entétentes et surtout un gameplay plein de suprise bien pensé qui ne laisse personne sur la touche.
Parlons peu mais parlons bien: dungeon crawler, multijoueur, un hero, trois fantomes... Son but survrivre, leur but exactement l'inverse : qu'il meur... Pour cela les fantomes s'incarneront en monstres et le joueur devra survivre a leurs assaults. De NOMBREUX monstres, de NOMBREUSES armes, de NOMBREUX objets. Chaques partie est fun et unique, le gameplay est simple, déplacement et deux boutons casiement pas ce combos MAIS que de joie et de richesses. Que ce soit le contrôle des monstres ou l'utilisation des armes il vous faudra du doigté de la prudence et surtout de la malice...
A 4 c'est simplement super et les devs on pensé a vous (et moi) gens de peu de moyens: pas besoins de 4 manettes: souris et claviers fonctionnent, la recognition et compatibilitée est parfaite...
Quand au visuels le coté pixel art très bien léché et très cohérent rappelle qu'il vaux mieux de gros pixels que des dessins tout moches ultra texturés (salt & sanctuary coucou), gagnant en lisibilitée et en sympatie. Le jeu est beau l'ambiance est unique et réussie et l'humour fonctionne très bien.
Si vous cherchez un jeu pour vous amuser a plusieurs ou même seul un petit dungeon crawler très bien réalisé... FONCEZ!


Petit moins j'attendais ces fameux environements variés prévus, mais attendons qui sait...

31083621.review:
Crawl is one of the most fun local multiplayer games I have ever played, with a unique mechanic whereby players take control of the dungeon and become the hero by killing him. The hero is more powerful than the monsters, so the non-hero players are forced to co-operate to whittle down his health, but once he's at low health that spirit of co-operation goes out the window and everyone is trying to land the final blow for themselves. This game's balance is extremely tight, barring a few exceptions (bows are the worst starting weapon in the game by far) and it's always a blast to play since the games aren't too long.

The mid-game is where Crawl truly shines, as the monster players have gained enough power to defeat the hero and he has yet to gain the powerful late-game equipment that would allow him to defeat such threats. At this point the game becomes a race, where you want to grab enough upgrades to be able to take on the bosses, but not spend so much time in the dungeon that you die and lose your spot as hero.

My only real complaint about Crawl is that I wish there were just a couple more bosses, as for most of the early access period there were only two, and now they have come to full release adding on just one last boss. The boss fights are fun, but with such a limited pool they get old fast, with optimal attack patterns that are easy to counter as the hero.

31082705.review:
[b]简评[/b]
轻度Roguelike生存大乱斗

[b]玩法[/b]
随机地城（楼层，含若干房间）
最大4名玩家（或1玩家+3AI）
当前玩家（人型）会受到其余三名玩家（幽灵）的攻击
幽灵可利用房间里的陷阱道具，或者召唤可以控制的怪物（开始游戏前选择其中三种）
当前玩家被集火推倒之后，化为幽灵，下一顺位的幽灵得以化为人型
上一过程持续循环
直到有玩家击败BOSS或者某玩家累积被BOSS击倒三次（后者不太确定），通关结算
BOSS也可以被幽灵玩家所控制
每一层地城皆有商店，大概40种武器，60种被动道具，10种主动道具（闪避，冲撞等），还有升级用的药瓶（先手进商店的药瓶全买走，美滋滋）
每一层结算时都能升级幽灵形态可以控制的怪物，种类繁多（60+？不确定）
另有独特的条件限定型挑战模式，是男人就活一百层系列拯救手残QAQ

1.0 DEVS CONGRATS!!

This has been our main "family-get-together" game since EA  (wife, her sis and husb).

Couch, 4 game-pads (steam now compatible with PS4 natively) , decent TV with the laptop on HDMI is the best!

One of the greatest parts of this game is how drastically everything changes with the different ppl you play, or how they develop their play styles, a skeleton in the hands of my wife is vastly different than one played by my little sister.

An example of the different styles: my wife loves all the bleeding buffs as hero and building the necromancer for an army of terror, my lil sister focuses more on monster play with items to buff her monsters as well as rush dragon and make your life a burning hell, and her husb is all about floating weapons and trashing your day with that damn lazer spell, I HATE that spell (please don't change it!).  

And it doesn't stop there either!  Everyone has their strength when playing the boss and it is always amazes me how everyone will quick build a strategy to take the hero down during the boss fight, 3 human brains crammed into one boss is better than any hell mode AI and managing to beat them on occasion is the most rewarding thing ever!

  666/666 - would have my soul lost forever by my family again... and again!

PS - This game NEEDS a 4player arcade cabinet!!

31079801.review:
[h1] I like Crawl. [/h1] 
Mostly because it's a "couch competitive" RPG where [b] when you're not the hero, you become the monsters. [/b] The stronger the hero gets, the stronger your monsters get, until you become strong enough to defeat the hero and take his place. This is a great concept that was very well executed. The animations are spot-on, the music adds to the tones of desperation and violence, the mechanics are simple enough that anyone should be able to get familiar with them in a brief amount of time, and the polish on details always feels that much closer to [i] just so [/i] with each update. I'm happy to say that, since receiving this title with Humble Monthly, I have thoroughly enjoyed almost every aspect of the game. 

[list]
[*] Fun combat that makes every attack feel as good as the last one.
[*] Good music to set the tone for a variety of scenarios.
[*] Simple and straightforward mechanics to keep the game progession strong.
[*] Consistently provides a unique experience every time.
[*] Playable without your friends by adding bots to the game. 
[/list]

[u] This is a great buy, especially if you have friends to share it with. [/u]

31075776.review:
What the HELL!!!


Fantastico juego. 

Recien salida la version 1.0 que mas se puede pedir por 5€....  ONLINE MULTIPLAYER claro :D :D


Adictivo, sencillo de manejar y muy divertido.

4 amigos invocan  un ritual que provoca que se maten entre ellos quedando uno solo para intentar conseguir la salvacion...  Podria ser el comienzo de cualquier juego mas con pixel art y mata mata sin mucho interes... Pero aqui los otros tres compañeros muertos en esos primeros segundos de juego seguiran como fantasmas intentando matar al que sigue vivo mediante trampas, invocaciones o transformandose en mostruos en los portales que lo hacen posible, recuperando la humanidad en caso de conseguir matar al vivo... Y asi sucesivamente hasta que algun jugador alcanza el nivel 10 y se enfrenta a uno de los bosses para derrotarlo y lograr su salvacion.


Partidas endiabladas de unos 30 minutos para lograr vencer nuevos boss (En cada partida es aleatorio) desbloquear nuevas armas para humanos, o mostruos para los entes fantasmales.

El sistema de puntos para evolucionar los mostruos esta muy bien implementado para mantener el equilibrio... Cuanto más suve de nivel un jugador mas puntos recibe el resto de jugadores para mejorar sus mostruos...


Los bots estan muy bien implementados, son duros y actuan de forma logica y muy puñetera. Buena IA


Solo hay una cosa que se echa en falta... Multijugador online. No suele ser tan facil juntar 4 personas para jugar en local, y aunque la IA esta muy bien, contra otros jugadores siempre es mas divertido.

Muy recomendable.

31075029.review:
[h1]Le meilleur moyen de passer une bonne soirée ! [/h1]

Crawl fait partie des meilleurs jeu compétitif local dont j'ai pu jouer dans ma vie. Tout est fait pour faire des coups traitres pour pouvoir achever l'humain et ainsi prendre sa place. Ainsi, les positions ne sont pas figés et les changements de rôle s'effectuent regulièrement. Les fantômes peuvent prendre le contrôle de monstre bien sûr mais aussi de statues redoutables, de pièges fourbes ou même de mimic (coffre). Les mimics sont d'ailleurs redoutables mais ne possèdent qu'une vie, il faut donc en prendre possession discrètement et attendre sagement que l'humain s'approche pour le dévorer.

Parfois on fait équipe entre fantômes mais cela ne dure jamais, faut bien lui donner le coup de grâce à ce satané humain. On peut faire évoluer ces monstres entre chaque étage, les points d'évolutions que l'on gagne correspondent au nombre de niveau que les humains ont gagné pendant l'étage. Ainsi les monstres restent toujours à un niveau suffisant pour pouvoir tuer l'humain.

Une fois le niveau 10 atteint, un humain peut tenter de combattre le boss qui sera controlé par les trois autres joueurs en même temps. Ça donne des moments bien loufoques ou le boss fait n'importe quoi parce que personne ne se coordonne. Heureusement, tuer le boss est assez complexe si on fait un minimum équipe, pour réussir l'humain devra avoir acheter de l'équipement puissant au marchand de chaque étage. Ils sont variés et les armes achetées offre parfois des capacités surprenantes. 

Bien sûr Crawl n'est pas parfait, ses contrôles peu précis dus à son style arcade pourront en dérouter certains mais on s'habitue vite. 

[b]Après plus d'une quinzaine de partie (pendant l'accès anticipé) je n'ai pas encore tout vue et chaque partie qui dure environ 30-40 min a réussi à rester surprenante. La 1.0 ajoute du contenu mais rien de très conséquent, le jeu était déjà très bon avant. Bref, On se marre, on s'insulte, Crawl vous fera passer une super soirée avec des amis ! [/b]

[quote] Envie de plus d'evaluations de ce genre  ? Suivez la page curateur >>[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28282773/] Sacrez'Art   [/url][/quote]

30192762.review:
Absolutely, without a doubt, one of the best couch multiplayer games I have ever played. In fact, just plain one of the best games I have ever played!

The gameplay is fantastic, tight and thrilling. You are one of four adventurers before you turn on one another in a quick and visceral opening scene. Once only one of you is left alive the rest of you take control of your spirits with the options to control monsters, traps and debris in each room as the remaining human player tries to progress. This creates a tense experience as you are always either fighting for your life, just trying to scrape through, or fighting for the chance to regain your humanity - if you kill the human you can restore your humanity and take control of your human body again. 

As excellent as the core gameplay is, it is the underlying systems that raise the standard to magnificent. The human needs to reach level 10, gaining levels by defeating monsters, then enter the boss room and defeat the boss to win the game. However, every time the player gains a level, making them stronger, the other players gain "wrath", a currency they can use to upgrade one of their three possible monsters. Each upgrade tier has two choices, offering a wealth of diversity, and indeed mayhem when all of the effects start flying. With the wrath mechanic those who are not playing as the human get progressively more powerful until they have a good chance of getting the kill and reclaiming their humanity once more. 

The mechanics of play are simple to understand; one button attacks and another uses your "special", a choice of whatever spell that you choose to buy from the blacksmith, gold permitting.  We had two regular gamers and two non regular gamers and everyone was able to compete out fo the gate. Tutorialising is extremely clever in Crawl, other than the buttons you are introduced to each of the ideas of the game through play; for example one of the bosses offers the chance to utilise a healer mid battle so before you enter the boss room he appears and gives you a glimpse of how it works. It is an extremely clever and intuitive process. Similarly, when you enter a new room items that you can interact with flash. 

The meta game is really quite engaging, too. At the start of each run you choose a deity to worship; this determines the three monsters you are able to use during the run and also a passive bonus. After each run you unlock new deities to worship, new weapons and spells to buy from the blacksmith, new monsters to play as and even new traps to utilise in the dungeons. All of this is to say that as you play more, the options increase and the game becomes even more varied on each play through. 

In summary, I can't praise Crawl enough. I thoroughly enjoyed every tantalising moment of play, every death throe and every victory. For anyone that enjoys gathering some friends and playing together, both in competition and in co-operation, you can't do any better than Crawl. 


************************************************************
Feedback for the Devs:
First, thank you for this amazing game!

Second, in my humble opinion, I think a few elements could be tweaked to improve the awesomeness:
The monster with the shield special; I think then cooldown is too short when coupled with his impressive speed.
Player colours; red and orange can become confused in the heat of play.
Loss of control; occassionally it is hard to determine why a player cannot attack (such as when on a pool).

Lastly, a few ideas we had...
Game modes! Such as on death rotating to the next player in line, rather than on kill. Or a human's health ticks down, ensuring that each turn as the human is finite and the rotation is more likely.

Thank you again, for the wonderful Crawl. 
***************************************************************

30042137.review:
Completely surprised by how incredibly fun this is! If you like local multiplayer games, this is pretty much a must!

At first glance, this looked like a funny concept that would be amusing for a game or two. Little did I realize how addicting this game can be!

Pros:
+Very simple controls (only two buttons)
+Tons of unlocks and reasons to grind. There's a very large amount of content to unlock through continued gameplay, and what feels like virtually unlimited, Mugen-esque mod potential.
+ AI bots - you can play this alone with AI bots tagging in for other players. No need for friends to enjoy it!
+ Excellent balance system - Your hero levels up by killing monsters, and your monsters level up by other players' heroes leveling up... meaning in one player is dominating, everyone else gets stronger monsters to try and beat them back down
+ Out-of-game challenges - Practice with monsters between games and see what you've unlocked
+ Large variety of spells and equipment - Get awesome powers and cool weapons with both magic abilities and even cursed gear
+ Cool boss battle concept - Try to win the game with 1vAll boss fights

Cons (with suggestions): 
- The game has the potential to drag - With random gear in the shop, a hero can get powerful quickly or struggle to survive a few rooms in a row. Bosses can be rough without good gear, so there's no easy way to predict if a single playthrough will last 30 minutes or 90. There could probably be some sort of adjustable gold/XP/item-power/wrath settings that would allow players to customize for faster or slower playthroughs.
- Only two buttons - Your ghosts have an Inhabit/Attack button, and a Special Attack/Exit button. Many a fight has been thrown at a critical moment by checking for a special attack only to basically forfeit the fight by leaving a monster/object. Just adding a third button for Inhabit/Exit would solve this
- No online play - I really, really hope this is something they look into. I would buy a half dozen copies of this in a heartbeat if they added this feature.
- Endgame item shopping is often a buyout - As you get to deeper levels, gold accumulates quickly and being the character alive when you enter the item shop usually turns into a shopping spree as you buyout most of the floor. It can be rough to keep your hero alive in endgame without proper gear. The game has a great mechanic of letting a new player teleport to the item shop after reviving his hero AND clearing the room, but that often doesn't help much if you're the second or third person to get to the shop that floor. And if you're undergeared, you probably won't live to the next floor/shop. I should stress, though... while this is an annoyance, it IS NOT game-breakingly bad by any means. This could be fixed with some sort of minimum item system per-player per-floor.

Neutral notes:
o The game is 1-4 players, and the mood of it changes a lot based on how many there are. 1v1 is a game of slow whittling and constant annoyance. Monster fights are sniping and kiting and trying to break them down over the course of rooms. 4-player games are basically royal rumbles every-other room, and the hero is swarmed with monsters, dies, is replaced by another player's hero who now still has to deal with the leftovers. Control often changes hands twice in a single room. 3-players is my favorite balance so far. Some sort of optional monster handicap setting could add more variety (option to boost in 1v1 for easier turnover, option to weaken in 4-player to make surviving longer easier)

30026338.review:
This is the best couch game out of all possible couch games. 

For context: I play a great deal of couch games with a great variety of people, and what I've learned is that it can be a *challenge* to keep everybody having fun throughout the night. It's one thing to play games with a bunch of Melee pros, or a gaggle of drunk newbies, but what happens when you put them together? Either you play gang beasts, and the tryhards are bored to death, or you put on Samurai Gunn and the poor boy/girlfriend who got roped in gets their ass handed to them for the rest of the night. It seems like there's always someone who isn't having fun. 

But not with Crawl.

The terrific basis of Crawl is that losing is *fun*. And the worse you are, the more fun it is. The more the tryhard in your group levels up, the bigger, uglier and more powerful your monsters are. Getting stomped for the first half hour? That's ok, now you have a *giant chicken ogre* to stomp that ****er with. It also serves as an auto-balancing system, so that even the worst player in the group has a chance for an epic comeback. 

But on the tryhard side, there's a host of options and optimization to sink your teeth into, as well as plenty of things you can pick up to make things more interesting. When one of our guys felt he was rampaging a little too hard, he got the item that gave him massively discounted items in exchange for randomly being turned into a frog - and spent the remainder of the game alternating between a raging fireball of spells and getting pulverized as a helpless amphibian. Taunt the gods to make your victory even sweeter through self-imposed hard-mode. It's a blast.

Plus, the art's great. The gameplay is great. The variety and depth of content is great. The replayability is great. The dramatic lovecraft voiceovers at the start of every game are really, really great. 

There are a lot of good couch games this competes with. Duck game, towerfall, Gang beasts, speed runners... but crawl will always stay at the top of our list. If you've got that hard-to-please varied group of gaming friends who can't ever seem to have fun for a whole evening straight, this is the title for you.

29937276.review:
屠龙者
每个人，都想从这地牢中逃脱。
但讽刺的是，“英雄”只能有一个。
那么…
他从尸体上抽出了剑，低着头走到了门外。
一路的披荆斩棘，让他的战斗技巧愈加娴熟，身体愈发健壮。
现在能够阻挡英雄的，只有地牢深处的那条三头龙了。
「年轻的勇士，」突然有人叫住了他，「先等一下。」
是一个牧师打扮的老人。
「我从来没有见过有人能从里面活着出来的，所以请让我帮助你。」
英雄点了点头，朝着恶龙所在的洞穴走去。
这是怎样的一条龙啊！熔浆，霜雾与浓酸不停地从三头龙的口中涌出。单单是听到它被惊醒的怒吼，就足以让人胆颤。
但是没有选择的余地了，他和巨龙都不会轻易放过对方。获得自由或者葬身于地牢，都将由这场战斗决定。
「！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！！」
伴随着第三个龙头痛苦的哀嚎，巨龙硕大的身躯轰然倒地。喷涌而出的龙血溅满了英雄的浑身上下。
他高举手中的利剑，泪水却从眼角处漫出，打在满是血污的地上。
这场战斗，是英雄胜利了。
无论是怪物或是鬼魂，失去了巨龙的指挥，都将重新化为腐骨，或安息长眠。
久违的安宁又重新回归到了这古老的地牢之中。
只是，为什…么？！
光滑的龙鳞从身上各处破出，将龙血与人血混在一起。无论是手臂还是脸颊，都被密密麻麻的龙鳞覆盖了。
原始的恐惧与剧痛一同传遍了英雄的全身，与疯长的鳞片一起。他再也无法睁开双眼了。
与此同时，被英雄砍下的三只龙头重新张开了满是利齿的嘴，向着跪倒在地的年轻人跳了过去。
…
战斗中被击伤的牧师重新回到了战场上，想为拼死奋战的英雄提供治疗，帮助他战胜恶龙。
然而他的目光再也捕捉不到那个年轻勇士的身影了。
映入眼帘的，只有遍地的血污和一把被折断的长剑，以及那头重新站了起来的三头龙。
「你这怪物…！」怒极了的老牧师将他手中的魔法剑掷向恶龙。但回应他的，只有巨龙响彻地牢的咆哮声….

29656192.review:
Imagine finding someone on a cold concrete floor, the room devoid of any windows or open doors.  As he struggles to his feet he notices three of his best friends making the same discovery in the room.  Suddenly, as if a product of his own confusion, a voice shouts in from above telling him that only one of them will survive.  Scrambling to find something useful on the ground, he realized they must have heard that same voice!  Brought back to his feet by the safety of a knife, he notices there is only one left and his back is turned.  The knife is plunged into his back and he immediately falls to his knees with him in dismay.  Regretful thoughts and sobbing are interrupted by the voice again, “Get up, death is no means to an end in this vile place,” and to his uneasy comfort, his friends were floating above him in spirit.
	The mechanics of this game have created an incredibly balanced gameplay that is easy for anyone to get into, built on top of a wonderfully themed visual and auditory experience.  Now begins the intrepid narrative through the ever-changing procedural dungeons of Crawl.  This unique four-player split-screen game by the Australian studio Powerhoof starts you off against all your friends (or surprisingly intelligent AI) in a one-hit-to-kill brawl to decide who the hero will be first.  When you are not the hero, you are a ghost that may float around the map getting into whatever he or she may like.  They could inhabit furniture and throw it, they could command traps to aim and activate, they could interact with pictures and holes in the walls, and of course, summon and inhabit upgradable monsters on pentagrams.  Once a monster, or even a trap or furniture kills the hero, that ghost will take his place leading the exploration.  The goal in this game is to reach level 10 and challenge the player-controlled boss.  
	The cohesive design of the auditory and visual aspects of this game are really the biggest things that set it apart from others.  They had decided on a very low-resolution pixel art type of sprite style, which being paired with the chip-tune style of music creates a beautiful modern take on this classic style.  The title screen and name screen even say “Insert Coin” instead of “Press Start” and only allow you to enter three-character names like an old arcade box.  Many tiny details have been added to the game, proving how much time and dedication it must have taken to build such a piece.  From random seeming pixel glitches on the menu screen paired with auditory glitches, to rich item descriptions, to screen shake.  There is even a narrator at the beginning of rounds that tells the story slightly different every time.  If you are the type of person that is overwhelmed by this art style, which I will admit is pretty common when you first start playing, I urge you to play for a while and really give the game a good shot.
	Everyone I have showed this game to seems a little overwhelmed and intimidated at first, just due to the amount of things happening on screen at all times.  The presumption that you will not be good at this game at first, however, is one that could not be further from the truth.  Even if you cannot kill the hero and lead the charge, your monsters will continue to level up as the current hero does.  Inversely, if you are very good at this game and spend the whole time playing as the hero you may have good weapons, but your monsters will be weak and it will be significantly harder to become the hero again.  
Given the multiplayer mechanics, the balancing aspects of this game seemed to have just come together inherently.  It feels so very natural to play, and often times, will create some very unexpected outcomes.  The bosses require the ghost players to work together and coordinate their attacks; otherwise it will be all too easy for the hero.  


*********************Warning: Spoilers*************************
One boss has an arm that fires sludge that will slow down and damage the hero.  The other arm fires bubbles that will trap the hero and make the final boss weapon much easier to hit.  The last weapon is an enormous eye laser that moves very slowly, but if the other teammates have done their jobs correctly, it will make short work of any level hero.  The other boss is a three-headed elemental dragon that has somewhat similar mechanics, but requires a different strategy.  There is an NPC in this boss fight that heals the player, which means the dragons best bet is to stay between the hero and the health.  As interesting and fun as these bosses are, more bosses would add a lot more variety to each dungeon adding much more replay value to this game.
********************End Spoilers**************************
  
	After playing “Crawl” with lots of friends it has easily found its way into my top five games.  The gameplay is chaotic, and challenging, and terribly competitive.  The overall style and design of the game makes it feel like a complete new artistic world to explore.  However, as full and entertaining as this game is, it is only in early access. It is not even finished yet, so go on steam and watch their wonderfully interesting trailers and support the designers at Powerhoof by getting your copy.

TL;DR

Awesome Game, go buy it and beat up your friends

29524819.review:
Simple controls that unfold into a bottomless well of tense competition, where you can always be a bit better but without the punishing learning curve of a fighting game. Ominous and exhilarating music and an aesthetic that consiatently nails 70's low fantasy art by way of 80's pixel medium while remaining perfectly legible until the slowly climbing density degenerates into a chaotic comedy of dungeoneering death. Brief periods of downtime, relieving the constant build of tension though no less posessed of interest than the mania of the larger game. Clever narrative touches that inform the players of their role in the nightmare even as they're invited to dip into the gleeful, cruel madness of children and bloodsports.

Happily will my fellow supplicants and I sacrifice more evenings, more ales at this altar. Crawl is the best couch-n'-controller game I've ever played. If it recieves a subtle comeback mechanic and a third boss before full release, it may well be the best such game I will ever play.

29307108.review:
Probably one of the best local multiplayers in gaming history. Awesome, awesome stuff.

PvP with a campaign and a twist. Mix of a roguelite, ARPG where both players attempt to slay the same boss. The twist is - only one player can be the hero. Other controls the monster(s) and traps. As you kill the hero as monsters, you'll turn the human instead. Players can attempt killing the boss at level 10. Trick is, you only gain XP as human.

As the player delves deeper in to the dungeons, both players get to upgrade their unique monsters and are forced to make choices on how to level up them as well.

The game has surprisingly much complexity, considering the controls have just movement, ATTACK and SPECIAL buttons.

Add randomized gear/trinkets/spells, and trikle gorgeous pixel art & animation on top. It even sounds awesome.

Highly recommended!

29274648.review:
Definitely one of my favorite local-coop games and nearly the only one, I play alone, too, from time to time. It's always fun and gets more interesting from run to run, because the game being still in early access, it's getting better and more polished, too. What I really like, you always unlock some new items etc. after a run, sometimes you don't think, they won't change too much, but after the next run you are deeply satisfied.

OK: the gameplay: you and your friend/enemies try to get enough experience to defeat a big monster boss. What makes the game interesting: there is only one player that plays a living human being, the other ones are ghosts that can possess different objects/traps in rooms to kill the human or conjure monsters, at certain points. When the human dies, one of the others, a real player or the computer, can have the body of the human. You fight from floor to floor, earning gold, to buy interesting weapons and other upgrades at shops, one shop each floor.

I really love the controls, at first they felt clumsy and out of touch, but this is part oft the charme of the game, that it is rather difficult to aim et cetera: just brillant! Because everything in the game fits to each other. I love the retro graphics/pixel art/the music/sound, everything. 

Only one thing would be a negative aspect for me: there are far too less different end-bosses: there are only two of them.
And that makes the end-fights a little bit boring and repetive. I hope for much more (at least five?)!
Thanks!

If you want a game that gives you deep satisfaction and is perfect for killing some time here and then, without getting addicted, but always to be remembered in the best possible way: give it a chance, it's worth its money!

29130352.review:
Really great local multiplayer party game. Hack and slash, roguelike, action rpg with magic abilities and all the fixings! The great hook with this game is that you and your friends play AGAINST each other.

Gameplay:

This game is usually played with four players, and if you're short on players you can use bots instead. One character can be the "hero" at a time, while the others play as disembodied ghosts whose objective is to strike a killing blow on the "hero." Once a ghost accomplishes this, they then become the "hero." Ghost players can possess traps, objects, and summon playable monsters in an effort to kill the hero. With every creature the hero kills, that player receives experience and can level up. Once a player reaches level 10, they can go through a portal and fight the boss, and if successful, win the match.

After every playthrough you unlock more traps, monsters, and bosses.

Verdict:

Great party game to play together with friends on the couch, and a great way to end friendships :)

Even with bot enemies this is so entretaining, if you and your friends are fans of couch coop games, horror, action and fantasy this is a very recommended party arcade game.

29093853.review:
Extremely polished and brimming with content even in its Beta.

The 'Local Co-op Only' turned me off from buying it until I could ensure that I had people to play with but once that was sorted, it became a game I constantly show to new players and invite old players to play in sessions as much as I can.

It can be played with up to four players which is the best experience, however three works just fine. Two-player experience can be a bit stale and adding AI isn't optimal as it doesn't allow you to reach across the table and slap the person who just killed you, but it's still there!

Note that if you only have one controller, it is still possible to play smoothly with four players. Due to the simplicity of controls, you can have two players on the keyboard and one using the mouse whilst another can manage the controller.

Overall I recommend this game to anyone who can manage to get a few people over for a session. It looks beautiful, is constantly updated with more content and the content already in it is polished and functional.

This is a game that I would see popping up in my discovery queue and elsewhere on steam every now and then, and I was always on the fence about getting it. Over christmas I bought it on a whim, and oh boy am I glad I did that. This is probably the funnest couch co-op games I've played, and I'm constantly searching for local co-op games to test out with family and friends.

Standout Pros for me:
-Really fun take on 'king of the hill' style gameplay
-Plenty of diversity each round due to upgrades and monster variety changing things up constantly
-Awesome catchy soundtrack
-Great competetive couch co-op fun with friends
-Interesting monster and gear upgrades to look forward to each game

Cons:
-No online multiplayer currently

Hopefully online will come in the future, but it's no big deal if it doesn't. I'm really looking forward to more updates and features in the future. Even in the current state this is definitely worth the $10 if you're looking for something to play on the couch with friends.

28999159.review:
One of the best early access games I've played. I've been wishing for this type of game ever since I was a kid. Basically you take turns playing as the hero, or the bad guys (ghosts, gouls, monsters, and traps). Whoever kills the hero becomes the new hero. You level up as a hero and as bad guys with an ultimate goal of defeating the boss monster. The mechanic of going back and forth between the hero and bad guys works seemlessly, and it is fun to play as both. 

I love the retro art style, music, and sound as they all fit well together and with the mechanics of the game. The game is quick to pick up, and I can't wait to play this with friends. 

Worth it at $10, and definitely worth it if on sale. Thus far I give this 10/10, and can't wait to see where they take it in the future!!!

I love the bit where you have to hit a bomb creature into a wall to unlock the door to one of the bosses, because you fight the boss in the same way and it basically teaches the player without having to tell them which is always appreciated. The challenge mode is fantastic, and all of the monster designs are pretty cool and you can tell and feel that they are upgrades to the starting monster which makes their kits feel familiar. I only had a few gripes with this game. one of the minor ones, is the title screen because the glitchy look you are going for just really hurts the eyes and doesnt fit with the game at all. A bigger gripe i had was that the monsters arent colored to match the player, so if a friend and i were playing the same monster or monsters we both had in our loadouts it got really confusing. Also when you first get the game you should have 4 monsters instead of 3 to start with so if you bought it to play with 3 other friends everyone could have a different character to use. overall i really liked this game and it is very promising and i highly reccomend it to anyone. one of the best early access games ive personally ever played!

28348030.review:
[h1]Crawl: Competitive Multiplayer Roguelike[/h1]

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

The gameplay is akin to The Binding of Isaac, you collect items in shops to further inhance your character whilst exploring a randomly generated dungeon filled with monsters, the difference being that it's a cometitive multiplayer experience, where you your friends or even cpus (which play near identically to a human) are ghosts fighting over a single human body, by killing the player in the human body you gain control of it and can upgrade yourself (each player has their own seperate pool of items).

But how exactly do you kill the human as a ghost, well as a ghost you're able to temporarely control one of three monsters (the monsters you get depend on which god you pick), when you damage and get damaged by the human you gain blood which will turn into gold if you become human, if the human levels up you gain wrath which lets you make your monsters evolve after someone ends the floor, these mechanics allow someone to easily jump infront which leads to a constant intensity in the gameplay.

The end goal is to defeat the boss monster, the boss monster can only be fought by a level 10 human, the boss monster is controlled by your opponets, whoever defeats the boss monster wins, if you lose you are still a human (you just have very low health), however there are only 3 total attempts shared between all players, whoever loses on the final attempt is the loser and the game ends.

[h1]Visuals[/h1]

This game has beautiful pixel art graphics which invokes a feeling of arcade cabinets from the 90's, every sprite is well done and fits the same theme, while there are flashes that might pose a risk to someone who is prone to epileptic seizures.

[h1]Audio[/h1]

The sound effects are very well done, all fitting the same theme.

The music is amazing, it's very energetic but not overly so which is very fitting for the gameplay.

[h1]Performance[/h1]

A potato could run this game with no slow down, it's barely intensive.

[h1]Price Efficiency[/h1]

This game will last you at least 3 action packed hours just by your self, you'll get an extra 1 or 2 hours from playing with friends, but if you play one run every now and then by yourself it will start to add up over time, I've got 13 hours just from playing this one or two runs and then setting it down, for $9.99 (usd) that's an amazing deal.

28096680.review:
--友情破壞 神作--
這是一款由1名玩家操縱勇者在地下城闖蕩  
其他玩家操縱鬼魂不斷的扯後腿 偷銃康弄死勇者的遊戲  
弄死勇者後便能趁機奪取其肉體 變成新的勇者 繼續他的冒險
只有補到尾刀的人才會變成新勇者  死去的勇者則變成鬼魂一方來繼續扯後腿
無止境的糾纏下去  直到有勇者擊敗魔王  遊戲結束
總之 就是個抓交替的遊戲

雖然仍在 early access   也有持續不斷的更新加入新玩意
早期的版本是遊戲一開始系統就隨機指定一名玩家當勇者 
現在的版本是 一開始所有人都是活著的  馬上就要展開廝殺 死掉的人當鬼 
被殺的不甘心  無止境的好基友

在地下城中 鬼魂可以走進招喚法陣隨機招喚出魔物 並操縱魔物來和勇者對抗
(每個人一開始選擇的邪神 旗下有3種魔物 可以持續升級進化下去) 
也可以附到陷阱上面偷婊勇者   附到箱子之類的環境物件上砸向勇者
避免一方獨大    
當勇者擊敗越多魔物  獲得經驗不斷的升級下去
操縱鬼魂的玩家就能獲得更多魔物的升級點數 來強化升級魔物 
操縱鬼魂的玩家 使用各種方式傷害勇者而獲得的血  
在自己成功捕到尾刀換自己當勇者時便能轉化成金錢  
即使等級輸人 也能靠財力購買強力的武器及道具 來縮小差距
(每個玩家當勇者時  勇者的武器.道具.技能.力量/敏捷/體力都是各自獨立的 各自修行的)
本遊戲目前只能單機多人   很可惜沒有線上對戰
邊緣人只能開AI來打    說實話AI調EASY就超強的了頗難搞
遊戲的操作很單純的只有上下左右 普攻A 技能B   卻能輕易的施展華麗的攻擊招數(只要普攻AAA連打)
比較適合使用搖桿遊玩  因為鍵盤對於左上 右上 左下 右下等4個方位不容易按  面對AI的風騷走位很痛苦
出乎意料地居然能使用滑鼠來玩..

遊戲裡有高達40種武器能夠解鎖  雖然有些武器是重複性質的 但就是差在性能及其能施展的華麗攻擊招數的不同
如長矛A是飛撲突刺>左右橫掃>向前連刺  
長矛B可能是向前刺>繼續連刺>把矛投擲出去變成遠程攻擊
長矛C可能附有魔法 向前刺>繼續連刺>左右橫掃  有機率發動魔法特效
(實際上應該是41種 最後一種是困難模式:無武器  全程只能使用投石索來戰鬥  )

高達55種魔物能夠操縱(含低階魔物至高階進化魔物)
高達56種道具及技能書
高達51種地下城場景物件.陷阱
還有數個邪神能選擇
(決定一開始的3種魔物 以及一些特殊模式 像上述的投石索 或是陷阱傷害+25% 或是初始武器為雙刀匕首)
以上都能隨著遊戲進行而逐步解鎖(某次更新追加的蒐集圖鑑顯示之數量)
還能從魔物圖鑑裡遊玩操縱魔物擊殺AI勇者的挑戰遊戲 

在地下城中 勇者不斷的闖蕩 不斷的被鬼魂滋擾著尋找著能通往下一層樓的樓梯 或是商店(購買武器道具技能書的地方)
覺得已經累積了足夠的實力了便能直接前往傳送陣 傳送到最終之地挑戰魔王
連魔王戰也是由鬼魂附體魔王  想盡辦法銃康著
(至少要等級10等才能進入傳送陣   挑戰魔王失敗的話就會殘血被扔回地城  
失敗太多次的話傳送陣就會整個崩塌  直接GAME OVER 鬼魂獲勝)
只能單機多P的這款遊戲 也能馬上和身邊的損友們直接真人快打     十足的友情破壞

27964879.review:
This game revolutionizes 1v3 asymetrical gameplay by relying on an old game genre and reimagining it as a multiplayer experience. Basically, this game uses the dungeon crawler formula to pit one human or "hero" against 3 vengeful spirits. These teams are, however, not static. Ghosts can become monsters and control traps to attempt to defeat the human and steal his body for themselves.

At it's core, this is  not a dungeon crawler or an asymmetrical team game, but a cut-throat free for all game (often only really seen in boardgames or table-top games) where you must work together with your fellow players whilst plotting how you want to take them down at the same time. Thus, the race to salvation begins.

You need to reach lvl 10.
You need to defeat the boss.
You need to survive the pit.
But how can you defeat the hero without working together?
But are you able to defeat the boss with just the stats/equipment you have now?

But why are there no female hero sprites??? #triggered #ermahgerd #triggered

27713909.review:
Incredible game. I fully recommend buying. And if you're off-put by the lack of online multiplayer, don't be. Because playing with the AIs is basically the same experience you'd get from online multiplayer, except no lag, no cheaters, and more consistantly fun to play with enemies.

The game is amazing about balance, and it makes it virtually impossible for one person to fall behind and end up not having a good time. Here's how it works:
There's always one person who plays as the "Hero", with the other three (or other two or other one) playing as "Ghosts" who summon and inhabit monsters, as well as using traps and throwing objects at the player. Whoever kills the current Hero becomes the Hero, with the dead one becoming a Ghost. When the Hero levels up, each of the Ghosts gains 5 wrath. At the end of each floor, players can spend wrath to level up the monsters that they summon during the level. So if you spent most of the last floor as a Hero, you'll be stronger in that aspect, whereas your monsters will be struggling (it's generally better to have a strong human though, as that's how you actually win the game). So even if you're doing terribly and haven't killed the Hero once, you still have a decent shot since you will have the strongest monsters in the game, and so the best chance of becoming the next Hero. Ghosts also gain gold passively through their interactions with the Hero (although the Hero gets more), so weak Heroes can still afford to upgrade their gear once they get to a shop.

Overall this game is just wonderfully balanced, both by the premise as a whole, and the amazing level of detail the developers have gone into to ensure that the scales never tip too far in one direction. You'll also never find a more attentive and responsive development team, just looking at their forums or their community page alone would be enough for me to buy this game, regardless of the amazing fun that it is.

¿Tienes amigos en la vida real?
¿Tienes un sofá?
¿Te gusta la música épica y pegadiza?

Si es así, cómprate este juego.

Crawl se basa en el típico "dungeon-crawler" con estética de dragones y mazmorras con un toque desenfadado y unos gráficos retro (pixel art) que le van genial.

La idea principal del juego es vencer al jefe final tras descender a través de mazmorras llenas de monstruos, ¿típico, verdad?. Pues no. Los monstruos son controlados por tus amigos en una carrera por ver quien se lleva el último golpe para así poder pasar a ser el héroe y tener la oportunidad de subir de nivel y blablabla.

A todo esto, súmale que puedes elegir con qué monstruos quieres tratar de "robar la humanidad" a tus amigos y una tienda en las mazmorras donde podrás personalizar el estilo de juego de tu héroe.

Un buen resumen del juego sería: 
"¡YO LE QUITÉ MÁS VIDA, HAS ESTADO ESPERANDO PARA DARLE EL ULTIMO GOLPE MALDITO GUSANO!"

Nota: NO TIENE JUEGO EN LINEA NI FALTA QUE LE HACE. La experiencia de matar a tus amigos cara a cara es inigualable.

27416424.review:
A very refreshing game that is great fun to play with people who are not that used to video games.

Crawl is pretty beginner friendly with only 2 buttons and the 3 vs 1 gameplay with an elegant method of handicapping better players so the others stand a chance. Every content update has me stocked and even the art design and music are great for a game that I only expected to shine on gameplay.

The only criticism I have is that while the 2 button style seems intuitive, people new to video games seem to have more difficulties with understand when what button does what than using 4 buttons. It was obvious to me as a gamer but to uninitiated folks the semantic category of what the buttons do seems to be harder to grasp. 

Still, it is a very fun game to play on couch coop and I can't wait for new cute monsters and chains to rattle.

27361009.review:
Crawl es un juego rogue-like coop local 4 personas, ideal para jugar con tus amigos.

El juego empieza con un duelo a muerte todos contra todos, el ganador tendrá que sobrevivir hasta alcanzar el nivel 10 y matar el boss final. Los jugadores muertos en el duelo se convierten en fantasmas, los cuales pueden poseer monstruos (incluido el boss final) y trampas para matar al superviviente. Cuando un fantasma consigue matar al jugador vivo le roba su humanidad, jugando como vivo hasta que gane o lo mate un jugador fantasma.

Durante la partida los jugadores pueden comprar armas, habilidades y mejorar sus monstruos. Los niveles, salas y el boss final son aleatorios.

La IA de los bots es muy buena, aunque lo mejor es jugar con amigos.

Este juego es una joya del coop local, 100% recomendable.

It's a little bit complicated to play with 3 or 4 people using only a keyboard, but Crawl is still great game to play by yourself, due to the AI for the bots being so good. The controls are really easy to learn, and you can play it with only your mouse, which is good for me, because I love lying in my bed while my computer is a few meters away from me. All in all, it's a great game, so keep up the good work!

27327393.review:
Crawl has become, unexpectedly, one of my favorite games. As an indie game, it will be money well spent (privded you have people to play with for some fantastic couch co-op). Get it, its great.

I own a lot of shared/split-screen games. I tend to organize a bunch of team sports, and pre-drinking is mandatory. To this end, having simple to play, local co-op games is a must for some good rowdy entertainemt. Crawl is simple to play (moderately hard to master). There are only two buttons, attack and special but the hook is that it is dynamic 3v1 set up. A 'human' player competes against three 'ghosts' to gain enough levels to be the one that challenges the boss. Ghosts inhabit monsters to kill the 'human'. The one that lands the deadly blow becomes 'human'. As 'human' players level, ghosts get currency to in turn level up their mosters. Thus, if you can't get a kill on a human and everyone levels around you, you will have more to spen on leveling monsters, ergo a higher chance of getting the kill. As monsters do damage to humans they gain currency they can use if they become human in a shop to increase their effectiveness. Once someone reaches enough power to challenge a boss, the 3 ghots comibine to controll that boss to fight. Overall, the game design is solid, unique, and super fun. If there are no monsters to inhabit, ghost characters can controll various traps and jump into items to harrass the 'human'.

I've had this game for a long time and the developers are still providing updates with more monster evolutions, more items to purchas in the shop, and more trap dynamics. The only even remotely (possibly)negative thing is they have yet to add to the roster of end game bosses (currently there are only 2).

While the overall this is a simple game there is a slight learning curve (mainly what are the monster attack/specials, possible human specials). There is progression (unlocking monster evolves/items), but it is pretty quick. Super casual players may be turned off by this, but overall, whenever I bust this game out, response is always positive.

27024329.review:
Crawl!, estas atrapado tu y otras 3 personas en un cuarto extraño de una mazmorra, y solo escapara de ese cuarto el que gane una sangrienta batalla contra sus compañeros de habitacion, aqui es donde te pones en la piel de nuestro heroe cuyo nombre solo puede tener 3 letras (seems legit) para luchar a muerte contra los otros personajes, al final de la batalla, los tres muertos se convertiran en fantasmas destinados a seguir y matar al jugador que siga con vida para tomar su cuerpo y tener una oportunidad de escapar, se que suena extraño y retorcido pero he de decir que si bien solo llevo 8 horas de juego con crawl, debo decir que no me arrepiento de haberlo comprado a precio completo (por que ahora me vengo a dar cuenta que lo rebajaron TT.TT) en esas 8 horas de juego estoy por completar el juego al 100% pero aun asi no me arrepiento de nada, y mi amor por este juego me ha llevado a empezar otro analisis super detallado de los que acostumbro a hacer, que por cierto comienza... AHORA!

[h1] gameplay: [/h1] los controles de crawl pueden ser descritos con dos palabras, simples y funcionales, con mando de xbox 360 (que personalemte recomiendo jugarlo con mando) en nuestra forma de humano o monstruo en caso de los fantasmas nos moveremos con la palanca izquierda, atacaremos con A y con B ejecutaremos nuestra habilidad especial, y en nuestra forma ectoplasmatica podremos poseer objetos con A y con B invocaremos a un slime compañero, unos controles simples pero al mismo tiempo intuitivos y faciles de deducir

[h1] banda sonora: [/h1] el soundtrack de crawl es bastante simple tambien, unas tonadas en 8 bits que van bien con los graficos y la ambientacion, no sobresalen por nada en particular pero funcionan bien y para mi eso es mas que suficiente

[h1] mecanica: [/h1] esta vez, pasamos de cosas simples a uno de los juegos con la mecanica mas enrredada pero mas divertida con la que me he topado (despues de move or die claro) explique ya que al inicio tendremos que matar a nuestros 3 compañeros y que el sobreviviente sera perseguido por los fantasmas de sus compañeros caidos sedientos de venganza e intentaran matarlo a toda costa, para hacerlo podran poseer objetos como vasijas, carros de mina e incluso trampas, cada sierto tiempo (y con cada sierto tiempo me refiero a casi todo el tiempo) nos encontraremos con habitaciones con pentagramas en el suelo, si un fantasma activa el pentagrama se convertira en un monstruo y podra luchar directamente con el jugador con vida, el fantasma que mate al humano se convierte en el humano y le tocara a el sobrevivir, aqui viene lo realmente complicado, el jugador que controle al humano ganara oro conforme vaya avanzando sala por sala, este oro lo podra gastar en tiendas para mejorar su equipo y volverse mas fuerte, mientras que los fantasmas acumulan furia conforme el humano va progresando y ellos fallando al intentar matarlo, esta furia la podran usar al final de cada nivel para mejorar a las bestias en las que te puedes convertir siendo fantasma, el problema es que el humano no acumula furia, por lo que si llevas un buen progreso y no te has muerto, no podras mejorar a tus bestias y cuando mueras y te toque a ti ser fantasma, vas a sufrir, y eso... duele

[h1] contenido: [/h1] he decidido dejar esto para el final ya que es un tema que quiero hablar de manera seria, el juego esta en early acces (para los novatos, el juego aun no esta del todo terminado) por lo que aun falta contenido por agregar, pero con lo que he podido comprobar, le falta mucho contenido, digo, cuanto duraras con un juego que cuenta con dos jefes que se repiten todo el tiempo, armas que tienen diferencias pequeñas entre si, diferentes clases pero que aun asi muchas de ellas comparten transformaciones y un diseño de niveles que en cuanto te acostumbras se vuelve predecible? la verdad es que yo amo este juego, pero agradeceria que se pusieran a trabajar en nuevos jefes, nuevas clases, nuevas armas y si es posible, un modo multijugador online ya que le hace mucha falta (teniendo en cuenta que es un party game, ya veras tu) a lo que voy es que le falta contenido pero teniendo en cuenta que aun esta en desarrollo, confio en que cuendo este terminado, sera un juego rebosante de contenido

[h1] conclucion: [/h1] en definitiva crawl es uno de esos juegos que te encuentras poco en steam, un juego que no busca ser especial, pasarse con sus graficos o estafar a la gente, de hecho es todo o contrario, es un juego que busca entretener y ya, es simple en muchos aspectos pero roza la perfeccion en otros, y con amigos dejarlo pasar no es una opcion

[h1] nota final: [/h1] le doy a crawl un 8/10, puede que cuendo este terminado mi nota para este juego cambie, pero por ahora, basandome en el contenido del juego actual y el factor diversion, yo creo que esta nota es mas que justa, recomendadisimo por si buscas algo diferente y entretenido o para jugar con amigos

This game is an example to every game on early access

Even at this point, with the game continuing development in early access it's a great game to play with friends. If they were to stop now and release it I wouldn't feel like I'd wasted my money. The thing is though, they haven't stopped! They continue to release updates, to tweek based on user feedback, to add new things all the time.

I have no idea what the end goal for this game is but every time I load it up there's something new to experience.

Pros:
+ Great multiplayer fun (4 people in a room is awesome)
+ Unique concept
+ Beautifully designed monsters with so many varied abilities
+ Great level system to balance the game

Cons:
- Unable to play online (I believe this wont ever be an option)
- Outside of the main game the training grounds feel a little lacking

Really those cons do nothing to make the game worse for me though. Me and my friends have all enjoyed the game every time and only ever play the main part without really looking at the the "Vault" section

This is a great couch co-ompetitive game! I've been playing it pretty much during the holidays since its release, will be third year in a row now! This is the time of the year when I have people to play with as I visit family... uhm. 

The game itself has you battling to be the hero to kill the boss, you become the hero by killing the current hero with one of your possessed/summoned monsters or a possessed trap, this as you are a ghost. You level up both hero and monsters and the hero can equip various items bought in the shop. There are plenty of unlocks along the way, like new kinds of monsters and things that will appear on the map. While running around there are lots of things for the ghosts to interact with to hamper the progress of the hero. It's almost like a multiplayer rouge-lite. I like it in any case.

To shake things up your group can set house rules, like how early (level) you are allowed to try and kill the boss, if you get multiple tries, etc.

(Recorded as part of my Extra-Life 2016 charity stream)

Monsters and mayhem await in this asymmetrical dungeon crawl adventure.  While one player tries to be the hero, the others control an wide array of evolving monsters determined to inhibit their progress, because if they do they get a chance to become the hero.
