I'm not normaly a big fan of frantic hack and slash games mostly because my skills are found lacking in that area,
However the concept this game offers was just too good to passs up. 
I think the best way I could sum up the concept is 'co-op' king of the hill. Basicly the vengfull ghosts players are trying to work together to kill the 'hero' which in turn helps level the hero up.  Of course this team work is really just a set up to try and land the last hit so you get to take the spot as the hero. The longer you play as the hero the better chance you have of being the one to take out the final boss of the level.

I find the leveling system pretty nice as there is options for both the hero and the monster aspects for each player. The hero gains gold for wepons and spells while the ghosts wrath points for better monsters to use spend to long with the hero and it might be awhile before you get a shot and playing that roll again meanwhile as a ghost you arn't gaining as much gold and the items in the shop might all have been grabbed leaving you less likely to live much longer. 

so far I've only tried the solo player but I'm positive with a couple of friends the game gets that much better.

26398363.review:
One of the best local multiplayer games I have ever played, perhaps the best if I exclude tekken nostalgia. 

The core idea of this game is just THAT good. And it is executed brilliantly. Easy to pick up and play, it thrusts up to four players into a dungeon full of traps and doors to the unknown. One player is always the human, trying to stay alive and gain levels by fighting monsters. The monsters, however, are controlled by your "friends" - many rooms have pentagrams on the floor, which, when approached by a ghost player, allow the summoning of a ghastly creature from the depths. As the player character gains strength, the monster players gain "wrath" - which in turn allows them to upgrade their monsters to a new, unique form. This way, the 1-3 players that are not currently the human constantly gain strength, which usually means it's just a matter of time until the human falls...

And when he does, the "ghost" that struck the final blow trades places with the human, and gains XP and gold in his stead. The goal is to reach level 10 and challenge the boss of the dungeon. If you beat him, you win. If you lose, there are 2 more tries ANY player has to get out. Else, everyone loses. After a game you unlock more items to buy, more dungeon objects to encounter and use (at your own risk..) and more deities. 

At the beginning of each game, each player picks a deity, which will 1) determine what base monsters / upgrade paths are available to that player and 2) what passive ability / starting item the human form of that player has. There is a lot more diversity to this game than initially meets the eye, which is great. Dungeons are also procedually genereated, the intro varies a lot- it really tries hard not to get old anytime soon.

And on that it succeeds in my opinion. If you have any opportunity to get friends in on this - do it. You wont regret it. There are simple yet interesting combat mechanics to master, and every game unfolds differently, depending on deities and what the shop has to offer on each stage. It's really good. As for the early access, it's hardly noticable - I actually only remebered because of the frequent updates.

25791578.review:
Crawl is a single or up to four player local co-op game. The retro style and the pixel art is flawless. This games concept is interesting and well executed. You can play as the monsters or the hero. Who ever lands the final blow on the hero becomes the hero. If one player is really good at the hero the other player will have leveled up their monster meaning they can take over. Another great point is that when it comes to the boss fight the other three players get to each control a part of the boss while the fourth player tries to beat the game. The different upgrade paths in the monsters keeps the game diverse and intersenting.

Cons: one thing this game is missing is online co-op

This game is looking up to become a well polished multiplayer game. This game is great with friends and is a fun quick burst of gameplay.

[h1]This game brought me back to gaming outside of LoL.[/h1]

This game breaths life into the dungeon crawler genre with its smooth controls and original playstyle. There are only a couple monsters that feel remotly similar, but other than those few every monster is unique in its playstyle and every move you make counts. It's fast paced and as fun as advertised. 

What sold me for this game before purchase was the monolouge, and the actual game has no shortage of pre battle monolouges with that amazingly ghastly voices. I legitimatly get shivers on some of them. Every game that you start has a completely new monolouge that you have most likely not heard in any of your previous games.

The combat is very fair and you know what you did wrong if you die. The mosters have very cut and dry strengths and weaknesses. Though some of them require that you have a certain type of weapon to counter, or you're good at using special spells.

Very original and very fun. Worth every cent even in single player mode and once multiplayer comes out it is worth even more!

25090178.review:
good game


No but srsly in the recent years of degrading game depth/skill ceiling, increasing focus on pretty graphics and simply catering to the average person, this game is what you and your group of competitive gaming oldones need. It's easy to pick up, since its basically only two action buttons, but the sheer amount of movement, item and monster mechanics allow it to be played in uncountable ways. 


To cut to the point: This piece of software right here is pretty much a top-down twin-stick rpg/shooter versus/co-op game, currently only supporting local multiplayer. Controls are basically L-stick to move/aim, A to shoot/slash, B to dodge/special move.


The goal for every player is the same, kill the boss after reaching lvl10 in human form, to be released from the dungeon. A sudden-death at the start determines the first ''runner'' to enter the dungeon in human form, your slaughtered companions souls steadily haunting your every step to kill you and take away your humanity for themselves i.e. their try at defeating the dungeon. The dungeon in itself is harmless, but every trap and contraption can be used by the ghosts of the other players to make your run a living bullethell. Furthermore each room contains a differing amount of pentagrams which can be used as a ghost to spawn into a monster, each with its own unique moveset. These creeps can be lvled after every floor, levels in human form of enemy player determine your evolution points. Human Form spends picked up cash to get new weapons, artifacts, moves etc. each weapon with its own moveset, each ability with its own uses. After a human form hits lvl 10 they can enter the boss portal on every floor to have one of the three tries at defeating the boss, problem is, the boss is also controlled by the enemy players, making this whole game a really competitive experience best enjoyed if all players have the gitgud mentality.

Soundtrack is amazing, fits the game perfect, really raw dark 8bit sounds whose rhythm still keeps you looped into the game.
Graphics can be seen on screens.

Only missing feature is online-multiplayer, in other aspects this is a game I support in every way and would buy again just to support development and show my gratitude for creating this piece of art. 
Definitely worth more than 10bucks.






p.s. gitgud, dodge moves only, abuse the MoI, take the bow, crush the boss

In Crawl spielt man gleichzeitig mit- und gegeneinander. Nur wenn man zusammen hält, kann der Endgegner besiegt werden. Überlässt man den anderen Mitspielern aber zu viel hat man selber keine Chance mehr den Endgegner zu legen. Ständig behagt man sich also auch gegeneinander.

Mir hat Crawl in diversen Gruppen Spaß gemacht. Eigentlich fehlen mir nur noch viel mehr Endgegner (bisher nur zwei vorhanden).

4/5

24204381.review: Crawl ist ein sehr unterhaltsames Couch Koop Spiel, welches im Stil eines Dungeon Crawlers aufgebaut ist. Die Besonderheit hierbei ist, dass die Mitspieler selbst die Monster und Fallen kontrollieren und versuchen müssen den ebenfalls von einem Spieler kontrollierten Helden vom Durchqueren des Dungeons abzuhalten. Mit jedem Heldentod wird ein anderer Spieler zum Helden und versucht ebenfalls das Dungeon zu durchqueren. Das Ziel ist es, seinen Charakter auf ein gutes Level mit guter Ausrüstung zu bringen um den Endboss zu besiegen, welcher ebenfalls von den Mitspielern kontrolliert wird.  Die Steuerung ist derweil immer sehr einfach gehalten und sollte kein Problem für Leute die das Spiel das erste Mal spielen darstellen.  Die Monster leveln gleich mit den Helden, da mit jedem Levelaufstieg des Helden Erfahrungspunkte an die anderen Spieler verteilt werden, mit denen sie ihre Monster entwickeln können. Die zahlreichen Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten sind genau wie die Monster sehr unterschiedlich und regen zum Ausprobieren an. Dies sorgt zusammen mit den zufallsgenerierten Dungeons und den unterschiedlichen Heldenklassen für genügend Abwechslung und Langzeitmotivation. Kritikpunkte sind nur die Endbosse, von denen es im aktuellen Zustand des Spiels nur 2 verschiedene gibt, sowie der fehlende Online-Multiplayer. Dafür dass es im Early Access ist bietet Crawl aber genügend Umfang für gerade mal 10 Euro.

24124596.review:
A lot of fun already! With Lovecraftian horror and 8-bit pixel art, a couch competitive 3v1 dungeon crawler emerges from the depths.

[h1]How it works[/h1]

I've never played a competitive game with this mechanic before. A brief matchup at the beginning of each game determines who the "human" player is, and who the "monster" players are. The human player traverses the dungeon, looking for the stairs to the next level. The monster players control spirits who float around the room with the ability to possess traps, spawn slimes, and summon controllable demons for the purpose of killing the human player. If the human player dies, the monster player who landed the fatal blow assumes the role of the human hero while the former human player joins the ranks of the ghosts. The amount of monsters you kill as the human hero determines who wins the game, with a levelling system that gives boosts to overall health. Monster earn a separate class of EXP which can be used to upgrade their demons to even more powerful monstrosities. Human players also have the opportunity starting at level 10 to fight a challenging dungeon boss picked at random.

[h1]What it needs[/h1]

There should be a system to upgrade peak monsters' base attributes, though, as a handicap for less experienced players. I already love the balancing system though. Also, at this point, the music is very limited and gets pretty repetitive. Finally, attack controls feel a little gummy and could use work before you stop walking away from the game with bloody thumbs.

[h1]In conclusion[/h1]

Buy this game if you love dungeon crawlers, rogue-lites, and are looking for a very new twist on a classic genre to challenge your friends with. Don't have friends? Pick this up when it's on sale, you can still play the game with up to 3 AI players who range from competent to outright ruthless, but this game really shines the brightest when your opponent is on the couch next to you.

23825701.review:
Crawl - одна из наиболее увлекательных hot-seat игр в истории. 

При старте, каждый из игроков выбирает себе "архетип", от которого зависит дерево монстров, доступных для вызова, и начальные бонусы.

После старта (а играть может одновременно до 4 человек, причем если не с кем поиграть, можно выбрать ботов), игрокам предстоит сразиться друг с другом, что определит, кто начнет игру героем, а кто призраками. 

И тут геймплей разделяется - герою нужно искать сокровища, убивать монстров, избегать ловушек, покупать новое снаряжение, в то время как другие игроки как раз таки и играют роль монстров и ловушек - вселяясь в последние, и вызывая через пентаграммы первых. Также, собирая эктоплазму, призрак и без пентаграммы может вызывать слизней, атакующих героя. 

Само игровое пространство уровня поделено на комнаты, и в одной из комнат есть переход на следующий, нижний, уровень. 
Важный момент - пока в комнате есть живые монстры, герой не может ее покинуть.

Герой, при убийстве врагов, повышает свой уровень, тогда как у призрака, каждый раз, когд это происходит, накапливается ярость, за которую, при переходе на следующий уровень, можно улучшить вызываемых монстров (так, начиная с харкающейся слизью гусеницы вы можете прокачаться до извергающего пламя дракона).
Если же герой погибает, то призрак, причастный к его убийству, вновь обретает человечность, и роли меняются. 

Также, на уровнях есть комната кузнеца, в которой можно купить артефакты, новое оружие, зелья, свитки, которые заменяют стандартное спец.действие (уворот) на новое. 

На некоторых уровнях есть портал, пройдя через который герой оказывается в комнате с боссом (есть несколько их разновидностей). Соответстсвенно, призраки пытаются помочь боссу (могут вселяться в определенные его части), а герой - одолеть его. 

Насколько я понимаю, выигрывает игру тот, кто смог одолеть босса, причем суммарно на всех персонажей дается всего 3 попытки победить его. Возможность активировать портал дается герою после достижения им 10-го уровня. 

С точки зрения управления все просто - 4 кнопки движения, одна кнопка стандартной атаки, и кнопка специального действия (по умолчанию это перекат). 

После окончания игры могут открыться новые апгрейды для монстров, новое оружие, предметы, что стимулирует игрока играть снова и снова. 

Игра очень динамичная, яркая, захватывающая, все игроки находятся в постоянном напряжении (кроме комнаты кузнеца). В целом, такие драйв и увлеченность я испытывал, наверное, только в Broforce :-) 

Очень рекомендую всем, кто не чурается пиксельной графики (очень красивой, надо сказать) и ураганного геймплея. 

ПС: хотелось лишь чтобы разрабы и дальше наполняли игру контентом - новыми монстрами, оружием, предметами, боссами, все остальное уже идеально.

23766553.review:
[h1]Crawl[/h1]

This game is a refreshing entrant into the couch-multiplayer games genre.

As much as these types of games are appreciated within the gaming community, Crawl offers something more unique that I personally had never seen before in a dungeon crawler. That is saying a lot, given how many of those types of games are on Steam alone.

Unlike many of those games, Crawl is played out in a king of the hill style, with one player controlling the hero, and the other three controlling monsters and traps. Kill the hero: become him. This is a mechanic I had never seen before and am thouroughly impressed with how well it was implemented. It draws you in. The fights and tension between players is genuine, and when you find yourself shouting with excitement... or resentment, without even realizing it, that is a very good thing.

The art is amazing. As someone who appreciates pixel art style, especially the retro, arcade-type pixelation, the art and animation immediately stood out to me. Very fluid and well done but at the same time still able to hold that nostalgic factor.

The soundtrack, while limited, shines where it is implemented. A very omnious feeling throughout, and the tracks change appropriately depending on certain events such as a player approaching victory or entering a boss fight.

The gameplay is well balanced and thought out, characters and monsters can be upgraded, and the rubber-banding is appropriate. Players can come back from any defecit at any point in the game.

[h1]Overall Opinion[/h1]

The game is a must buy in my opinion. It is best played with friends, but I have enjoyed several hours of playtime with the AI, which can give you a run for your money. Updates are still on the horizon at the time of this review, showing the devs really care about this game and its success. Their forum on their website posts upcoming updates for the game and gives players the oppurtunity to give feedback, which is a welcome stand-out from a lot of other developers.

With more content on the horizon, Crawl is shaping up to be a very promising game. As of now even, it is definitely a complete, polished game worthy of many hours of playtime.

All games have a realm they are best suited to. Mass Effect is an excellent single-player example, Populous is one of the best God games out there; FTL, the standard for roguelikes. So when it comes to multiplayer games that are not only fun, challenging, and fresh but that allow you to drop a hot mess on your buddy's head, no game is better suited than Crawl. 

But how to best describe a game that effortlessly packs together arcade style multiplayer alongside RPG friendly player progression and item usage? Well if I had to use a single word to do so, I'd say something along the lines of...bananas.

This game is fucking bananas.

First off, the premise. You and up to four other players (bots are also an option) are tasked with defeating the final boss in a dungeon crawler style series of levels that contain all manner of hazards from fire-spewing torches to Zelda style porcupine bricks that careen from one side of the map to the next. At any given moment, one player is the human in search of the end of the dungeon while the rest are either floating apparitions that collect globs of ectoplasmic goo to use as a weapon later on or to possess vile aberrations; each of which possess' it's own unique approach to dispatching the lone human paragon. 

Monster progression is tiered and each tree provides a different approach and selection of satanic beasts you will be able to choose from. This includes, but is not limited to, Cthulhu (+3 Lovecraft boner), Skeletor's misogynistic cousin, and a barfing carp or, as I have come to know it as, "Barfamander."

Yup, it's sort of like Army of Darkness got drunk and had a sloppy fuck with a desperate Pokemon. 

You'll spend a great deal of time possessing traps as you chisel away at the human in play in the hopes that, by killing them in a Shogun Assassin style arterial splash of blood, you will land the final blow and thus become the human until the same fate befalls you. It's a fun give-and-take that means that anyone can end up being the winner regardless of points or skill level (although the latter certainly factors in).

Fun Steam based additions have been somewhat regular and made the title a real gem as far as replay and for the creepily glitched out visuals and sound that operate like an NES on meth. Got a few bucks to spare with the buddies you love to hate most? 

Get your Crawl on.

23461871.review:
这是一款风格独特的roguelike游戏，游戏中无论是勇闯地牢的英雄，还是玩弄陷阱、召唤怪物、乃至控制boss的鬼魂皆可由你控制，赶快叫上你的基友，加入这一场场撕逼互虐战斗之中吧！
游戏评价：
+优秀的艺术风格：每个人物都只由几个像素点组成却充满表现力，场景也很有氛围
+独特的游戏方式：英雄被杀后可变为鬼魂，而杀了英雄的鬼魂可以变为英雄([spoiler]最后英雄击杀boss或者被boss击杀三次才能结束游戏[/spoiler])
+游戏时长适中：每局大概20~40分钟
+重复可玩性高：每局都能体验到不同的武器、装备、怪物、机关等（[spoiler]每场结束可以随机解锁部分道具[/spoiler]）

-游戏平衡略性差：英雄的提升空间很大，而怪物到最顶级以后几乎没有提升空间，导致英雄完虐怪物，而且这样游戏时间越长打boss越容易
-游戏更新太慢：就把这个当做是吐槽吧，从第一个测试版发布至今两年多了还没完坑......
-缺乏联机乐趣，只能本地联机游玩

23419422.review:
Well, well, well... Of all of the roguelike, couch co-op indie games out there, Crawl has to be my favourite. The atmosphere of the game is just creepy enough to send the willies up newcomers, not to mention the new intro cutscenes narrated by the magnificent Old Shrimpeyes. I don't know what that man eats, drinks or starves himself of to get that kind of voice, but whatever it is, I want it.
Intro and Atmosphere aside, Crawl is just a boatload of fun to play. I picked up the Steam Link recently and said box of goodness has proven itself to be quite good at processing these pixel-style games. It's situated in my living room, so I of course went on to have a real couch co-op experience with a few mates which consisted mainly of ghostly noises and violent screaming. The graphics are great, especially when running at 60fps as you get to watch the current human shifting fearfully from hall to hall before being set upon by rats, spiders and goblin grasshopper thingies, all of which are controlled by either bots or the people sitting next to you.
The best part is, if you haven't been human for a while, you gain Wrath every time the lucky fellow levels up, which in turn allows you to evolve your goblin grasshopper thingy into a rock-lobbing giant. This system of EXP for the living and Wrath for the dead makes the game a lot fairer and keeps things interesting in a long runthrough.
Overall, I'd recommend Crawl for anyone hankering for some old fashioned jolly cooperation; I can't remember what I bought it for because I was a pre-release funder, but whatever it costs now, it's worth it!

23195044.review:
I wanted this game as soon as I saw the trailers, and I wasn't disappointed. In fact, I've played it everyday since I got it. It's a fast-paced game with great music, atmosphere, gameplay, and a lot of challenge without too steep a curve. I have only played with AI so far, and I still have a lot of fun. They feel like proper opponents, and help set the illusion that you're playing with people.

I first used keyboard controls. They're alright; I wouldn't advise you slouch or curl up while playing though, as there's a lot of rapid button-pushing involved and that'll make your hands cramp up very quickly. I now use an iBuffalo Classic USB gamepad; the same goes for it, although that might just be because it's a new gadget and hasn't been broken in yet. Both control sets work great! Word to the wise, though: As of now, you can't adjust the gamepad controls in the main menu; you have to start a game and then use the controls menu that appears immediately after.

The developers are still working out the kinks, I imagine, and they're adding new content all the time. The brief story-like introductions have some great variety to them, and there's nothing more awesome than going through all the new monsters, weapons, and items you unlock after every game. I have no complaints!

23131144.review: Yeah, I didn't play that game for long, but my reason is that I want to enjoy it with my friends. This is definetly a game you should play with your buddies. It is a dungeon crawler, but the most authentic and unusual one you have ever played. And you know what? It works out really well. The pixelart looks awesome and I really dig the music which fits the artstyle perfectly. Really cool music and presentation and I didn't even get to the gameplay. This dungeoncrawler lets you fight against your friends. Your friends are actually the enemy, not the AI as it usually would be in a coop game. At first, all the players fight against each other and the last one alive gets to "crawl" the dungeon while his friends try killing him as all sorts of mobs. The variation is really surprising, you play a fish, a undead, a samurai and so much more. Those are the opponents of the human player. As soon as one of the dead players kills the human one, he gets to be human. This sounds really weird but it totally works and is probably lots of fun together. I really love that the game finishes so complete. The animations in the menu alone are cool with the music.

23117232.review:
Interesting and fun, and well-implemented concept. 

Consider it to be a combination of games like 'the Duck game' and a 2d roguelike.

The game starts off where one player has to kill the other two before anyone can move on. Game over for the other two, right? WRONG. That's what makes this game unique. The other two (in ghost form) can either 'possess' traps or spawn monsters to fight the survivor. You know how you always have to kill monsters to progress in roguelikes? This time, the monsters are your friends.

The only thing I'd say it's missing is online mp via steam. It's still a great game, though.

23111846.review:
At version 0.9 I would say this game is a great buy if you want to play a local multiplayer game that is both cooperative in one aspect and competitive in another. This game is cooperative because you join up with your dead allies and try to kill the current hero, but at the same time you want that last hit to become a hero, so you might not want to pull your weight during some encounters until the right moment arrives. Also, playing against three of your friends as a hero is a pretty big challenge considering how strong some monsters are, so going first  AI on hard mode can be fun to play against since their aim is pretty on point and can make for a great challenge at some times, since I have seem them occassionally stick to walls and just die there. 
Playing by yourself isn't exactly the most amount of fun and having to unlock new monsters and items can be considered a both positive and negative, since it gives you something to work for, but at the same time it would be nice to have everything to play with your friends from the start. Also, unlocking everything seems like it would take less than 9 hours of gameplay, so unlocking items and monsters is not really a big grind, which helps.
I think if they added a few more bosses and balanced a few of the weak monsters, then this game would be 10/10 when playing with friends.

Overall,
if you got friends and want to have fun killing each other, then this is a game you should buy.

This is one of those intelligently designed games that is just amazing to behold.  It is nothing but constant frenetic action with your friends, and there's always something to unlock. All this game needs to do now is perform a little bit more monster/hero balancing and slowly add in content over time and it will be perfect. It has an excellent frame structure right now, but it just needs additional monsters, weapons/items, dungeon layouts, themes, and bosses.

I would relaly love to see what a castle, crypt, or swamp themed dungeon would look like. I would love to see more varied bosses as well. RIght now the three headed dragon boss feels a little underpowered compared to the tentacle monster.

The only mechanic that I still find odd is the one where all players lose if they kill the hero during the final third boss fight. It's like there's no reason to continue for monster players in the third round fight --- unless the point is (if we're going down, you're going down with us) ? Either way, I'd like to see a type of modification or adjustment to done to this and see what you guys can come up with. Otherwise, I feel there isn't much of an incentive for the ghost/monster players to keep playing once the third boss battle begins.

To reiterate, Crawl has an excellent skeleton, it just needs to have some more tasty meat on its bones and it will become perfect. It really is such a beatuifully designed game. I absolutely LOVE the unlock system. If you keep adding more, I'll keep playing more just to see what else I can unlock with my friends. I freaking love that system.

22856283.review:
Friends become enemies become friends again in this feverish beat-em-up where you will die the hero, only to see yourself become the villian anyway.
This puts a very unique spin on an already established genre, and it does it in a way that makes it stand out against the rest as an example, a goal for how to change game mechanics while maintaining the fun factor.

HOW IT PLAYS
To start, it plays like Binding of Isaac or Enter the Gungeon in a sense. Instead of shooting, there is hack n' slash combat. That is where similarities end. 

When the game start, what happens is a wonderfully crafted, simple yet effective backstory is given as to the 'what and why' of the game. The 4 heroes (up to 4 players or 3 AI) are reduced to 1 while the other players(or AI) now become the spirits. Those spirits are now your enemy. 

It is the Hero's job to reach at least hero level 10 and kill the boss, all while surviving the traps and monsters that lurk in the dungeon. To do this, the hero will need to stock up on gear and weapons found in the Blcksmiths shop. 

The spirits are tasked with taking down the hero by means of possesing the traps and summoning runes that lay marked on the floor. Those summoning runes turn the spirits into 1 of 3 monsters from their "monster loadout". Once one of them kills the hero, they then take on the role of hero, slayer of ghouls and the fiends they possess. 

Throughout the game, the hero levels up and sometimes gets rewarded with gold by finding interactive objects or dealing damage to the hero as sppirits. The spirits on the other hand evolve by earning their own currency gained by causing harm to the hero or when the hero levels up. 

It is a fun and rewarding back and forth game that is surprisingly well balanced with no bugs that I have encountered. I bought this game just a few days before I found it was also part of my Humble Monthly quite some time ago. I did not request a refund from steam for my purchase however because this game is easily worth the money I paid. I would recomend this game to anyone who has local buddies (or can play solo) and loves dungeon crawlers.

OTHER THINGS AND STUFF
Things it could improve would be to add online functionality, and more diversity to the level design, although neither is required for this already magnificent game.

Go give the game a chance!

Edit: After spending more time in this game, my review still holds. If anything, I think higher of this game. It is truly something special. They have added more voicework, nee items, a new boss, new mechanics, and new monsters to control. The developers have truly pulled through with this game. Please, go out and play it. It's a hellova good time.

22697577.review:
Absolutely fantastic game!

Let me start off by saying that if my 50 hours of logged gameplay have taught me anything, its that this is one of the most balanced and fun games I have ever bought. The replay-ability of this game is actually amazing! I used to play this game with my brother a year ago and now I have most of the people on my college dorm floor actually addicted to palying it. This, combined with the fact that the game isn't actually finished is stunning. The balance between human and monster gameplay is amazing. Many people will talk bad about how some monsters you can just troll with, and to that I say, "Git gud."

The only problems I have observed with this game are the variety of final bosses. There are currently two. Most of the time a certain player has the skills to destroy a certain boss, no matter how good the boss controlers are. Therefore, sometimes its up to the flip of a coin as to if someone will win the game automatically or not. HOWEVER, I am happy to hear that they have annaounced and are in the progess of making a thrid boss. This will fix the lack of variety.

Another note is that the longer you play the more you find really cool room themes. Some I have seen semi-frequently are rooms with the walls/floors lined with blood sigils or rooms that have grass and vegetation. I would love to see even more of these fun-to-find environments as the game is developed.

Overall, this early access game could be a game all on its own right now if it wanted to. However, I am very glad work is still being done on it. I encourage literally everyone to buy and play this game. I hope it brings as mouch joy to you as it does to me and my entire college doem floor!

22651865.review:
Палец вниз. Сразу скажу, что в игре есть и много положительных задумок и моментов, но они, к сожалению, не перевешивают.

Для начала - немного о механике игры. В компании до четырех игроков (ботов) мы оказываемся в подземелье. Причем "героем" будет только один из компании. Остальные начинают как безтелесные духи, которые могут приобрести материальную форму в особых точках, превращаясь в монстров (или вселяясь в расставленные на локациях ловушки), которые будут вредить "герою", в попытке занять его место. "Герой" получает за убийства монстров экспу, монстры, будучи убитыми - очки гнева, которые между уровнями можно будет вложить в прокачку доступного к использованию бестиария. Цель игры - докачаться до 10 уровня (можно и дальше), чтобы получить возможность телепортироваться к боссу, которым, опять же, будут управлять ваши товарищи (или товарищи-боты, не знаю кто там у вас), завалить его и выиграть.

Задумка - неизбитая и интересная, тем и подкупает. В целом, игра сделана с любовью - кропотливый пиксельарт, анимация, любопытные ветки развития монстров и даже ассортимент оружия у кузнеца (у разных видов - разные удары и комбо) - всё это, безусловно, в плюс.

Дальше - минусы. Первый - один вы в неё не поиграете. Или боты, или друзья. Причем друзья подойдут только те, которые собрались поиграть с вами в одной комнате - мультиплеер только локальный за одним компьютером. Надеюсь, разработчики добавят сетевой мультиплеер - т.к. это самая большая проблема игры. От ботов удовольствия мало.
Второй - низкая реиграбельность. Поиграв часок, вы сможете попробовать большую часть доступных монстров, оружия и артефактов. Из прочего разнообразия - боссы, но это ситуацию не спасает. Кстати, кроме других игроков, монстров на локациях нет (не считая пузыреобразных миньонов, которых могут призывать ваши друзья-враги).

Резюмируя - игра получилась очень узкой направленности: играть с ботами - скучно, по сети - нельзя. Если у вас всегда есть под боком друг с джойстиком (а лучше три) - можно и приглядеться, т.к. ряд интересных задумок и любовное исполнение заслуживают внимания. Однако, даже в этом случае, игра не затянет надолго, и после того, как будут исследованы доступные монстры и боссы - будет заброшена в дальний угол. А времени на это потребуется совсем немного. Есть подозрение, что довольно весело играть втроем-вчетвером, опробовать, к сожалению, не довелось.

Еще раз скажу, что разрабы скорее молодцы, пятюню им, но хотелось бы увидеть интересные фишки из Crawl в чем-то более играбельном. А в нынешнем виде, игра, скорее, напоминает концепт интересных решений и технических возможностей, но не более того.

22594131.review:
Crawl is simple but brilliantly executed multiplayer concept. One person plays a hero traversing a dungeon, and the other players play as the dungeon and enemies.  When a monster kills the hero they take his place. The monsters are generally "weaker" than the hero so they need to both work together and compete to get the last hit.

The matches are fairly short, usually lasting from 15 to 30 minutes which doesn’t feel like too long. The balancing mechanics are well designed, and players make comebacks regularly keeping the game close - the longer you play as a monster the better off you are if you become the hero, but wait too long and you might lose.

The hero and monsters feel good to play, and the players are given several customization options at the beginning of each game allowing them to choose a group of monsters to play as. There are also additional perks which offer variety in play styles.

There is a learning curve to the game, and understanding the different resources you have to manage and knowing each monster can be confusing to newer players. The mechanical simplicity helps a lot with this. Crawls biggest problem is that it currently has only local multiplayer and really needs online multiplayer.

Crawl is intensely fun and extremely well designed. It is easily one of if not the best local multiplayer games available on steam, and an amazing value for its price. If you can get a group of three or four people together to play I highly recommend it.

22474655.review:
This is a very solid game for early access. and has an enormous amount of style and potential.  I do have a few complaints about the overall balancing however.

1. Defensive playstyles through monsters are ultimately more rewarding than aggresive playstyles, and camping is a big problem. (Atleast, in the 12 hours we've played collectively). 

2. Because of this, some of the final monster evolutions are not worth evolving too (Im thinking of the slug, for example)

3. Part of the issue is because of all these defensive options you're given as monsters, it almost feels like online would just be overwhelmingly frustrating to deal with if it was implimented. If i wasn't sitting next to some friends playing this game, i'd probably have ragequit against the defensive playstyles in an online setting playing against people who i didn't know. (This is just personal prefernce however, and im sure online would still be an amazing adition for the community and players of this game)

If the dev's were able to find a way to combat this while not completely destroying the ranged characters playstyle, it'd be much more rewarding to play as a monster, and maybe not feel like such a scumbag to your friends all the time.

Negatives aside, this is still a blast to play, and leads to many hilarious moments. May lead to some frustrations, but ultimately is one of the most entertaining Couch co-op games i've played.

22346637.review:
Crawl is without a doubt, one of the most fun couch-coop/hate machines I've ever played. 
It's like NFL Blitz for N64, except that I don't get stabbed with an N64 Controller.

Here is what you need to know:
The devs WANT online multiplayer, but they haven't started, and have expressed how very difficult good netcode is for a game like this with a dev staff of only 2 nice gentlemen. It's not available now, and may not be for a while!
Single player with bots is possible, and pretty fun, but bots are pretty bad at bosses, even on max AI setting. They are also great at kill stealing and being dicks.

1v1 isn't super fun, but doable with bots. if you have TWO friends who'll play with you, or THREE, you're set to have an absolutely excellent time. 

If the gameplay looks fun to you though, you should buy it, even if you can't force your friends to play.

22001861.review:
Crawl的游戏方式的确新颖，而且生来就带着一股撕逼潜质。
你和你的敌人（队友）都是被困在地下城里的灵魂，现在你们只有一具人类身体，谁操纵着人类身体打败BOSS谁就能离开地下城。好了我介绍完了，你们开始撕吧。
简单的游戏目标下是同样简单的操作，纯鼠标操作完全可以搞定，手柄的话也只需要一个摇杆和两个按键。在这个巴不得把控制器每个按键都标上功能说明的游戏时代，有这么个作风淳朴的游戏也是极为不易。
说起来好像挺简单，只要操纵人类稳住别跪就行，但是玩起来你就会感到一股紧逼的压迫感，毕竟身边有几只幽灵时刻围在你的身边准备夺取身体呢。

而且这个压迫感还是实际上的，因为幽灵每收集到3个灰尘（因为从空气中生出来的我就这么认为吧）就能召唤一个史莱姆，虽然史莱姆单独基本没有战斗力。可在你被怪物堆包围，正手忙脚乱的时候来几只史莱姆添乱，那可是随时会崩盘。
而每过一段时间空气中就会刷出灰尘团，而且在你破坏场景中的箱子木桌之类的也会出现灰尘，完克各种手贱的破箱达人。
所以控制人类的玩家就要时刻小心，步步为营，而且得抓紧脚步。再也不能在商店里精挑细选了，也不能毫无目的地乱逛了，拖慢脚步的报应就是在下一个房间里有⑨个史莱姆跳出来打你。
人类的玩法是杀怪物涨经验升级挑战BOSS走上人生巅峰（结算画面确实有一个人类踏着怪物尸体的山峰= =），当人类到达10级之后，就能去三角房间挑战BOSS了。
目前而言，BOSS只有两个……其中一个还特别好打。（好打是在AI控制下的，如果对玩家就不会那么容易了。）（所以说这游戏乐趣必须也在联机
BOSS的攻击方式很特殊，其他幽灵玩家各自操作BOSS的一部分，如果配合的好能一下子耗掉人类一半多的血。（可惜AI不是很会配合
挑战BOSS成功之后就算人类胜利，如果失败就要被打回三角房间继续流程。
三角房间有三束火焰，每挑战一次灭一束，如果3次挑战BOSS都失败了，当然就算幽灵获胜。

其他幽灵的目标就很简单了——干死人类，拿到操纵权。
但是这个干也不能愣头冲上去就干，那根送经验没啥区别。
在有怪物召唤阵的房间，幽灵会随机变成自己之前选择的3种怪物之1。
怪物是可以升级的，在这里有个比较精巧的设计，就是怪物升级的点数是根据人类的等级来决定的。
也就是如果人类杀了越多的怪物，等级越高，那么其他幽灵用来升级自己怪物的点数就越高，这就防止了人类单方面碾压的情况。人类越强，怪物也就越强，这种平衡设定非常值得赞同。

还没有提到这个简单两键操作的功能呢，其实就是攻击和特殊技。
每个怪物的攻击方式和特殊技都不一样，当然人类也可以在商店购买武器和技能书来进行更换攻击方式。
所以在围攻人类的这个方面，怪物们就要进行分工合作了。
有负责输出的，有负责封路的，还有负责抗打的（？），怪物虽然血量没有人类厚，但是利用各式技能和数量优势照样能花式秀杀人类。（AI就不行了，不会配合，只会散打。
当人类残血的时候，一场新的看不见的战争就开始了。
没错，因为游戏设定是“只有对人类造成最后一击的怪物才会占据人类的身体”。
所以当人类残血的时候，操纵怪物的玩家们内心就各自开始打起了小算盘。
“不行，我不能持续输出，万一趁我攻击空隙背后那小子一记飞箭抢了人头怎么办。”
“糟了，那货停止攻击了，现在我的攻击还不足以杀掉人类，还是再等等看剩余血量足够了再射。”
“我去，怎么都不打了，那我也不扛伤害了，跑之前先吐口毒，万一DOT跳死人类呢，嘻嘻。”
于是人类这个时候就可以抓紧怪物内讧的时间开始一波反击，顺便秀一下走位和闪避，一套打包带走，顺便升级去刚BOSS。
你看，满满的都是套路，撕逼神游不是它还能是谁？！

Crawl的房间布置也是固定房间随机排列的模式，但和暴虐的固定从左至右不同，这里的地下城结构是分散的。
也就是如果你的人类在某一层的出口房间被其他玩家夺取操纵权，那么这个玩家可能因为拿着一手的钱要去买东西于是又一路小跑跑回商店买完之后再一路小跑跑到出口房间再离开。
虽然在某些房间中有着消耗5金币即可传送回商店的祭坛，然而在这种金币资源较为紧张的地方，一般人不会很愿意花点钱传送过去。
这就使流程进度稍微有点被拖累，想一想如果这一关每个玩家都轮流占据一次身体，那得来回跑个三四趟……

说点游戏流程之外的。
Crawl的美术风格可以说是绝了，第一次有像素游戏的画面效果让我有“惊艳”的感觉。
仿街机的标题insert coin说明，刻意的画面闪烁和精美的抖动花屏效果，还有复古OS的启动画面，令人开始对这个地下城背后的故事有了点其他意义的猜想（？）。（当然很可能只是我想多了
而且游戏中的像素精度虽然不高，但是流畅度十足，一招一式都有十分带感的动态，在动作这方面crawl可以说是做到了相当优秀的程度。
流程中的收集要素也不少，很多物品在游戏中达成条件才能解锁，而且解锁条件还都不是很明朗。
解锁的新怪物还可以进入挑战模式练习对战人类，是个熟悉各种怪物技能单杀人类的好场所。（可惜没有人类武器和技能的练习模式

要说游戏的缺陷，大概是地下城里的内容还是比较少，除了怪物召唤阵房间之外都没有什么有趣的设计，当然也可能是我玩的不够多没解锁的原因。
游戏节奏很快，打AI大概15~20分钟一局，我只和小伙伴联机过三次，不过每次斗智斗勇玩的非常High。
如果你有一些现实中可以坐在一台电脑前共同游玩的好友，那么非常推荐这款游戏，绝对是act地下城类玩家的首选！
对了，我有没有提到这款游戏里有G胖客串小BOSS？

21844696.review: Crawl is an awesome couch co-op dungeon crawler with a twist. For now, being in Early Access, there isn't a hell of a lot of content, but it is incredibly fun to play with a friend, and I can't wait to see what the developers add to the game. 21844369.review: I received Crawl as a gift from a friend, so when I first started it up, I didn't know what to expect aside from a Dungeon Crawler. What I got was a unique experience, well geared toward multiplayer fun. Assymetric gameplay at its simplest, and yet most refined, up to four players try to get through a dungeon, each trying to be the one to kill the boss at the end. There can only be one dungeoneer at a time though, so while one player slays monsters and evades traps, the others are controlling those monsters and traps. Whichever player is the one to kill the current active dungeoneer becomes the new dungeoneer. The balancing is actually quite effective, though it can be possible to steamroll the opposition if you get a good streak going while active. The game is still under development, so there are only two bosses that I have seen, but I'm looking forward to seeing more from the game.

21817264.review:
PROS:
The easiest way I can describe it is that it's concept reminds me of The Legend of Zelda but only if one character plays as Link where you're a little guy with a sword and the other plays as Ganon where you summon monsters of all kind after the little guy with the sword. It's a really fun concept and I can see Powerhoof is trying to take as much advantage of this as they can, which of coarse is FREAKING AWESOME! I like how you don't even need to power up all the eldritch stones to activate the portal to the boss and how it's a different monster with it's own unique mechanics depending on how many you have powered up.

This game is also a good example of how a video game doesn't need a real story what so ever to be enjoyable because it could leave your imagination up to do that if you wanted to like how it does for a silent protagonist's personality or motives. You can imagine the human as a hero and the ghost(s) as the villain, or the human as the villain or the ghost(s) as the hero(s), or there could be no good guy here at all but instead just poor souls fighting over a change at freedom and riches like a bunch of hungry wolves fighting over a dead rabbit. The possibilities are endless to what it could be happening down in the caverns.

CONS:
As fun as the game is and as much as I hate to admit it, the only thing that could make it complete is if they do put together a little online feature where you can play with friends from all over. Sure it's got local co-op AND I know that it's still on there to do list, but my point still stands that online is the only thing that's missing. But even with online still yet to be a reality, the game is pretty solid even when playing by yourself. Though when I played it by myself, I couldn't help but notice there's some slight kinks in the ghosts' AI. But it's still early access and these kinks do seem pretty minor like sometimes the ghosts would stay stuck in a corner for some reason, interracting with a trap that you're no where near which only happened once for me and they stopped obviously as soon as I left the room.


ALL IN ALL:
Really solid game, enjoyable even when playing by yourself, still waiting on that online even after a year and a bit but they can take there times since I'm sure they're getting to that soon.

21576800.review:
Crawl é um jogo todo cooperativo, só que de de um jeito diferente e único. Em Crawl, você explora as dungeons sendo assombrado por fantasmas. Esses fantasmas são outros jogadores, se você estiver jogando com algum amigo ao seu lado, ou pelo computador, mas estão sempre presentes. O fato de os fantasmas sempre serem presentes é porque nesse jogo, seus amigos controlam os inimigos e os cenários.

Sendo o guerreiro, o seu objetivo é sobreviver o máximo possível, adquirir quanto mais experiência e continuar pelos níveis, matar criaturas, comprar itens. Já, jogando como fantasma, seu objetivo é controlar armadilhas pelo mapa, dando dano ao guerreiro, controlando criaturas que podem ser invocadas em pentagramas pelo chão. A vida do guerreiro não vai subir, apenas achando itens especiais, então torna a aventura bem mais divertida, e por isso, o importante não é conseguir passar de tudo de uma vez, e sim se sair melhor do que o outro jogador.

Review completa: http://gonbrasil.com.br/2015/07/17/jogamos-crawl/

21553963.review:
The developers are little overly fond of the phrase "torn apart" and variants in their release notes.
I mean it's kind of understandable. Everybody gets torn apart in this game. A lot.

Oh, you might be wondering, what stops the player in the human flesh bag from just dawdling around and wasting everybody's time? You can do that but when the ghost players aren't otherwise occupied, they're always zooming back and forth gathering up ambient ectoplasm blobs which they can spend to summon slimes. Slimes are pretty pathetic but you can summon them in numbers as a distraction in larger fights and the hero doesn't get rewarded for killing them. Best of all slimes lock the doors when you summon them, which is good fun when the hero is just about to rush out of a trap room.

I was surprised though, I was worried being a ghost would feel like wasted time but honestly not only is it fun to be a ghost but you still feel like you're in the running and pushing to win, and as a session progresses humanity starts flipping back and forth between people with hilarious frequency

Idk I'll write a real review later maybe, basically it's good and you should get it. It's wonderfully competitive enough that even when playing against bots you forget that you're playing against bots

21547469.review:
* Delightfully antagonistic without being punitive - you always feel you can come back (and couch-based revenge is sweet)
* Engages everyone at all times even when you're not the hero
* Can be customized to suit varying skill levels and playstyles
* Roguelike level design and randomness of item generation means strategies must remain dynamic
* Alex Yoder's blippy-virtuoso soundtrack keeps your heart pounding as you fight tooth and claw to regain your freedom
* Challenge mode gives you a great way to learn and practice each monster's playstyle
* Powerhoof's choice of art style and "possessed glitchiness" leaves you with a splinter of dread & creep in your mind even after you finish playing
* Great for decompressing after attending Sunday church services ;)
* Among the most "feels feature-complete" Early Access titles I've played in a long time! (And they're still adding more!)

21436053.review:
This game is an absolute blast to play in local multiplayer with a group of your friends. It's antagonistic-coop gameplay mechanic makes it a good time for friends with a competitive streak. Short (less than 15 minute) runs means that everyone gets a chance to play and you can quickly have rematches for those occasional lucky runs that people will get.
The balance seems exquisite, as there doesn't seem to be weapons or builds that are particulary overpowered.
The god taunting is a nice addition as well, as it allows you to really challenge everyone, or maybe handicap a particularly skilled player. Sound effects are very well done and really lend to that retro arcade feel.
And there's nothing more satisfying than snagging one of those truly fearsome mid-bosses and watching your fellow ghost friends cry out in jealosy, and watching the current hero player shit a brick.

Crawl is an excellent couch mulitplayer title. It's gameplay is easy for anyone to pick up and can be enjoyed in short bursts or long playthroughs. 

While it does feature bots and a Challenge singleplayer mode it is better enjoyed with friends. The two button controls make it easy to have two players with just the keyboard and mouse, one player using each, without being cramped on the keyboard.

It has a variety of procedurally generated rooms, filled with traps, upgradable monsters and there are many secrets and mysteries to be found (one worthy of Gaben himself...). 

Seriously, stop reading this review and get it when it's cheap! It's guarenteed to be a hit with you and your friends.

The only downside is that at the time of this review it does not have online multiplayer, but it's still in early access so that and many other features are bound to be introduced soon.

21114575.review:
This game is def a treat to play with bots or with other friends in the room.

You have a total of 4 players. 
One player starts off as The Hero
The other 3 players act as Ghosts that are tasked with killing the Hero player so that they, in turn, can become The Hero Themselves.
The first person of the 4 players to reach level 10, go through the portal and kill the Final Boss wins!

The gameplay is some of the best MP fun to be had, the only big downsides I found was that it's Local-Only Multiplayer..on PC which may break the purchase for a lot of people understandably. Thankfully you can play with Bots who have 3 different difficulties.

The other issue I found was a bit of unbalanced gameplay when there are 4 players. There just isn't enough resources gained with the 4 players to max out your monsters or really get powerful with your Hero character some of the time.

Here's a review of the game if you'd like to see more! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5TZr--pOiZQ

21101097.review:
【画面】：粗旷的像素风，粗旷却不失风格（偶对了这里还有G胖上镜）

【游戏机制】：游戏的主线剧情是很平常的主角通过重重考验打败大魔王的故事，然而与一般的游戏不同，这里主角和每一个怪物都是由玩家扮演，游戏采用房间制一个房间一个房间探险。一开始会随机分配一个玩家作为主角，其他玩家为鬼魂，鬼魂不能直接攻击主角，但是鬼魂进入周围的机关里操控机关攻击主角，甚至可以通过到地上的六芒星上变身为自己提前选好的怪物。主角必须怪物大战一番，如果怪物都被杀死，则操作怪物的玩家变回鬼魂，主角玩家可以向下一个屋子探险。如果主角被杀死，则杀死主角的怪物将占据以前主角的身体变为新的主角，而之前死去的主角将变为鬼魂，新的主角要与还没死的怪物继续决斗，直至怪物都死干净。主角可以在游戏中购买装备药水。每个章节结束后，会根据大家的表现分配经验，用来给自己的怪物升级，不同怪物有很多不同的分支，究竟选哪个还得自己上游戏里体验了。

【操作】：很简单，移动，普通攻击，特殊技能。这个游戏走位很主要。

【联机】：只支持本地多人，最多4人
总之这是一个损友必备的游戏，游戏机制很独特，这种主角轮换机制也是我第一次见到。每个人都有机会成为主角，每个主角也都有失手的时候。如果有朋友陪你一起玩的话，那为什么不入一个呢？

★☆另外，欢迎各位小伙伴做客STEAM独立游戏吧，独立游戏爱好者聚集地~ 
（传送门请点 http://tieba.baidu.com/f?kw=steam独立游戏&fr=home&fp=0&ie=utf-8  官方群：246902752 ★☆

21067297.review:
I can't remember if I have ever left a review for any game in all the years I've been on steam.  If I did, it wasn't a good enough one for me to remember.  

I'm leaving one now.

Simply put:  This game is awesome.  This is one of THOSE games:  Games that I break out in a party setting with my friends and we play it over and over and over.  The idea behind this game is simple enough, but there's enough under the hood to add some depth and variety that it doesn't make the game boring at all or feel repetitive.  Nothing is more satisfying in the world than closing off a room from the hero (as he tries to dash to the portal),  stealing a kill from another monster player (while already at level 10) and race into the adjacent room, open the portal, and attempt to kill the boss.

This game will test friendships, no doubt.  It is worth every penny and I can't wait to see what else they add to it.  I'm not crying for lack of on-line multiplayer.  And, the game has some AI in it, so you can even play solo if you want.  (I also really like the 'drop in' / 'drop out' feature A LOT.  Very handy.)  I realize that a lot of people like that component and want it... but the magic here is playing with 3 other friends all in the same room.

21065386.review:
[h1]미완성임에도 즐거운[/h1]
이 게임의 여러가지 특성상 [b]'코옵'플레이[/b]가 핵심입니다.
하지만 아직 로컬 코옵밖에 구현되지 않은 상태이며, [b]온라인 코옵은 불가능[/b]합니다.

그럼에도 불구하고 저는 이 게임을 매우 재미있게 했습니다.
그게 가능했던 이유는 제가 로컬 코옵을 함께 즐길 친구들이 많기 때문입니다!
(......)

자, 그렇다면 이제 친구가 없는 여러분도 이 게임을 즐길 수 있는 요소를 알려드리겠습니다.
그건 바로 [b]수준 높은 AI[/b] 덕분입니다.
AI는 Easy, Normal, Hard 3가지 단계가 선택 가능합니다.
Easy는 처음 하시는 분들도 큰 어려움 없이 상대하실 수 있으며,
Normal도 어느 정도 익숙해 진 후에는 문제 없습니다.
그리고 대망의 Hard는 이 게임을 처음 접한 분들이라면 반드시 농락을 당할 것을 약속드립니다. 

AI의 행동 패턴이 쉽게 예측 가능한 패턴이 아니라서, 실제 플레이어와 경쟁하고 있다는 착각이 들기도합니다.

[h1]하지만 여전히 아쉬운[/h1]
그렇지만 핵심 기능이 구현되지 않았다는 사실은 변함없습니다.
AI가 아무리 잘 구현 되어있더라도 그 한계는 명확합니다.
또한 제가 생각하는 이 게임의 본질은 [b]경쟁[/b]입니다.
하지만 AI로부터는 그 본질적인 재미를 얻기는 불충분합니다.
결국 AI의 한계를 극복하고, 본질적인 재미를 제공하기 위해서는 '온라인 코옵' 기능 구현이 필수적입니다.
(혹은 알파고를 영입하거나)

하지만 다행히 개발자는 '온라인 코옵'에 긍정적인 의견을 표현하고 있습니다.
다만 개발에 난항을 겪고 있는 듯 합니다.

[h1]다음 달이 계속 기대되는 게임[/h1]
이 게임은 얼리 엑세스로 출시된 이후 꾸준히 업데이트를 해오고 있습니다. (약 3개월에 1번 꼴로 업데이트 중)
또한 업데이트 전에도 개발 소식을 스팀 커뮤니티를 통해 적극적으로 알리고 있습니다.
그리고 매번 업데이트마다 새로운 컨텐츠가 추가되어, 새롭게 즐기는 데 무리가 없습니다.

결국 구매결정은 당신의 몫입니다. (급 마무리?)

There is little value to this game in singleplayer. And, it currently supports only LOCAL multiplayer. Co-op is a misnomer, because thats the furthest thing you will be doing with your friends when you jump into this game. 

This game has tight, responsive combat. Some of the monsters feel worthless, but most just take some getting used to in order to be effective. You can level up the monsters between the stages with experience gained while you were the monsters/ghosts. The sounds and utility of choosing which monsters to level up and what branch in their evolution to pick is great. 

Playing as the hero is gritty and fun. The more monsters you kill, the higher you can level up and also gain gold. Gold is spent at the shopkeeper to buy new weapons, skills, and upgrades. Make sure to pick the right ones! One charm makes you powerful.....but also turns you into a harmless, weak frog! Once you have reached a high enough level, you can choose to attempt to defeat the boss. Be careful! If you die enough times, it's game over and you can even lose your name and progress, having to start your file over! 

There are some truly intense moments in this game. When you and a few of your ghost friends have been able to possess monsters and traps to get the friend playing the hero down to the last few hits, it gets crazy, Whomever lands the LAST HIT becomes the hero, despite who harmed them the most! I love that feature! 

I really can't recommend this game enough, as long as you have friends to play with you! Even for $10 this game is a bargain, much less if you catch it on sale!

21019867.review: This is THE best PvP dungeon crawling party game to be released on steam this year!

21018909.review: Awesome, can't wait for more content

21011980.review:
This is one of my new favorite games on Steam, hands down. Like a normal Dungeon Crawler, you go from room to room fighting off monsters. However in Crawl, the players play as the monsters, all trying to attack the main player. The goal of the game as a monster is to kill the human player and take their place, while the goal of the human is to kill as much as possible and gain XP points. You win the game if you're the player and you go into the boss room and destroy the boss. (The other players also control the boss too!) However, you may only do this at level 10. If the players fail to slay the boss 3 times, the player who fought the third time is removed from the game forever. (And I'm not kidding, it actually deletes your name!)

If you have friends locally, this is for you. Just grab a couple of controllers. And no, unlike 70% of steam games with controller support, it DOESN'T need to have XInput. The devs of this game were sure to incorporate as much controllers as possible. As long as it has a USB that you can stick into your computer the controller probably works. Did I mention the game only uses 3 buttons and a d pad? (2 not including the start button) Haven't tested it, but this should work in theory: http://www.amazon.com/Classic-USB-NES-Controller-PC/dp/B002YVD3KM

If you want one of the best local play experiences you'll ever have, buy now. Also the game devs are really active in the community pumping out updates like mad.

Positive Features:
-Up to 4 Players Locally
-Single player mode with AIs
-TONS of controller options
-Innovative control scene
-Active Devs (As of now)
-Low Price
-High Repeatability
-Cabinet mode (You may hook the game up to an arcade machine!)

Negative Features:
-No online support yet. May not come for a while. Don't buy the game hoping for online support, it's clearly not it's focus, although it may come in the future.


Overall, this game is wonderful locally. If you're having a party or just inviting friends over, this is a must have. It's still fun with bots, but not as good with other people, I haven't played much single player but I know it's kind of a mixed response, some like it and some don't. I like it though.

Also you can fight Gabe Newell. He hits you with his custom skinned digital knives. 10/10

20732740.review:
One of the best local multiplayer games ever made. My friends and I have played this almost every week without fail since launch - it's that damn good. When we meet new people who claim they're into games, we vet them on this and see if they have fun or can appreciate the depth of game mechanics. We love this game because there's nothing like sitting shoulder to shoulder with a pal and howling with rage at a stolen kill, laughter at a horde of slimes causing a human to suddenly play a Shmup, or roars of hype when a close bossfight comes down to the wire. My short recommendation for this game is [b]BUY IT[/b]. But now let's get to why you should.

CRAWL is a local multiplayer game that involves between 2-4 players. One player is a human, and the other 1-3 are monsters. Every time a monster kills a human, whether it being done as a monster, as a possessable slime, or a controllable trap, that player will become the human. [u]This has to be done on a last hit.[/u] This means that the three non-human players must work in a loose alliance until the very last minute, because there can only be one human!

The other gameplay mechanics are a bit more complicated than that, and I'll explain the most complicated one, the leveling system and the asymmetrical nature of the players:

-A player possessing a human can kill monsters to gain XP and continue leveling up. This primarily adds extra health and to the human and gets the player closer to a boss run, since only characters with level 10 or higher can do boss runs. Humans get better gear and stats by accessing shops. They use gold that they gain primarly while being a monster (I'll get to that later)

-Nonhuman players control ghosts most of the time. Ghosts can possess pentagrams to spawn as monsters and fight the humans. They can also control traps or collect ectoplasm while they're in Ghost mode to drop slimes, which are weak, autonomous/controllable monsters that can be dropped at any time. This is useful for trapping a human in a room, since humans must kill all monsters before leaving a room. Slimes aren't too strong on their own, but if the human's health is low, and/or the room is full of traps, they can be utterly devastating. All players can level up their monsters at the end of a round. Nonhuman players can also all control a boss monster Voltron-style, with each player controlling a limb or head and working together to kill the human.

Now here's what keeps this asymmetrical gameplay balanced from a progression standpoint. As other players level up their human forms, all the other players get "Wrath", or monster XP. So as any given player human(s) get stronger, the monsters of the other players get stronger. This keeps the players' monsters roughly scaled with players' human forms, and it means that people who are especially good at playing only humans or only monsters may be in for a dramatic uphill battle once they get out of being a human/monster for an extended time. 

Also, while players are monsters, they gain gold by hurting or killing the human. HOWEVER, this gold can only be used when you're a human! This means that someone who's been a monster for a long time will most likely have strong monsters, a lot of gold, but low human levels. Even if you can buy out the shop, you'll still be a pathetic creature of flesh until level up or reach the shop to get some assistance.

There's a lot more stuff going on here as well. Single-fight upgrades that require slime/gold/human health sacrifice, spells, dodge rolls, blink teleports, poisoned food, magic staffs, frog hexes, cursed weapons (that make you insane), repeating crossbows, Gabe Newell, I could just keep going on and on. Let's just say there's a LOT of content packed in the core game, and different human/monster builds play very differently from each other. There is also a ingame database to keep track of all the traps, monsters, and items, and even a monster/boss duel mode, where you can practice as a human or as a monster to improve your skills.

The only drawback I could say about this game is the fact that it doesn't have online multiplayer, and that it is quite different in terms of gameplay flow when you get started for the first time. The online multiplayer aspect is not a big deal. This game plays at a fast, almost twitch-like speed, and lag would utterly ruin the experience. As for the gameplay, a gross approximation I would make is classic Zelda crossed with Dark Souls, but the monsters are hilarious jerks because they're your friends sitting next to you! But really, it's a bit of a gross approximation - CRAWL is one of a kind. And the devs are great guys. They provide substantial updates to this game - not very often, but it's only 2 guys and they take the time to address balance issues while adding content during updates. They'll even talk to you on their Facebook page and respond to emails you send them. 

I'll say this though: if you ask them about online multiplayer, they'll tell you that they'll finish the game first then add it later, so don't get your hopes up.

Anyway, get it, my personal GOTY every year since it launched because it's just so damn fun.

20432454.review:
Crawl is an excellent four player local competitive game, with a well defined style and a lot of heart. You're four lost souls damned to wander an unholy dungeon, fighting to escape through exerting your will upon the frail flesh which happens to pass before you. As a spirit, you are ever at odds for when you inhabit the hero the other spirits seek to displace you, and when you are a spirit, you must be the one to strike the killing blow if you would escape. Once you've advanced your hero to a sufficient level, and subsequently discovered a portal, you can go through it to face a monstrosity which may end up inhabited by all your foes. Fail there, and return to the dungeon, until someone escapes, or you collectively fail too often.

If Crawl has a flaw, and you do not agree that the flaws are at times inherent to the beauty of a piece, it is that the game loop is secured around four players. If you do not have four people, you will need to fill the remaining slots with A.I. which - while quite capable - is not nearly as unpredictable and thus exciting as a human player.

Purchase a copy, invite three of your friends, and prepare to writhe - no - crawl your way back to the living.

20302378.review:
What an incredibly well done couch/party game!
Pretty quick, entertaining runs; easy to learn, (moderately) hard to master; weird ideas; very different monsters, traps and items; excellent retro style.

The game might not seem fair every moment, because sometimes the hero gets bashed without a chance or monsters squished like bugs, but fairness comes back by the game's leveling system: the more the enemy heros level up, the more you can improve your monsters. That way even players with bad luck or lower skills advance.

Even in Early Access Crawl already is more enjoyable and has a higher replay value than many (if not most!) finished games. One of the few things that should be improved (especially concerning balance) are the boss fights, but even if the game stayed exactly as it is, I'd still love it. (In fact, I wonder how much better it can possibly get...)

20207654.review:
Crawl is a retro 8 bit pixel throwback with quite a gameplay twist. 

The controls on gamepads are very simple, being the traditional A=attack and B=special, like a true child of the '80s. The gameplay is superb, though a bit tricky to get used to at first. (But hey, they're doing something new, so it will take a little bit of getting used to).

The ability of the player mobs to spawn on pentagrams is well thought out, but they also have the ability to take control of traps to further inhibit the Dungeoneer. This can become a bit of a clusterfuck if you have 3 enemy players, as some of the rooms are very small in regards to the amount of anti-hero objects in them.

The leveling up features seem pretty smooth, as well as the Wrath mechanics, and the shop. The Boss pentagram that appears on each level (accessible at lvl 10) sends you to a room where you battle one of many huge bosses. This can feel a bit like an attack-spam sometimes, but only if you are significantly prepared for the boss through the purchase of upgrades. It does still feel like a retro boss battle.

Overall I would give Crawl an 8/10

They are bringing something new and interesting to the table in the form of something familiar. It is a great game to play  alone, or with friends, and it's a great excuse to cuss your friends out when they booby trap kill you before the final room.

Anyways 9/10 for not enough russian bear.

20199090.review:
Crawl is an awesome multiplayer (local) game in which you, your friends and AI will control up to 3 ghosts. The players will be competing for gold and experience while traversing a dungeon. One player will spawn as the hero, and the remaining players will start as ghosts. The currently alive player will move from room to room, coming across pentagrams in most rooms. The ghosts can activate these to summon one of 3 monsters chosen in a kit at the start of the game. 

Should a ghost deal the killing blow on the player, they spawn as the hero and must continue the dungeon! Each floor has a shop and boss ring the player can interact with, as well as other wishing wells and a few other entitys to work with. 

The combat is fun, there's plenty of weapons the store offers, plenty of artifacts to modify the character, as well as spells to get from the shop. 

Pros: 
A fun (currently local) fighting game for friends to challenge each other in. 
Plenty of weapons to choose from, a good bit of item variation. 
Lots of unlocks to encourage replayability. 
Challenging bosses that force the ghost/players to work together to kill the hero/player
More content to come! 
The combat is solid and fun. 
Nice design for a minimalist/pixel game.

Cons: 
While maps are randomly generated, there isn't any difference in backgrounds or themes at this time of review
 The sound is very harsh and not appeasing at all.

20191435.review:
Amazing 4 player couch co-op game! 

When I first bought the game things seemed really chaotic and disjointed, but after about 5 minutes in-game things started making a lot of sense: You're basically playing a modified version of playground-style Predator vs Prey. One person starts out as the hero and the other three players (or AI) are ghosts that can inhabit deadly traps to attack the hero, or stand on a pentagram and become a monster with special abilities. 

The goal of the hero is to level up and beat the dungeon boss, while the goal of the ghosts are to collect ectoplasm to level up, kill the hero, take over his body and kill the boss. Along the way, you stumble upon shops where you can buy trinkets that give you buffs, or new weapons. Going deeper into the dungeon allows all players to level up their summonable monsters which evens the playing field between hero and ghost.

The first time I got to play this game with three other friends was when I realized that this game was truly worth the purchase and the risk of buying an early access game. I tend to stay away from EA games unless I see that they have true potential of becoming a complete game, and this one definitely has it. If you're on the fence about getting this game, take my advice and BUY IT! You won't be dissapointed.

19672139.review:
KurzRezension:
"Jeden Cent wert, wenn man seine Freunde um den PC versammeln kann!"

Wenn du mehr wissen möchtest:

_TECHNIK_[4,5/5]:

Kompatibel[5/5]: 

Ich habe 3 Xbox Controller viva Wirless Adapter an den PC angeschlossen und lasse das Spiel über den Fernseher laufen. 
Die Xbox Controller wurden ohne Probleme auch vom Spiel erkannt. Auflösung etc wurde auf den Fernseher eins a übertragen. Das Spiel läuft mit seinem 8Bit luck stets flüssig und hat keine Ruckler auch auf meinen PC. Ich hatte keine Probleme nach den Installieren mit den Starten oder derweiteren. 

Grafik[4/5]:

Alter 8Bit luck der liebevoll gestaltet ist in einem 2D-Umbegung. Hat für mich aber seinen eigenen Charm und frustiert nicht durch Ruckler oder Frameeinbrüche.



_STORY_ [3/5]:
Ein rastloser Held der sich bemüht aus einem Verlies zu entkommen, während die rachsüchtigen Geister ihn nach seiner Menschlichkeit trachten. 

Die Story ist noch immer besser, als die von Halo 5 :P, ausserdem gibt es viele Geheimnisse und liebevoll gemachte Zustände im Spiel, die nicht verraten möchte, die jedoch Atmosphäre ins Spiel bringen, deshalb möchte ich die fehlende Story nicht als allzu schlecht bewerten.
_Spielmechanik_ [10/5]:

Grundmechanik [20/5]:

Crawl macht erst spaß, wenn man es mit Freunden spielt. (Bis zu 4Spieler)
Jemand spielt den Held, der versucht Stufe 10 zu kommen um den Endboss zu vernichten. (LevelCap: 20)
Die anderen spielen Geister die Dämonen beschwören können und verschiedene Fallen benutzen können, um den Helden um die Ecke zu bringen. Derjenige der den Helden tötet, bekommt seine menschlichkeit wieder und wird zu helden. Level und Gegenstände gehen in der Partie nicht verloren. Eine Partie endet, wenn die Gruppe 3mal scheiterte einen der bisher 2 Endbosse zu töten oder den Endboss besiegt. 

Held:
Der Held sammelt Erfahrung und Gold.

Mit GOLD kann er sich Buffs, Fähigkeiten und Waffen kaufen. 
Dabei gibt es verschiedene Waffentypen, die sich von ihrer Handhabung unterscheiden. Die Waffen obwohl sie den gleichen Typen haben, können dabei verschiedene Effekte haben und natürliche verschiedene Schadensarten.
Fähigkeiten & Buffs unterscheiden sich nur von ihrer Handhabung.

Mit ERFAHRUNG steigt er Level auf, mit der Eigenschaften automatisch auflevelt. Mit Stufe 10 kann er durch ein Portal reisen.

The gameplay is brilliant and unique, intense with just one friend to play local with a controller.  Even alone, it's bizarre and beautiful.  This is another indie Dark Fantasy title that's joining a few others in squirming out from the depths - oh, I could not be happier for this black tide.  

You'll see.  You'll all see.

19579050.review:
There's not much about this game that hasn't already been said. Everything currently in the game is extremely tight, polished, well-balanced and incredibly fun. I only have a few gripes.

Play if you're looking for:
Local MP with some beers and some buds.
Polished dungeon crawling with excellent controls.
Competition.
Monster evolution.
A game where you get to be the bad guys/bosses.

Don't play if you:
Have no local friends to play with.
Don't have a controller.
Don't like pixel games.

As I have said, everything in the game is amazing. The only problem I have is what's NOT in the game. For this to really hit just the right spot, it really only needs more content. The developers are releasing updates every several weeks, however, so this shouldn't be a problem for long. I would personally like to see more than one boss, as there is only a single one right now.

In time, I would also like to see the life of the game sessions expanded a bit. I'm certain it's a lot more fun with a full party, but if your game consists of only two players it is over quite quickly. The monster evolution trees can be fairly short and the requirement to unlock the boss is easy to attain. I would like to see an option wherein you can increase the level required to access the boss.

The mouse and keyboard controls are also terrible independently. You can either pick the keyboard or the mouse, but not both. An option to combine these two would solve the problem (WASD to move, mouse to attack).

Crawl has honestly blown my expectations away, giving me the feel of nostalgia from it's music and art style while also giving me the kind of gameplay that has nearly infinite replay value. 19124891.review:
Bueno, que les puedo decir, se vé que eh jugado unas cuantas horas pero no quiere decir que el juego en sí tengo algo malo, es que a veces me da pereza jugar o hacer cualquier otra cosa xD, lo que les puedo decir de este juego es que es completamente divertido y más cuando se juega en grupo de amigos donde todos se echen un par de insultos por matarse :v (lo digo porque estaría chido, no porque me hubiera pasado :v)... ¿por qué?

Bueno, la respuesta es simple y es que este juego se hizo para jugar con amigos con controles de xbox, como sin controles, es decir, un jugador puede decidir jugar con el mouse, el teclado, un mando, etc. Esto dice que en amigos se juega.

El juego tiene una mecánica simple y original puesto a que trata de un sujeto o par de sujetos que intentan individualmente de salir de una caverna o cueva y para esto tienen que subir de nivel hasta poder invocar y enfrentarse al boss, ¿por qué individual? Pues porque sólo 1 es humano y los otros 1, 2, o 3 son fantasmas que intentan matarte para reencarnar en tu cuerpo (por así decirlo) mediante pactos en el suelo en las cámaras donde te vas, los cuales les sirven a los fantasmas para reencarnar en un monstruo e intentar matarte y pos obtener tu cuerpo 7u7. Es original, al menos para mi porque ningun juego que haya jugado tiene este tipo de cosas, y simple porque es morirte, invocar y matar y revivir... IZI.

La jugabilidad o el control no es complicada puesto a que... como les digo... sólo 2 botones para atacar, el de ataque simple y el especial, y aparte las flechas para moverte (en el teclado, en el mouse pues moverlo :v y el mando la palanca)
así que si no te gusta jugar con alguno, cambiaselo a un amigo por otro si es que juegas con un amigo.

Les cuento que en el transcurso que eh jugado el tiempo de las partidas son de larga duración puesto a que te mueres y en el transcurso en que intentas matar al vato que es humano es largo, y a veces te roban la reencarnación xD (me a pasado :'v), en promedio creo que +20 min. por ser que invocar al boss el lvl minimo es de 10.

Las actualizaciones son hermosas, agregan objetos para implementar la fuera, agilidad o la vida, otros objetos pues te convierten en vampiro, te mandan a tragarte un corazón de humano, demonio, etc. Una anécdota mia es que hace como marzo que no juego y ahora en noviembre (2015) implementaron algo en la interfaz de el niveleo de monstruos, para no espoilearles cuando la pones es épico nivelear tus monstruos y escuchar a tus amigos nivelear a los suyos *-*.

Bueno, básicamente en mi opinión y criterio con el cual critico este juego, es un gran juego para jugar con amigos como sólo pues se pone jarcor cuando peleas con las cpu :v (perr*s 8)) estilo mata y revive si es que existe con actualizaciones fantásticas, objetos, monstruos y mecánicas originales que te dejan con un buen sabor de boca. 10/10 ''Oh mai gunnes'' Lion Hirus 2015

18766239.review: CRAWL ist ein sich in Entwicklung befindlicher Early Access Titel zweier australischer Programmierer, der schon jetzt super funktioniert und jeden Cent seiner 9,99€ wert ist! Bis zu 4 Spieler beharken sich im Local Multiplayer (online kommt wahrscheinlich nicht mehr), wobei einer einen Helden spielt, alle anderen jedoch Geister kontrollieren, die diesen zu töten versuchen. Als Geist kann man Monster oder Fallen "besetzen", um den Helden zu bekämpfen. Derjenige, der dem Helden den finalen Stoß versetzt, materialisiert sich sofort selbst als Held, während der Besiegte zum Geist wird. Die Geister arbeiten im Team zusammen und steigern ihre zu kontrollierenden Monster, als Held sammelt man Erfahrung, Waffen und Items, um sich der Geister zu erwehren und letztlich den Endgegner herauszufordern. Der dann auch von den Geisterspielern gesteuert wird! Ständig ändern sich die Allianzen und Machtverhältnisse unter den Spielern. Die Levels sind immer zufallsgeneriert. Jedes Spiel ist dynamisch, schnell und verläuft anders. Es ist die Turboversion eines DungeonCRAWLers, gekreuzt mit einem Party Game. Der Grafikstil ist pixelig doch ungemein liebevoll detailliert und animiert. Ein Spiel zum lieb haben, von dem man auch träumt.....

先说，这游戏值得一玩。这是一个4人游戏，跟朋友一起玩特别嗨，除非你的朋友很少，那你可以跟电脑玩儿。这游戏就是一个人扮演英雄，其他人扮演怪。具体游戏是什么个玩法，自己看游戏介绍。我想说的是，这不只是一个杀怪的游戏，怪之间要懂得配合，把英雄当BOSS打。或者说，你觉得这英雄太菜了，就干掉他（抢人头！），自己当英雄。怪可以靠攻击英雄打出的伤害获得BLOOD来升级，英雄可以击杀怪物获得经验升级，然后获取金币去商店购买物品、魔法、武器等等用来加强自己的东西。10级之后就可以激活符咒开BOSS房打BOSS了，总共有3次挑战BOSS的机会，控制怪的玩家控制BOSS攻击英雄，杀了他之后会损失一次挑战BOSS的机会。谁干掉了BOSS，就谁赢。要是3次全失败，呃，反正我们没有失败过3次我不知道会发生啥事。跟基友们一起玩特别基情，人越多越基情，真心值得一玩。快买买买，然后跟你女朋友玩儿去。然后就会正如我所愿的分手的。哈-哈。

18708581.review:
This game is supposed to support controllers fully,but it doesn't work very well.Impossible to bind controls on a single controller,pressing a single button activates the controller for Player 1,but pressing another different button (which you have to do to bind the controls) activates the controller for Player 2 also.Try pressing ESC to cancel it,it activates the keyboard for Player 3.Try to click on something to go back,it activates the mouse for player 4.Although it seems possible to bind controls by clumsily binding 1 controller to 1,using ALT+F4 to return to steam,re-launching and repeating the process,for me it would glitch at the 3rd controller and controller 1&2 would get mixed up.

My controllers work perfectly as xbox 360 wired controllers on every other single game I own,so I'm pretty sure it's not a problem on my part.Complete shame as this game looks really fun.


EDIT :

Last night I got drunk with my friends,and we were bored so I thought I'd reinstall Crawl to see if it worked,and guess what- it did. No idea why,I desinstalled and reinstalled it about 20 times before but for some reason,my controllers get properly recognised now (maybe a patch was released,I don't know)

So the review then:

- This game is really fun.It's a bit difficult to understand and to explain (especially when playing with non english speakers) but the learning curve isn't too steep.
-The mechanics are really engaging and you won't find yourself watching your friends have fun,some times you'll prefer playing as a monster because who doesn't want to be able to be a dragon,a lovecraftian-cthulhu-mind flayer,or a giant skeleton knight ?
-I just started but it seems like there is a LOT to unlock in this game.Combos with skills/trinkets are pretty cool though sometimes imbalanced (raging bull + haunted axe x 3 = GG GL HF)  but it's a party game,not a competitive game.
-The versus doesn't just inculde monsters vs human.You'll often try to steal a kill to regain your humanity,but when the human player has to fight a boss,you'll cooperate to make sure he doesn't win.

I didn't quite understand how you reach the final struggle(game ends after that,which caught us off guard as we thought we could re-try the final boss several times) but hopefully I'll find an answer in the forums.It's definitely a multiplayer game though,so I wouldn't recommend buying it if you don't have anyone willing to play with you,the bots are fairly easy to beat.
