18538826.review:
This game is that creepy coin-op machine in the dark corner of the arcade that everyone is a little bit scared of. It eminates a eerie, black glow, and twitches occasionally, as if it's powered by some supernatural force. 

The shared-screen multiplayer experience is fish 'n' chip shop nostalgia (thanks to the excellent 8-bit-ish soundtrack), expertly mixed with an 80s horror-thriller vibe, and other elements make it feel just a bit magical. The gameplay itself can be thought of as a double-dragon RPG Binding-of-Isaac mashup with lasting replayability. The 1-UP experience is lovely, but you'll need a friend (or three) to fully appreciate this visionary work of genius.

Highly recommended.

Every stage has got a portal room, a shop and of course a staircase to the next stage.
You can activate the portal to the boss if you have reached level 10.
In the shop you can buy 3 weapons ([ 1. attak ]e.g.: a sword, a bow. an axe), 2 spells ([ 2. attak ] different effect) , 2 potions (e.g.: healt, streanght, speed ) and 3 artefacts ( different effect).
You can have only 1 weapon and 1 spell at the time.
In total the boss can be fightin 3 times. 
If the human beats by the goasts controlled boss he automaticlly wins but if the boss survives 3 times he escapes and the player with the higerst level wins.

As a ghoast you are able to go in traps (e.g.: a crossbow on 3 wooden legs ) and pentagrams.
On a  pentagram you can spawn 1 your 3 monsters wich will be randomly chosen  by the game.
If you level up a monster he changes his look and attacks and gets stronger obviosly.
When a goast damages the human it get's gold.

If you are the human the you can get gold from chests, you can find them sometimes in rooms.
You can only level up, buy things in the shop, activate the portal to the boss and use the staircase when you are the human.
As the human you also decide in witch room to go.

You can change controlls at yourself in the option menu.
In the main menu you can find logs for every trap, monster and weapon.
There isn't online mode yet and I'm not sure if Powerhoof wants to add this mode.
Sorry for my writing mistackes and please dont be to hard on me because it's my first review.

Can't recomend the game enough. The game is updated every few months providing plenty of time to test out the new additions and get used to the tweaks. The devs are active in the steam forums and are VERY open to discussion and reccomendations. 

gameplay:
one player (chosen at random) controls the hero at the start, the other players are ghosts that control the monsters and traps. 
dungeons are randomly generated and each room has a minimum pentagram(monster spawn point) equal to the number of players controlling ghosts. 
each player has 3 monsters based on the god you choose to worship. 
god can also provide a bonus to your hero character. 
evolve monsters by damaging or effecting the hero. 
branching monster evolution tree. While they are fairly limited there is still a large selection and every combination is possible.  
definitely more fun with people but single player against AI is fun as well. 

really the only negative is that when playing with 4 people it is possible for one player to be underleveled in one form or the other. 
if the other 3 players are the only ones getting a chance at being the hero then the 4th player has higher level monsters but the lowest level hero fighting the higher level monsters. granted they will gain xp for killing the hero (which is usually enough for a 1-4 level up). the player would at this point have a massive stockpile of gold (also gained from harming the hero) and can purchase a large amount of upgrades provided they can find the store on that floor.

finding the store isnt dificult because the doors are marked with a red stairs (end of floor) blue portal (boss aka how to win the game) an anvil (shop) or a ? if an area is unexplored.

ranged weapons have been fixed from earlier versions where they were clunky but are now much smoother to use. 

bosses: there are 2 bosses

 a 3 headed hydra where each player controls a head

and a squid monster where one player controls the eye and the other 2 control tentacles. 

great party game

18137901.review:
Crawl is an incredibly fun multiplayer dungeon crawler, where you take control of a hero, or monsters.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BTW6VWBZhT8
At the beginning, everyone selects what monster leader they'd like, which determines what monster minions they'll be able to use within the game. Once a game starts, one player is chosen to be the human hero. The other players start as ghosts, that can only affect the player through possessing traps around the dungeon, or spawning as a monster on a pentagram. All monsters have unique abilities. 

If a monster kills the hero, they will become the hero themselves, and transform the previous hero into a monster. If the hero kills a monster, then they will gain xp, as well as give "wrath" to the enemy ghosts. The ghosts can then use this to upgrade their monsters into evolutions with different abilities. This keeps the game balanced very well. 
A hero can use collected gold to purchase new weapons, spells and accessories at shops. The hero also uses xp to level up to level 10. Once that has been reached, a portal will open on the floor, and allow the hero access to the boss.

Boss fights are interesting, because the enemy ghosts can take control of different parts of the boss. Shooting acidic balls out of one hydra head, or bubbles out of a tentacle.

There's a lot to the game that makes it very interesting, and can be quite strategic if you really plan things well.
It's a lot of fun when played with friends, although the AI is also quite competent.

Overall, a great game!

I think there's a couple things that need to happen to make this one of my favorite games:

One, with little effort, is to make the little reticle under your character always be your color. There are times when me and some other ghost are the same creature and there's no way to tell who's who, It's a classic problem. If you could find a way to do it without color it'd be even better -- I have color blind friends and they were particularly handicapped.

Another, with exponentially more effort, is the addition of more "area" types; you could do an ice place, or jungle ruins place, I don't care, just a couple more different color swatches to look at would help with playing this over and over. I'm sure you've put an INSANE amount of effort into all the animation polish; hopefully just adding in a couple more environments wouldn't be so difficult.

I know you're really focused on the playable monsters but try not to neglect bosses, the atmosphere, etc. Not that you have, It'd just be a shame for you to stop with just that.

Anyway, great work so for with this. I'm excited to see where you take it.

18101575.review:
I've played this game ever since it came out. I invited some friends over, and we had a blast screwing each other over, and continue to to this day. The game has come so far, starting with just 3 evolutionary trees and a handful of monsters, to 10+ trees, 40 monsters, and a gigantic variety of monster-slaying weaponry to fend off your impending doom. If you're looking for a fun party game with an arcadey, rpg feel, this is the game for you. If I had the opportuntiy to buy this game again, I would gladly do so,

I do have a few minor complaints -- you almost need controllers to have the best experience. Playing with the keyboard or mouse is sufficient, but controllers provide a more fuild playstyle. Other than that, the only other problem I have is that some evolutionary trees seem to be better than others, but that really depends on your proficiency with certain monsters. 

As of when this review was written, there are only two bosses, but the ghosts work together inside of one boss to thwart the player. There is a hydra, with three heads -- fire, ice, and poison -- and a kranken that fires an enormous laser whilist trapping the hero in bubbles and spewing pink acid. Nothing is more satisfying than killing the boss on your ast try, with 1 health remaining... or, killing the hero at the very last second.

Having all 4 players isn't a necesity, but does provide a unique experience. Colluding with your friends to utterly destroy the human is such a fun feeling. If you don' have 4 friends immediately around, playing vs another friend is a challenge that tests your ability to fully utilize your monsters and/or hero abilities and skills. On the off-chance you have exactly 0 people to play with, you can always fight with the AI on varrying difficulty levels.

10/10, would kill friends over and over again.

Pienso, mientras me como la última empanada de humita que queda en la mesa. 
Ya es el momento de decidir: ¿Me conviene asesinar a mis dos mejores amigos con el demoledor Minotauro o sería conveniente utilizar los puntos obtenidos, durante la última ronda, para optar por el intrépido licántropo?
Es que debo meditarlo bien.
Ellos se lo buscaron. Se complotaron para darle masa a mi héroe. Sin asco... porque (claro) el juego es super rápido e intuitivo (vamos, se juega con dos botones), pero los rogue-like nunca fueron su fuerte y éste es algo caótico, a decir verdad. Igual, ya saben las cosas básicas: la aventura se desarrolla en mapas generados al azar, donde el jugador más hábil personificaría al Caballero, cuyo objetivo es enfrentarse a los avatares de sus otros tres competidores, que lo acecharán en el mismo nivel -quizá con algún demonio invocado desde un pentagrama en el suelo ó ayudando con alguna trampa-, todo con el afán de robar el protagonismo y convertirse, ellos mismos, en los héroes de ésta travesía. La que culmina con un épico boss-fight, 3 vs. 1 (una oportunidad que logra el primero en levelear su personaje al LVL 10)... 
Toda la partida es un divertido "tira y afloje" constante que se tensiona, mucho más, a medida que avanzamos: "-EH, WACHINES, ESO NO VALE", "-TOMÁ, ATREVIDO!", "-NAHHHH, QUÉ MENTIRA"...
Tampoco puedo olvidar que aún tengo algunos puntos en la reserva. Recolecto oro para equipar y mejorar las habilidades de mi personaje (aunque resulte algo anticlimático entrar en la Tienda, no es nada demasiado complejo y siempre es satisfactorio verle la cara a mis amigos cuando me compro esas dagas arrojadizas).
Mi segundo objetivo sería terminar con el terror sembrado por el fantasma de la Inteligencia Artificial -por ahora, la que mejor juega de los tres... por ahora-. Creo que no se extenderá mucho su reinado, porque todavían quedan much... ¡Oh! Bien, ya me están insultando.
Compro el pescado gigante y fué...

17802036.review:
Crawl is a roguelike game that is being developed by the Australian team, PowerHoof. This game was put onto Steam's early access list in August 2014. The developers are very active with producing updates and content for the game, as you can see by their updated blog - http://www.powerhoof.com/

Whilst I try to steer clear of Early Access games, and especially reviewing them, I decided to break my trend and try this game out as it was one I have been following for a while now. 

Crawl can be played single player, or with up to four people on local co-op. I have only played single player so far, so my review will be solely based on that.  

One of the players will control the hero, and the others will be in control of ghosts. The ghost's aim is to kill the hero, they can do this by possessing traps in the randomly generated dungeon the hero is crawling through. Ghosts are also able to spawn into demons and monsters in various rooms.  The hero will gain experience points by killing monsters put before him, more experience means more health and more damage. The hero will also find gold, which can be used to purchase new weapons, items, potions and special abilities.  Once the ghost manages to kill a hero, they swap roles and you rinse and repeat. Monsters which kill the hero will be rewarded with Wrath points, these points can be used at the end of each level to level up the monsters to be able to do more damage and gain more powerful abilities. 

The traps found throughout the dungeons can vary from bouncing spike walls, to bolt arrow turrets. All of them provide a sufficient threat for the hero, since they can't actually be destroyed, all the hero can do is escape to the next room. Unlike the monsters, where the hero has to clear the room before being able to move on. 

Crawl uses a nicely presented pixel style art which has a nice charm to it. Whilst it is more pixelated than most games that use this style, it actually looks a lot better than most of them. It gives it a feel as if you are playing in an arcade, with the Metal Slug style character selection screen, and the health bars at the bottom for all the players. I really enjoyed the look of Crawl, even though it's using a style which is growing very thin in the PC market at the moment. 

From what I have seen so far, there is no story behind any of the game, purely focuses on the gameplay elements. 

To begin with, Crawl is a very hard game to get to grips with. There isn't an easily find-able help menu or tutorial, and you are kind of just left to figure it out on your own. Whilst this can be done after ten or fifteen minutes, it would of been nice to get a proper introduction to the game. Since I was playing on single player mode, and was up against the AI all the time, I managed to breeze through the levels with hardly any difficulty at all. When it comes to purchasing items from the shop, the AI just seemed to pick things at random, whether they are worse than what they currently had or not. Maybe this is something which can be fixed in up coming updates.  I would anticipate the multiplayer mode to be where a difficulty curve takes a large rise though. 

All of the dungeons in Crawl are randomly generated, so I can't really say much about the level design, but what I can say is that all the rooms are still interesting to be in, they have a large selection of breakable objects, some of which will hold extra gold, there are normally one or two traps in each room for the ghosts to poses, and there are normally, two, if not three, summoning ports for the ghosts to take control of one of their minions or monsters. 

There is a huge amount of replay-ability to be had with Crawl; I am about two hours into playing so far, and I am barely scratching the surface as to the amount of gameplay there is. Each time you finish a run, you unlock new weapons, items and abilities to use, making the next run you play completely different to the last.  I would absolutely love to see some sort of online multiplayer added to this game, limiting it to just local multiplayer seems like a silly idea to me, especially if you are putting your game on Steam. It could so easily be integrated with Steam's servers and made to be a fantastic online multiplayer experience. 

I had no technical issues whilst playing the game. A controller is highly recommended, as most rogue-likes go, it is increasingly difficult to play these games on a keyboard. 

To conclude, since Crawl is still an early access title, I am simply going to recommend it, but verging on the side of caution. Whilst the devs are still updating the game currently, early access games always run the risk of never being completed. However, the game has a low enough in price to allow you to take that risk with the knowledge that you are easily getting your money's worth as things stand at the moment. If/when this game gets a full release, it's easily going to be a game you'll keep installed ready to launch when you have friends over.


[b][u] Tom's Score Card[/u][/b]
1) Stay away
2) Only recommended when on sale
[b][u]3) Recommended[/u][/b]
4) Highly recommended
5) This is a must play

If you found this review helpful, please consider giving it a thumbs up. You can also find more reviews over at http://www.completingthebackloggroup.com/

http://store.steampowered.com/app/293780

17481685.review:
I thoroughly enjoy Crawl. The graphics and simple controls give a really nice asthetic feel to the game, like something you'd play on an old console. Despite it's apparent simplicity, Crawl is anything but.

The game handles the fast paced action of The Hero (you) being attacked by all of the Spirits (your friends) incredibly well. The team work potential of Spirits to destroy The Hero, using the huge number of combinations of items, monsters, and traps that exist gives the game a lot of replay value.

A few parts beautiful graphics, several parts chaotic action, one part slow motion, Crawl is a great game that will (probably) cement your bonds of friendship with friends.

Clever trash talk not included.

17441689.review:
Short version:
Get it if you have 1 to 3 friends, (so, a total of 4 peeps,) that love playing new types of games on a couch.

Longer version:
Couch Conflict games are great but tend to fall into a very small selection of catagories.
A large number are 1 screen platformers.
Another swathe are 1 screen "asteroids" based twin stick shooters.
Within these 2 large pools there are some stellar gems, a lot of winners, a few minor tweaks and innovations and a lot of "others" that don't really distinguish them selves well.
For the most part, if you have a handful of entries from these groups in your library, you'll have the basics covered and dipping back in too the pools probably won't net you anything wonderfully different.

So it's always exciting when clever people come up with something that feel radically different with out over complicating what you seek out from these experiances.
Nighogg is a great example of this idea, and if you're looking at Crawl as a multiplayer couch gamer, you probably already know about the joys of that.

What Crawl offers is different again... and does take a minute more to absorb, but after that you will be drinking in a game that takes the head to head nature of this genre and mixes in a brilliant and ever changing landscape of all vs 1 and and great "begining-middle-end" arc in each session.

If you have your basic couch conflict games covered, Get Nidhogg and get this and you'll have a great little menu to pick from.

Nighog for instantly accessable gaming at snack like speed.
Twin stick arenas and 1 screen platformers for experiances with a hair more length and variable substance.
Crawl for a solid hunk of entertainment that still leaves room for multiple sessions.

(Oh and Mount your friends for dessert... because it's fruity and lite) :D

17425499.review: Crawl is a great game I give it 4 out of 5 stars for the state its in as of 08/07/2015 and let me tell you why. Its pretty much like its not in early access. What I like about the game is that there are a lot of possibilities in the battle of who is to win. I like how there are only three chances you get to win the game. With that being said, anyone over the level of 10 could go for it when they reach the shrine. As of right now there are two bosses you can either be or fight which is randomly chosen for you when you activate the shrines. Either you or the other 3 players (depending on who activates the shrine) become part of the three parts of the boss, and you have to try to defeat the boss while the others use the boss to defeat you. Anyone can fail twice fighting the boss battles. The third time whoever fails will ultimately lose the game and the other players win in a first, second, third basis.(The loser being 4th) I also like the dynamic of there is one hero and the others are ghosts vying for the life of the hero and use forms of monsters to try to steal the life of the hero and become him. All an all this is a great game and I cannot wait for the full version. What I would like to see in the full version is a database for all that you unlock like a lore, just like Risk Of Rain. And also I really hope and pray they create multiplayer because that would make it 5 stars in my opinion.

17243580.review:
Crawl. Eine Runde ca. 1 Stunde mit dem Potential 1-3 Freundschaften zu zerstören. Das Spiel hört sich nicht nur interessant an, sondern ist es auch. 

Man spielt mit 2-4 Spielern, oder Bots, wobei 1 Spieler der "Held" ist und die anderen 1-3 Spieler die "Schurken" sind, die dem Helden die Tour versauen sollen. Die fiesen Geister die von den 3 anderen Spielern gesteuert werden, können Schleime (Ectoplasma) spawnen, die dem Helden schaden, sowie die Kontrolle über diverse Monster übernehmen um den Helden den Todesstoß zu verpassen. Der Held levelt indem er Monster tötet und Kristalle zerstört, kann Gold finden, und im Shop neue Waffen, Zauber, Tränke etc. kaufen. Das Ziel des Helden ist es den Endboss zu besiegen. Der Bossraum kann ab Stufe 10 betreten, aber vermutlich noch nicht bezwungen, werden. Immer wenn einer der Schurken den Helden tötet, wird er zum Helden und versucht  Stufen aufzusteigen und gute Ausrüstung zu erwerben. Der gefallene Held wird zum Schurken. Nach jedem "Floor" können die Monster die den Schurken zur Verfügung stehen upgegradet werden und bei betreten eines neuen "Floors" ändert sich der Dungeon komplett. Neue Räume, Neue Gegenstände im Shop. Besiegt der Held den Enboss, so gewinnt er. Verlieren die Helden 3 mal gegen den Endboss, so gewinnen die Schurken. Ich durfte beide Szenarios bereits erleben.

Was mir an diesem Spiel sehr gefällt ist, dass man sich sehr hineinsteigert und wirklich sein absolut Bestes gibt. Der Held will nicht sterben und der Schurke will den Todesstoß setzen um selber weiter zu kommen.
Weiterhin werden nach jeder Runde die man gespielt hat neue Waffen, Zauber, Bosse, Monstersets usw. freigeschaltet. Wovon am Ende alle etwas haben.

Das Einzige was mir oder uns nicht gefallen hat ist, dass die Rolle des Helden nicht Reihum geht, sondern immer demjenigen zuteil wird der ihm den Todesstoß verpasst hat. Macht schon Sinn, aber wenn man Pech hat kommt man so ziemlich lange oder gar nicht dazu den Helden zu spielen. Aber es lässt sich darüber streiten ob das nun gut oder schlecht ist.

Fazit:
Dieses Spiel ist seinen Preis aufjedenfall wert. Es wirkt nicht wie ein Early Access-Spiel, sondern wie ein verdammt spaßiges Vollständiges Spiel. Auf Neue Inhalte freue ich mich natürlich trotzdem!

Extremely fun game! Especially with friends, of course!

The best part of the game is that even when you die, or when you fail to become human, you get mad, then you just shrug and figure "Hey! Now I get crazy better monsters now!" It's a genius concept and fun wether you're winning or losing.

Only real bad side is that ranged weapons often can make a human OP (my friends hate when I have the fire bow with a spirit bow spell), but I imagine tweaks will be made in the future to balance out issues like that.

The fact that this is still early access also makes this game very cool because you get to look forward to the updates and the new additions to the dungeon!

16871741.review:
After a couple hours of gameplay, this is easily one of the most addicting games I've ever played. It's a fairly simple dungeon-crawler, yet it is very enjoyable. Very old-school, which is something I appreciate. In each round there are 4 players. Of these players, 3 are ghosts and 1 is a human. As a ghost, the objective is to work together with the other ghosts to slay the human. This can be done by turning into enemies, activating traps, and summoning blobs. When a human dies, the ghost who landed the killing blow then becomes the human. The goal is to stay human long enough to become level 10, after which you must find a portal and defeat a boss.

Pros and Cons:
+ Simple to learn, yet hard to master
+ Very addictive
+ Great multiplayer
+ Nonstop action, monster or human
+ Well-balanced mechanics (monster strength, health, etc.)
+ Old-school, classic video game feeling
+ Well randomized, even with small details
+ Lots of weapons
+ BE THE MONSTER
- No online multiplayer
- Only 2 bosses

As you can see, I have few complaints about the game. Overall, it is a well-made and very enjoyable game.

16869701.review: The game is fun, if a bit hectic and fast for my taste. Also brings to mind a game I played (and liked) on IOS called Hero's Quest.

16869593.review: If you're doing local multiplayer, it's a fucking blast.

16855050.review: Crawl is the definition of party games to play when you want to start a fight with your friends. Crawl is a co-op(or single player with bots) retro arcade simulator fantasy dugeon crawler. Aiding yourself with powerups, spells and abilities, and tons of unique weapons, the hero must fight through levels and levels of dungeon against player coltrolled monsters. As you get stronger, so do the monsters. As a human player your goal is to reach level 10 and kill the boss(which is also player controlled). However, everyone else plays the roll of the monsters and traps in the dungeon which constantly evolve and become more and more difficult. If you are killed you become a ghost and your killer becomes the hero. See where this is going? This game has competition and rage written all over it. One can play a quick game within 15-20 min, but the longer the game lasts the more exiting it tends to be. The developers are constantly releasing new content and making the game better and better with each update. For anyone who enjoys dungeon crawlers or simply wants a game to play with their friends, this game is for you.

16764207.review:
Crawl sisältää sohva cooppioopin kaikki hyvät ja huonot puolet. 
Pelissä yksi pelaaja aloittaa sankarina ja muut pelaajat haamuina, jotka yrittävät estää sankarin etenemistä käyttämällä hyväkseen ympäristössä olevia ansoja, tai pentagrammeja joiden avulla he voivat kontrolloida erilaisia hirviöitä ja vetää sankariamme pataan oikein kunnolla.
 
Pelin jippo piilee siinä, että kuka aiheuttaa sankariin viimeisen iskun, pääsee itse seuraavaksi ohjaamaan tätä, mikä aiheuttaa välillä tilanteita joissa olet itse vaivalla mätkinyt mieheltä elämät lähes nolliin, mutta sitten pelaaja kolme tekee viimeisen iskun jollain saatanan harppuuna-ansalla ja nussii tapon törkeästi sun kädestä. Tämän vuoksi jotkut tapot saattavat tuntua halvoilta, mutta toisaalta tämä antaa myös altavastaajille mahdollisuuden pelata joten asia on plus miinus nolla.

Mutta "päähenkilöä" ohjaavakaan ei ole avuton, vaikka vastassa olisikin kolme vastaan yksi tilanne. Sankarimme voi vaihtaa mukanaan olevan veren rahaksi ja käyttää tätä ostaakseen kaupasta bustermiekkoja, erinäisiä loitsuja kuten lazeria ampuvia orbeja, hyperväistöjä, varsijousia, taikasauvoja, keihäitä yms. sekä juomia jotka nostavat sankarin eri statseja kuten nopeutta tai iskuvoimaa. Mutta verta jota rahaksi vaihdetaan ansaitsee (muutamia arkkuja lukuunottamatta) ainoastaan tekemällä ihmispelaajaan vahinkoa hirviöillä, joten tiimin hyödyttömät jäsenet jäävät nuolemaan näppejään.

Pelin voi myös voittaa molemmilla puolilla pelaten. Sankarin täytyy voittaa jompikumpi kahdesta loppuvastuksesta joita pääsee halutessaan kokeilemaan. Nämä vastukset ovat haamupelaajien yhdessä ohjaamia ja voivat pelaajien tasosta riippuen olla todella helppoja tai vaikeita. Jekku onkin siinä että loppukörmyjä voi kokeilla voittaa vain kolmesti ja kolmannella kerralla jos sankari epäonnistuu, peli loppuu haamujen voittoon.

Kenttien välillä vihollispelaajat voivat kehittää omia monsujaan joka kerta ikävimmiksi ja tämän vuoksi loppupuolen taistelut muuttuvat sankarin kannalta kohtuu epäreiluiksi, mutta minkäs teet.
Pelissä on kiitettävästi erilaisia monstereita kokeiltavaksi ja kentät ovat joka kerta randomisoitu joten toistoa ei kerry liiaksi, vaikka tietyt patternit saattavatkin näkyä useasti. Pelin grafiikat ovat myös tahallaan mukavan pikseliset ja biisitkin tukevat tunnelmaa, vaikka niitä olisi kyllä jälkeenpäin miettien saanut olla vähän enemmän. Peli myös toimii hyvin vähän heikommillakin koneilla joten se on aina plussaa.

Pelissä on kyllä muutamia kenkkuja puolia mitkä pistävät silmään. Muutamat kaupasta ostettavat itemit ovat selkeästi parhaita ja kuuluvat perusvarustukseen pelin voittamiseksi, kuten hyperdash, jonka avulla sankari voi välittömästi teleportata paikasta toiseen iskujen väistämiseksi. Olemme myös ystäviemme kanssa kieltäneet Berserk kyvyn käytön kokonaan, sillä tämä antaa napin painalluksella sankarille tuplavahingon ja nopeuden, eikä siinä kaikki sillä kyky latautuu uudestaan parissa sekunnissa. Tämän avulla peli on jo käytännössä voitettu vaikka pelkällä vasemmalla kädellä. hyi. 
Myös möllit ovat toistensa kanssa epätasapainossa, sillä toiset ovat toisia huomattavasti parempia ja jotkut ovat täysin hyödytömiä.

Myös aseita kuten nuija kannattaa välttää sillä niistä ei saa kuin pahaa mieltä ja rupia perseeseen. Se lyö kerran vuodessa ja ei osu kehenkään ja kun olet hitaasti lyömässä uudestaan olet jo kuollut sillä möllipelaajat ovat jo max levelillä ja itse pääsit juuri ensimmäistä kertaa tuntiin pelaamaan sankarilla, koska ystäväsi on hamstrannut joka kaupasta kaikki hp juomat ja pääsit etenemään vain yhden huoneen, perkele!  >:I

Yksin pelatessa pelistä jää vain ikävä jälki sieluun, mutta ystävien kanssa raivotessa peli on terapeuttisen loistavaa menoa, mutta muistakaa varata aikaa, sillä vain yksi sessio voi kestää pidempään kuin erä monopolia.
Lyhyinä ruiskeina peli on täydellinen, mutta pidempinä setteinä muuttuu helposti itseään toistavaksi tai turhauttavaksi.
Varaa siis mukaasi pitkä pinna, 2-pac colaa, kolme/neljä sohvaperunaa ja nauti hieman erillaisesta pelikokemuksesta.

16754197.review:
I bought this game a couple days ago and I have to say I am very dissapointed... in the obnoxious, trout-bearded tacowallets I call friends. What I expected to be a competitive and fun game to play with others turned out to be the biggest troll-fest to which I've ever been subjected. If they were in human form, they'd allow me to kill them without a fight just so they could have the satisfaction of teaming up on me. I climbed level after level, giving them precious vitae to evolve into the most powerful BS monsters I've ever faced in any game. I can't count how many times I was reduced to a puddle of blood by a giant death-beam eyeball with wings, or forced to endure a small room full of traps because they just HAD to drop a single blob as I was about to walk through the door. I was the only one able to make it to the boss battles with my humanity intact, but I soon discovered that this was just a complex ruse to make me use up all the portal attempts and have all memory of my character erased from history by getting barfed on by my friends' three headed dragon.
But as long as your co-op parters aren't complete jerks, you'll enjoy this well-polished game.
10/10 would get trolled again.

16389759.review:
最大４人まで参加可能な結構スピーディな2D対戦アクションゲーム（一応botも使えるよ）
個人的にはbotは面白くないので身内プレーを推奨。
あと当たり前だけどコントローラ必須。多人数プレイ的な意味でも。（遠距離武器が斜めのサイティングとかするのでキーボードは厳しい）
 
いい点

主人公側は動きが軽快で気持ちいい
武器、スペル、モンスターの種類が多くて楽しい（アンロック制だけどプレイ回数だし、１回プレーごとにアンロックだから楽）
モンスターの進化、お金のシステムによるゲームバランス（敵側も負けっぱなしにならない）
敵側も徒党を組んでの攻撃で盛り上がれる

悪い点

ラスボス（勝利条件）が複数いるが明らかに強いボスと弱いボスの差がある
1vs1だと主人公側が強すぎる
一部モンスターの進化系統が強すぎる
（全体的に悪いと感じたのはそこらへんのバランスだけ）


以下紹介

2～4人のプレイヤーが主人公側（1人）と幽霊側（他全員）に分かれて戦う。
最終的に主人公となってラスボスを倒した人が勝利する。
大事なのは「幽霊が主人公を殺害すると、その幽霊に主人公の役が移る」ということ。ハイエナ最高。
だから幽霊は、モンスターとして召還されたり、罠に憑依して罠を起動したり、とよってたかって全力で主人公を殺害する。
（幽霊側はめっちゃ楽しい）

もちろん主人公が弱いはずもなく、序盤は機動力と攻撃力でがんがんモンスターを倒して経験地を稼ぐ。
が、この世界ではモンスターを倒してもお金が出ないし、回復手段もほぼない。
だから装備は買えないしジリ貧でそのうち殺されてしまう…

でも幽霊側になっても落胆することは無い。むしろ幽霊は補給期間である。（しかも主人公をよってたかって殴れる）（楽しい）
主人公側ではお金は得られなかったが、幽霊側では攻撃をヒットさせたときに貰える。全力で主人公を殴ってお金を手に入れよう。
買い物はまた主人公になってからだけどな。頑張ろう。
また、他プレイヤーが主人公時に上げたレベルに応じて進化ポイントが得られる。
これで主人公になれない人も、誰よりも早く凶悪モンスターをぶん回せて楽しい。
モンスターも豊富。（単体で強いやつ、サポート力が高いやつとか）

ラスボス戦はラスボスの各攻撃部位に幽霊たちが憑依して主人公と戦う合体ロボみたいな状態の戦闘。
ただ、ラスボス側が慣れてないと主人公が勝ってしまう感じでここは微妙だと思った。
ぶっちゃけあんまり装備もそろってない主人公で1vs3でも勝てる。

いろいろ長くなったけど、戦闘アクションは楽しいし、盛り上がるのでお勧め。

This game is fun, and the time I've spent playing seems to just have washed away. This is one of the few games where I feel that the addiction that I get from playing it, is worth it.

 -Music is great

Cons:

   might get mixed up on who is who, because they are the same skin.

TL;DR
Get this game. It's great.

16252541.review:
Crawl is a unique experience that can only be described with one word. Awesome.
This dungeon crawling masterpiece is incredibly fun to play. I love playing it so much. Here's why:
-Radomized Dungeons: Each time you play the game, you get something different. Even the textures on the wall are different each run.
-Wide Variety of Weapons: There are lots of different weapons to choose from, and not all of them are the same. There are heavy melee, light melee, ranged weapons, and magic weapons as well as various spells/abilities that can be aquired during a run.
-Play as the Monsters: This game is meant for 2-4 players (I suggest 4 even if 3 are bots), 1 player is the hero while the other 3 are ghosts who can become monsters to try to kill the hero and take his place. It adds a unique feel to this game. 
-Multiplayer Mayhem: This game really is meant to be played by 4 people (even if can be played by 1), with 4 people this game becomes an all out brawl to become the hero and beat the boss to clear the game. It is an unforgettable experience to gather some friends and just play this game.
Crawl is an amazing game and the devs should be really proud of themselves. I can tell that they put a lot of hard work and energy into making this game the best it can be. I really hope to see more content added to Crawl to make it an even better experience.

16240003.review: I love this game, it has a really smooth feel to it, and the balance bewteen monster and human are perfect. It creates some really fun tims with friends even if it's not online multiplayer, and has unlimited replay-ability. But now for my recomendations to the developers. I beilive 3 things are needed to make this game even better than it already is, the first is just simply more enemies, bosses, and items, however I know that those are all in development already anyway. The second is online multiplayer, but that is a very time-consuming feature and maybe not worth it in the long-run. The third is a new team mode, where there is 2 humans at once, both of them with weakend health, and sharing gold though. And of course 2 monsters, both on the same team. So that when you kill one of the humans the other one also dies and swtiches to the monster, and both monsters become humans. This would make a really fun addition to the game, with the enjoyment of fighting against even AI with your freind on your team. And I think this should seriously be condisidered to add an awesome new element to an already amazing game.

16023614.review: When I saw the trailer for this game, admittedly it made me weak and sent a shiver down my spine. The idea and setting of the game is utterly marvelous. Not only creeping through a dungeon with your friends trying to cause your downfall, but with care, they can take that delicious chance of freedom from you is so very entertaining. I personally love the art style, it's suitable and really helps set the theme for this dark dungeon crawl. The controls are simple, yet very satisfying, every strike with a blade and every dodge to spare your life is as satisfying as any. Not to mention the monsters you encounter, some you love and some you hate, but that makes you fight so much harder just to make sure you do not see your grinning friend shout in success as he steals your humanity. Though many people have complained about an online functionality, I understand however am not too upset by it. If there is not going to be an online function however, I would like to see some improvements to the AI. Often I've found the AI to act in peculiar ways, like they're on a cycle, letting another AI or player get away with things completely at certain times and it's tremendously obvious when they do so. I'd like to see the AI be a little more dynamic and not quite so inclined to help each other, it is a desperate fight for freedom after all. Aside from that however, so far into the Early Access I am loving the game, and hope many more do. Absolutely  worth the price, and the fun to be had.

Crawl is an enormously entertaining game.  The interesting mix of so many elements is immensely entertaining.  Crawl is a retro themed, but modern take of a dungeon crawling mix of assymetrical multiplayer with co-op and campaign elements among many other great elements.  This game is the perfect combination of game elements that just becomes... well, perfection.  I started gaming years ago and have played games of practicaly any kind, but this game is somewhere in my top 3 favorite games of all time!  It is perfection!

     Now, time to address negative reviews.  All negative reviews of this game either complain about the lack of online multiplayer or lack of content in the Early Access version at the time they typed up the review. It is full of content and exciting gameplay and there are still updates to come because this amazing game is still in Early Access.  Online play has not yet been implemented so it can be hard to find the full 4 player game it was meant for, however, at the time of me typing this review I have a 19 hours of gameplay. MAN, where do I start. Ok first of if you enjoy classic 8 bit style games or their modern counterparts such as Terraria, Risk Of Rain, Super Meat Boy, Shovel Knight, then I would take good hard look at Crawl.

What's so fun about it? For one it has a very fitting, nostalgic, well made soundtrack. You're given many controller options and the controls them selves are very simple and In addition, are very responsive. They don't feel goofy or sloppy. *UNLESS* you choose to use the mouse as your controller, I wouldn't recommend it.

The level design is randomized, you will never play a game and feel like you've been on a particular level before, it just doesn't get old. The scenery always seems fresh.

The game is stable I've played around 37 hours so far and bugs as well as crashes are rare. It's most likely not a game you're going to be frustrated by because it crashes every 20 minuets.

The AI is actually very enjoyable to play with, it's surprising how clever they can be at times which provides a highly entertaining experience. With few bugs to mention besides occasionally getting trapped it's a great addition which allows you to play offline any time.

I could go on about the large selection of weapons, unique items, buffs, monsters, mini bosses, bosses, statues, traps. But that would take a long ass time.  To keep this short, In the end, for $10 this game is dripping with content, and quality, and fun times.

The only thing that I'd warn of, is that the game isn't online multiplayer, only local multiplayer (as in) you plug in 4 controllers to one computer and you can play with 4 friends like a console.

Online would be a great addition but it's not currently avalible.

15297055.review:
Crawl is a beautiful combination of teamwork, skill, and luck.

In Crawl, your job is to venture through various rooms, where you try to find monsters, which are spawned by other players. Upon slaying these monsters, you gain experience points, which you can use to fight the boss after you have collected enough.

If your friend (a monster) kills you, you swap places, meaning you spawn the monsters, and they fight them. When you kill the adventurer, you gain "hero blood" which you can trade for gold to spend at a shop, spending it on weapons, allies, and abilities.

When you eventually fight the boss, the game doesn't stop being multiplayer. Oh, no. The non-adventurers must actually possess parts of the massive boss and work together to defeat the adventurer. If the adventurer kills the boss, he/she wins. If the boss "kills" (you teleport back aways) the adventurer 3 times, the game is over.

When a game is over, you can unlock new monsters which players can transform their previous monsters into. You also unlock new abilities for monsters and adventurers, etcetera.

Overall, I think that Crawl is a masterpiece. The pixel-art blends very well with the shifts in scene, the soudtrack is amazing, and the gameplay itself is one-of-a-kind.

I rate this game 10/10, and it's still in development. I highly suggest you buy this game if you're even remotely interested.

15055707.review:
[h1]A superb, fun party game with great animation and a rad soundtrack.[/h1]

Multiplayer Crawl is amazing fun. You can play it against bots and they work great but multiplayer is really where it's at. It feels like arcade games used to back in the golden age of arcade games.

It makes a great party game, but take note that the multiplayer is local only and you will need joypads. 
One player can use the keyboard but you can't aim precisely using it. You can use this to handicap a player if they're winning too often though, or turn off precise aiming for everyone if you like. You can even use a mouse as a controller if you're desperate.

Powerhoof have also added a 'taunt your god' option, which you can use to handicap individual players in a variety of ways, fixing the one gripe I did have about the game.

One player at a time has human form and all the other players are ghosts that gang up and try to kill them with monsters and traps. Get the killing blow on the human player and you take human form instead! The human player advances through the dungeon to attempt to kill the boss and win.

The animations are superb, the music is great, the controls are tight and responsive and the combat is smooth and impactful. There are a ton of weapons, items, potions, abilities, dungeon features and monsters, some of which get unlocked as you play more.

Also the trailers are great, and the early access trailer gives a nice overview of the game if you're about to start up a game with new players.

14914342.review:
I believe this is one of the most solid asymmetric PvP games I've played. At the current moment there isn't a huge amount of content, but the devs do add fairly meaty updates every few weeks. That being said, the mechanics of the game are solid, the way gaining and losing possession of the hero works is an example of good balance mechanisms. It's like a negative feedback loop where the longer you stay as either ghost or hero, the easier it is to kill the hero and be killed respectively.

And man does it have style. The music, the ever-present (aesthetic only) glitchiness, it actually makes me feel nostalgic. You can tell what the devs were going for and I think they nailed it. Some people see pixelated art as an excuse for spending less time animating, but the pixel art in this game is made by someone who obviously takes the style seriously, because it actually has a very distinct character and the animations are deceptively smooth for the resolution.

As Jason Voorhees to my top left says: I love it.

Seemingly simple, yet comactly complex in this 300 MB Rogue-like Dungeon Crawler as it's been said. I've only gone against AI bots for the moment, but playing four players is utter madness. It's like a timeless childhood game that needed to be around before Gauntlet. That game was still great at the time, but I can imagine the bundles of joy and frustration this game would have, and will have in the near future

Feels great to control your hero and demons alike, the pixelated art-style vaguely reminds me of Hyper Light Drifter, music and sound design are top-notch, and the game itself feels rewarding to play and beat.

MUST HAVE!

Uno de los mejores juegos dentro de su género, que además incorpora un gameplay muy interesante donde tus amigos controlan a los monstruos (intentaran matarte para convertirse en el héroe y derrotar al jefe final!)

Si has estado mirándolo y aun no te has decidido, cómpralo que no te arrepentirás!

Es un ejemplo de lo que deberían de ser los Early Access, no he encontrado un solo bug, hasta ahora el juego está bien balanceado (héroe vs enemigos), el control con mando es perfecto y el juego va muy fluido.

Recomiendo jugarlo con mando.

Si tuviese que sacarle un “defecto” diría que estaría bien poder jugar también online para no tener que traerte a todos tus amigos a casa cada vez que quieras jugar, aun así la inteligencia artificial está muy bien programada y más de una vez te pondrá en apuros.

En conclusión un juegazo que te mantiene en tensión durante toda la partida, tenéis que experimentar lo que es estar huyendo del enemigo cuando te queda un 5% de vida y encima estás envenenado y te vas desangrando por la sala… (El enemigo son 3 demonios enormes evolucionados al máximo...) ^^

Nota: 10

14742757.review:
[h1]Crawl: Historia pixelowej gry,która podbiła serce moje jak i wasze![/h1]

[b]Crawl to przepiękna pixelkowa gra z odrobiną stylu Rogule-like,w której wcielamy się w jednego z 4 towarzyszy,którzy pragnący sławy jak i bogactwa starych opustoszałych lochów,odwaźyli się tak wejść. Jednak szybko okazuję się,że 3 pozostałych naszych towarzyszy(bądź my) zostali/śmy zkazani na klątwe,i zmieniamy(bądź nasi towarzysze) w duchy,które mają za zadanie nas nie dopuścić do pełnych skarbów jak i niebezpieczeństwa jakie nas czycha w tych okropnych lochach.[/b]

Jako,że jakimś cudem zostaliśmy wciąź istotą żywą(człowiekiem),a pozostali towarzysze są martwi,musimy jak najszybciej przemierzać setki LOSOWO generowane lochy, w których musimy zabijać naszych towarzyszy,którzy przy użyciu Pentagramów,zmieniają się w róźne potwory,musimy pamiętać,aby nie dać się zabić,ponieważ każdy "Członek" naszego Team'u,który był potworem a nas zabije zmienia się znowu w człowieka i tak dalej.W ciąż mówiły o człowieku,więc jako człowiem musimy zdobyć 10 poziom(przez zabijanie naszych towarzyszy),i jak mamy troche pieniędzy(Przez otwieranie skrzynek,albo za krew ludzką(Tylko Potwory) ) możemy udać się do sklepu w którym możemy kupić od jakiś czarów do miktur,lub od mieczy do wielkich maczug,bądź od Łuków do potężnych Kusz,i tak to się odbywa jako Człowiek.

Iź istnieje wielkie prawdopodobieństwo,że będziemy duchami,i właśnie zostaliśmy wybrani,mamy za zadanie razem z innymi towarzyszami(2-ma kolegami) nie dopuścić,aby Człowiek awansował na 10 poziom i nie dostał się do końcowego Boss'a,jako Duch możemy stepać,na Pentagramy,które zmienią nas w różne potwory,jeśli zginiemy jako potwór,zmieniamy się znowu w ducha,jeśli nasi towarzysze są ciągle potworami i walczą z człowiekiem,to nie znaczy,że nie mamy nic już do robienia! Musimy pomagać naszym towarzyszą,na mapie pojawiają się róźne pułapki,które możemy opentać i sterować nimi,jeśli nie ma pułapek to nic nie szkodzi! na mapie pojawiają się "Ektoplazmy" musimy uzbierać daną ilość i możemy respić "psełdo" potwory,takie jak Slime'y,które możemy opętać,bądź A.I będzie nimi sterować. Za każde walnięcie(jakiekolwiek,czy z pułapki,czy z potwora)dostajemy krew,dzięki uzbieranie danej ilości jak zostaniemy człowiekiem,możemy wymienić na złoto.Po każdej rundzie(Jak człowiek zajdzie piętro niżej schodami) możemy "ulepszać nasze stworki" Przykładowo,Szkieleta na Szkieleta Łucznika ---> w Ogniowego Szkielete Łucznika i tak Dalej. I tak musimy grać Duchami.

[h1]PLUSY GRY[/h1]

+Piękna pixelkowa Grafika
[u]+Niska Cena[/u]
+Ciągłe Update'y
+Nawet jak na "Early Access" gra ma w sobie dużo przedmiotów,postaci,potworów etc.

+Można grać z A.I
+Nigdy się nie nudzi!
+Piękne Sountrack'i

+Pełno Potworów którymi możemy grać

[h1]WADY GRY[/h1]

[u]-Chwilowo,tylko Lokalna Kooperacja[/u]
-A.I Strasznie męczy z IQ....
-Można czasami napotkać pare bugów...(jak w każdej grze)
-Ciągle "Early Access",więc jak się boisz,bugów to nie kupuj

[b][u]Podsumowanie![/u][/b]
Grafika 10/10!
Effekty Specjalne/Dźwięki 10/10!!
Grywalność 9/10
Lokalna Kooperacja 9.5/10!
Zaciesz 10/10!!!

[spoiler]Mam nadzieje,że o niczym nie zapomniałem i,że zachęciłem was tą recenzją,bardzo dziękuję,za przeczytanie!, Have fun! YOPG! Bye![/spoiler]

14672464.review:
[h1]Crawl - Alle gegen Einen und Einer gegen Alle[/h1]

[b]Überblick[/b]

Was machen eigentlich Australier, wenn ihnen langweilig ist? Neben Känguruhs umschubsen, entwickelt man einfach mal einen der besten Multiplayer-Titel der vergangenen Monate.
Alles an diesem Spiel schreit Multiplayer und das ist auch das Herzstück des Spiels. Aber zunächst mal ein intensiver Blick auf das Spielprinzip.

[b]Gameplay[/b]

Hier sind wir beim Herzstück des Spiels. Selten habe ich ein derart genial und einfallsreich ausbalanciertes asymmetrisches Spielprinzip erlebt, wie in Crawl. Zu Beginn eines Durchlaufs wird per Zufall entschieden, welcher der bis zu 4 menschlichen Spieler als Held startet und welche als Geister. Die Geister fliegen nun, ganz ihrer Eigenschaft entsprechend, durch die Gegend und sammeln Ektoplasma ein. Dafür dürfen sie dann Blobs spawnen. Um dem Helden wirklich zu traktieren, bedarf es aber ganz anderer Geschütze. In vielen Räumen des Levels befinden sich Pentagramme auf dem Boden. Über diese können nun die bisher immateriell herum schwebenden Geister in Form eines der drei, anfangs gewählten Monster erscheinen. 
Auch dies ist mehr oder weniger dem Zufall überlassen und kann mit unter schwer zum Nachteil des armen Tropfs, der gerade den Helden spielt, ausfallen. Sobald ein Monster, oder ein Blob, im Raum erschienen ist, wird dieser versiegelt und kann nur wieder verlassen werden, wenn der Held alle Monster erledigt hat. Für die übliche Abenteuertätigkeit, Monster erlegen, erhält dieser auch die üblichen Erfahrungspunkte. Soweit so normal, aber jetzt kommt bereits eine Besonderheit des Spiels zum Tragen: Die Monster erhalten für den Schaden, den sie dem Helden zufügen, bevor sie das Zeitliche segnen, „Blut“ gutgeschrieben. Je mehr Schaden, desto mehr Blut. Sollte eines der Monster es schaffen den Helden tatsächlich zu erledigen, so wird der steuernde Spieler umgehend in die Rolle des Helden versetzt. Jetzt gilt es sich zu beeilen und die gesammelten Blutpunkte im Itemshop bei einer Art „Buddha“-Statue gegen Geld einzutauschen. Auch hier gilt natürlich: Je mehr Blut, desto mehr Geld. Das Bare kann dann gegen verschiedene Gegenstände, Waffen und Spezialattacken eingetauscht werden. Bereits im Early Access ist die Auswahl immens.

[b]It is not even my final FOOORM. Der Endgegner[/b]

Die Helden steigen durch das Besiegen der Monster nach und nach in den Stufen auf und werden stärker. Ab Stufe 10 kann der Held, sofern er sich stark genug wähnt, über den Portalraum zum Bossgegner teleportieren und diesen herausfordern. Auch hier gibt es wieder eine Besonderheit: Anders als bisher, spielt nicht jeder der Geister sein eigenes Monster, sondern alle drei steuern den Bossgegner zusammen. Momentan gibt es hiervon leider nur zwei, aber die haben es in sich. Als Beispiel soll hier mal das „Ding“ aus dem Sumpf mit dem illustren Namen Kourok dienen. Dieser ist zwar bewegungsunfähig, sitzt aber schön gemütlich in seiner Sumpfpfütze und ist nicht auf normale Art vom Spieler zu erreichen. Gesteuert werden bei ihm die beiden äußeren Tentakel, wobei eines eine Art Schleim verschießt, der Schaden macht und das andere eine Blase, die den Helden gefangen hält und fast bewegungsunfähig macht, sowie der einäugige Kopf, der einen vernichtenden, aber recht schwer zu zielenden Strahl verschießt.
Das Herausfordern des finalen Bosses geht dabei insgesamt und für alle Spieler geltend bis zu drei Mal. Fordert ein Spieler den Gegner zum letzten Mal heraus, bedeutet das, dass der Durchlauf beendet ist, egal wie nun der finale Kampf ausgeht. Besiegt der menschliche Held den Gegner so entflieht er dem Dungeon und geht als Sieger hervor. Verliert er beim letzten Mal, so geht er als Verlierer aus dem Durchlauf hervor, während bei den anderen ein Ranking abhängig von den Erfahrungspunkten stattfindet.

[b]Monsterevolution, Darwin mal anders[/b]

Entscheidet sich ein Spieler ein Level zu beenden, indem er hinabsteigt, erscheint ein Bildschirm, bei dem sogenannte Vitae verteilt wird. Diese hängt etwas undurchsichtig mit den Stufen der Helden zusammen, die im Level erreicht wurden. Benutzt wird sie dann, und hier kommt der interessante Part, um die drei Monster in einer Art Evolutionsbaum weiterzuentwickeln. So wird aus dem bisher schwachen Skelettkrieger ein Bogenschütze, aus dem kleinen Auge, dass blaues Feuer verschießt am Ende gar ein „Beholder“. Der Baum hat hierbei ein um das andere Mal Abzweigungen, die verschieden Monster hervorbringen. Das Ende der Evolution sieht momentan, bis auf bei einem mit Patch 0.4 nachgelieferten Monster, allerdings immer gleich aus. Die Motivation es zu erreichen, schmälert das nicht im geringsten. 
Die Stärke des Spiels liegt also ganz klar beim Multiplayer, denn es geht doch nichts darüber seinem Mitspieler kurz bevor er schwer geschwächt den Raum verlässt, noch einen Blob vor die Nase zu setzen und ihn am Besten noch damit zu erledigen. Der Multiplayermodus ist momentan nur lokal an einem PC möglich, aber das soll sich in Zukunft auch ändern. Eigentlich macht das aber nichts, denn so ein Couchcoop ist auch mal wieder eine erfrischende Erfahrung.

[b]Die Steuerung[/b]

Die ist simpel und serh gut gelungen und lässt sich nahezu mit allen möglichen Eingabegeräten verwenden. Tastatur, Maus und Gamepad habe ich angetestet udn alles lies sich vernünftig bis sehr gut steuern. Die Maus hat leichte Vorteile.

[b]Grafik und Atmosphäre[/b]

Es wurden wunderbar die Effekte und die Optik alter Arcade Klassiker eingefangen. Die reinen Brauntöne stören damit nach einer Weile auch überhaupt nicht mehr und gerade die Sounds lassen einen das Gefühl haben mitten in einer Arcade Hlle zu sein. Passend dazu kann man das Spiel auch auf Arcadeautomaten abstimmen.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yUJ991RzdBs

14569864.review:
This is hands down one of the best local multiplayer games on PC, I don't think my words can really do it justice, in the sense that I'm not all that amazing at writing... but hey? Why not try?

So, here's how it goes, you like to have your friends over and play games, you recently purchased an extra controller to play another awesome local multiplayer game, but its quickly becoming boring and you need some variety. (In my case this game was castle crashers.) So, I went on game jolt and saw a banner advertising this game, I decided to buy it.

Crawl is a great game in many regards, a fun art style, polished gameplay, surprisingly bug free for an early access game, and constantly changing how you play. A typical round of crawl will go like this, you pick a deity to worship. (This will determine what monsters you get and will give you bonuses as well, ex: shop discounts or extra monster health) And you and you friend(s) spawn in. One of you will be the hero, the others will be the ghosts. The goal of the hero is to kill the other players when they become monsters on pentagrams and get XP to fight a boss when the player reaches level 10. The ghost's goal will be to kill the hero using an assortment of monsters, traps, and cunning. When the ghost kills the hero the ghost takes the hero's place. But, that may be hard as it goes for being a pixelated monster with 3 hit points. So, usually how it goes in my experience is the hero stays the hero for the first dungeon. Anyways at the end of the floor, the monsters will get upgrade points for their monsters depending on how much the hero leveled up. (Monsters also get blood when damaging the player, this will be important later.) So, the next round starts with the ghosts having new, upgraded monsters, and the hero still hasn't gotten enough gold to buy any new items from the shop. The monsters steamroll the player and thus a new hero in born. The new hero can then go to the shop to buy upgrades, weapons, and abilities, by exchanging the blood he/she got for hurting the hero for gold. Crawl Goes like this until one of the heroes has reached level 10, and can challenge one of the two bosses currently in the game, although I'll save those for a surprise, then the round is over. But at the end of each round new weapons, traps, shrines, monsters, and deities are unlocked to keep the gameplay fresh between rounds.

So all in all: Do I reccomend crawl?
YES

The pixel art, gameplay, monsters, spells, and updates keep the gameplay exciting and every couple of months or so the devs' release a HUGE update with new bosses, evolutions, traps, balances, and weapons. Crawl is by far my favourite local game to play with friends, and this review is coming from a guy who has never even played a dungeon crawler before! Buy Crawl now, you won't be sorry. Trust me

14551499.review: Crawl is quite obviously a game made by people who love games. Everything about it is well done. The humor, the animation, the music, the smooth controls, the fun little upgrades, the epic explosions of gore! It's a refreshingly original experience, best played with a couch full of friends and a controller to clench in your sweaty hands. Can't wait for more content. Keep it up Powerhoof!

14539851.review: Захотел я значит поиграть во что-то со стареньким духом в старых добрых пикселях, но все с чем-то более новым нежели всякие стрит файторы где от смысла и стиля лишь прыжок и удар, и наткнулся я дескать на это чудо игру Crawl, откровенно говоря пока играл один не совсем понял что и как, НО попробовав поиграть с друзьями(кстати один игрок даже может играть на мышки, и в этой игре это скорее преимущество нежели наказания гостей Авось я за клавой я хозяин дома, поостерегитесь на мышку игра очень хорошо адаптирована) мы по истене ощутили дух старых приставочных игр, то что в наше время давно угасло это дух соперничества, здесь смысл какой 1 игрок герой а остальные игроки монстры, соответственно убил героя получил его оболочку, убил монстра апнул уровень,(кстати если герой поднимает уровень остальные игроки получают очки монстра и могут прокачивать своих монстров) по истене не видел я больше такой игры и тебе экшен, и рпг, и самый захватывающий дух соперничества, если любите принимать гостей эта игра станет великолепным дополнением, а пожалуй главная ее прелесть это простота освоения, моя супруга играет лишь арканойды(и шарики по цветам собирает) но приложив усилий заставил ее попробовать и сие чудо, и я не поверил как она на получасе игры уже умудрялась открывать нечто неведанное мне, в общем эта игра даже на данной стадии разработки стоит Каждого потраченного рубля, рекомендую данную игру людям которые могут позволить себе поиграть в несколько человек на одном пк, для одного игрока данная игра не интересна, но это лишь мое мнение покупать или нет решать вам

Bom, comprei Crawl quando ele ainda estava no começo de tudo, quando não haviam mais de 4 deuses, e quando o jogo estava dando seus primeiros passos. Os motivos pelo qual eu comprei esse jogo foram dois: O trailer fantástico que me atraiu mais do que deveria e a ideia de poder jogar um Co-op competitivo completamente inovador (a pixel art perfeita foi um ponto também que me atraiu).
Quando o jogo lançou e eu o joguei pela primeira vez (com 3 amigos), ele foi tudo que eu esperava que seria para um jogo em Early Acess, ainda faltavam coisas, mas poxa, ele estava jogável do jeito que eu esperava! Estava super divertido e tinha bastante fator de replayability, jogamos umas 10 partidas naquele dia. Depois de um tempo ele foi enjoando cada vez mais, e por fim, deixamos ele de molho por uns 2 meses.

Passado esses dois meses eu me lembrei "poxa, e o Crawl? Nunca mais jogamos!", então eu chamei meu irmão e a namorada para jogar um pouco mais, e CACETA, o jogo tinha mudado completamente! Haviam muito mais Gods, tinha um novo Boss, mais coisas para desbloquear, que que é isso???

Deixe-me ir diretamente ao ponto que eu quero chegar. A empresa que está fazendo Crawl, não fez simplesmente um bom jogo, ela está fazendo o que todos esses jogos em "Early Acess" devem fazer, ou seja, CONTINUAR TRABALHANDO NO JOGO. Possuo uns 10 jogos em Early Acess na Steam que lançam atualizações quase que imperceptiveis e demoradas, enquanto Crawl está melhorando cada vez mais!

Tl;dr: O jogo está ótimo e a empresa dele é super esforçada, estão lançando cada vez mais atualizações e o jogo é super divertido, recomendo 10/10 comprarem ele! (Eu senti que ele é um pouco enjoativo depois de jogar VÁRIAS horas, porém, com a quantidade de "unlockables" ele acaba tendo um fator de Replayability muito bom!)

14517615.review:
非常的好玩，才玩了一会就被深深的吸引了

首先，游戏的玩法绝对是一大亮点，虽然没仔细看玩法介绍，但大概是这样：玩家控制一个类似亡灵的东西，然后”寄生“在勇士的体内，在地下城内，与其他亡灵展开战斗（人数2-4人，可以是AI或者小伙伴，联机玩一定非常有趣，建议和基友一起入），其他亡灵可以通过魔法阵召唤出实体的怪物攻击勇者，当控制勇者被击杀时，击杀勇者的亡灵会操控勇者（抢人头很爽哈），之前的亡灵会被挤出去，要再次夺取回身体，就是这样不断争取勇者的操控权，每下一层玩家还可以升级自己召唤的怪物，在每层的商店勇者可以买武器道具（虽然目前比较少，毕竟是早期测试）当勇者达到10级的时候就可以挑战boss，有不同种类的boss，进入boss房后其他亡灵将会控制boss（比如说头或手等部位，可以供多个亡灵寄生不同的部位），如果勇者击杀boss则算胜利，被杀死则会重新回到地下城，继续游戏。

大概就是这个玩法，虽然说内容比较少，但以后会慢慢增加，是个很容易上瘾的游戏

+复古像素画风（个人偏好）
+容易上手，不懂英文摸索一下就知道大致玩法了
+独特的操作控制，感觉顺手
+联机乐趣
+合适的价格
+++游戏新颖的玩法，绝对眼前一亮
-容易上瘾
-虽然容易上瘾，但就目前来说不太耐玩
-玩法单一
-内容较少（以后会增加）
？BGM（说实话我没注意听，有BGM么O__O "…）
-游戏的平衡性，似乎有些不太好，有一些运气成分，到10级就可以挑战boss，说实话这里应该增加一些内容，胜利应该更难一些，增加一些策略性就更好了，而不是简单的抢人头然后去打boss（boss感觉不是很厉害）

总体来说，在早期测试期间这款游戏还是令人满意的，非常推荐
画面：8/10
游戏性：9/10
耐玩性：6/10
BGM:?/?
上手程度：8/10
总评分：8/10

14451282.review: Crawl is a game in which a group of 2-4 players are thrown into a dungeon, all of them have the same goal: "Beat a Final Boss to Escape the dungeon". The problem is that only one of those players gets to escape the dungeon by defeating one of the final bosses. At the beginning of a game, one of the players is randomly selected to be the "Human", the final bosses can only be defeated by a human. The other players are then selected to be "Ghosts", the ghosts can posess summoning circles to bring fourth all kinds of controllable monsters to attack the human with, ghosts are also able to spawn controllable slimes, control one of the final bosses parts, and control different traps and statues. When a ghost kills a human, that ghost then immidiatley swaps places with the human, which makes the last human a ghost, and the ghost that landed the killshot on the human becomes a human itself. This game is best played with a group of good friends, trust me, it makes the desperate struggle for victory ALL the more satisfying.

14425315.review:
Crawl is a fun and unique local multiplayer experience.  In short, it's a king-of-the-hill style dungeon crawler, with players constantly swapping roles as either the plucky hero or one of the three ghosts attempting to take them down.  The way that the ghosts team up against the human is best described as "formalized trolling."

The asymmetry of play helps to keep the game fresh, as well as make differences in skill less pivotal in one's ability to enjoy the game.  While the graphics are blocky (unsurprising coming from a two-person team), the animations are superb.

14311823.review:
Crawl: Antagonistic Cooperation

	If you’ve never heard of Crawl, stop what you’re doing and run, don’t walk, to youtube and watch the trailer. It is the best trailer for any video game I have ever seen. Don’t worry I’ll wait.

No seriously, watch it.

If you have no idea what kind of a game Crawl is, let me tell you…

Crawl is a four player local co-op dungeon crawler. One player is the Human and the other three are the Monsters. Simple concept. Amazing execution.

You might be thinking, “One guy is the Human? Sucks for the other three!” Not really.

I’ve had the game since Early Access release (August, 6th 2014), and in that time I’ve learned this game is fun by yourself, but it shines when you have four living breathing people to play together. It is a lot like Super Smash Bros: great by yourself, but best with friends. And it’s completely possible to have a wonderful time never even playing as the Human. The Monsters are that interesting and fun.

As the trailer showed (seriously you should watch it), when a monster kills the Human their ‘Humanity’ is transferred to the killer. Just like how gold is awarded in DOTA, rage upon last hit stealing is also included, which ensures everyone is going to be the Human at least once per playthrough. And as the Human player(s) level up, everyone else gains ‘Vitae’ which is used to level up your Monsters, ensuring there is always a challenge. 

In some cases, Human players will take an early lead and level up too quickly, causing the Monsters to scale up faster than the player can cope. Meaning at level 10, Humans might have a similar experience to a player at level 1 (they can still get their teeth kicked in with relative ease). There have been many cases in which I’ve skyrocketed to level 6 or 7 and suddenly I’m fighting all 2nd tier Monsters with starting gear. This usually ends how you would expect; weeping in the fetal position. 

The only way to actually gain gold is to draw blood as a monster. Mechanically speaking, that means damaging and/or killing the Human. This creates a desire to play as both the Human and the Monsters. The only way to improve your Human is, ironically, to hurt and kill other Humans. Many times I have thought “I wish I had blood” whilst doing my best to prevent the others from taking my Humanity. In my experience, you almost always feel like you’re about to die when playing as the Human. And when playing as the Monsters, you’re working with your friends one minute and then actively working against them the next. The fluid nature of the cooperation in this game is amazing. There is nothing else like it.

The main goal of the game is for the Human player to reach level 10 as quickly as possible, find the Eldritch Stones, and challenge the boss. If they win, they win! If they lose? They have to continue further into the dungeon with about 1/10th of their HP. After a total of three loses, the current Human loses the game. They’re ‘CONSUMED FOREVER,’ and the game deletes their account.

Dark Souls would be proud.

There is never a dull moment when playing Crawl. Whether you’re the Monsters or the Human, there is always pressure. If you wait too long, the Spirits will collect ectoplasm and summon blobs on you. There’s nothing worse than fighting tooth and nail to get through a room only to have all of your buddies summon nine blobs to finish you off.  

Trying to fight three other players who are working together to kill you but against each other to kill you first… is very hectic. And with so much happening on screen, it can be difficult to keep track of who and where you are. For the most part, it isn’t too hard to parse your position. It’s definitely harder to find yourself after you’ve lost track than it is to lose track in the first place. Perhaps something like an aura with your color could be added? 

Losing yourself aside, Crawl has an incredible lo-fi feel, while still letting you know it’s a modern game. The sprites are evocative of older games, yet they still feel fresh, new, and lively. The animation is fluid. The colors are deep and have good contrast (Thanks to the v0.3 Plague Mushroom update, released 1/15/15). Seriously, this is some of the best pixel art I’ve experienced. 

Also the music is superb. That’s all I really have to say. It’s great.

Overall, Crawl is an exceptional game with great gameplay, amazing art, and outstanding music. It’s simply dripping with flavor. Powerhoof managed to cram so much style into a “simple” game. It is refreshing, fun, and one of the best $10 games I’ve ever had the privilege of purchasing. 

Buy it and play it with all of your friends.

The dudes over at Powerhoof are going places. They have created such a great game and deserve more recognition.

And, seriously, that trailer was amazing.

Like this review? Check out http://100hoursave.wordpress.com/
